column169:
Caroline, Mark, Matt, Andrew & Grace all met with Clay to go over our questions on his businesses. He opened the call by saying he was very close to cancelling because he really didn't have time for it with how the markets doing.........

The good news is we don't need to do any extra accounting (as of now) - below is a breakdown of the different LLCs - 

• Clay Cornette life enterprises – houses his rentals, he said he has 2024 accounting done and he’ll send us the docs
• For honor – personal fund, not conducting business itself, it’ll get 1099s for stock portfolios, a piece of real estate sold out of it (Hoy Lake) in 2025 (will be sch D)
• Lira consulting LLC – carolayne's cleaning, nothing in 2024

Clay is going to send us the prior accountants contact info so we can get the rental financials because he says they've already been done for 2024. I looked at the zip file he sent and the rental folder just had bank statements, so we'll need to reach out to them. the rentals are also a 2025 book keeping prospect because he said it hasnt been done at all for 2025.

I also requested a POA for both him and carolayne so that we can eliminate some of the back and forth with doc requests with them.

He's also still concerned about all of the crypto gains and wanting to find a way to offset them. there's not really a magic fix for this but i told him that Dat and I are brainstorming on it and we can regroup with some ideas after the 2024 tax returns are done

Next Steps:
- POA is requested and instructions are STC
- I followed up with Carolanye since she didnt show up to the meeting she scheduled for herself
- waiting on accountant info to get 2024 rental financials
- accounting to review the zip file he sent and let tax know if theres anything of concern/note
- accounting to set up a time to meet with clay to get third party access to his accounts
column173: assuming that the rental financials are actually done, then we dont need any proposal adjustments. but TBD on that.

column105: Met with Connor last Wednesday and I think we need to do a level set meeting with Connor and Mitch for pricing on 3PM and 3PI, One of the JV starting a management/consulting company which might include monthly meetings separate to discuss their branch, Mitch is considering AVL still but it would be more involvement of esop, cap tables, etc. Also, it is on hold for now but Connor has a friend that wants to setup a home day care center and to see if we have a pamphlet of some sort to send to Connor so they know what the 850 includes. The 850 is without discount.

Connor canceled yesterday's meeting due to the payroll deadline but will be meeting on the Monthly call 9/10/25. He called me about about one of his JV's wanting to set up a management company  that would be pretty much be the point of contact with us on meetings, discussions on the branch, and to help with the operations so he was wondering what steps and items they would need to get everything running etc. 

Also, Connor has a friend but is holding off but they are planning on setting up a home day care center and was wondering the price. I pinged Caroline and the price would be around 850 without discounts. Weekly calls have been running smoothly and accruals are now all setup and financials are accurate per branch. We still need to clean up DJ's branch so waiting on Connor with this branch since he wanted to hold a little bit and revisit pretty soon. 

Need to look into how to go about his account with IL and what he needs to do this set this up since he doesn't have an account.

Had a call with Damion for Cannalean, mainly about their process work flow regarding production.  So from what I understood, they order material for the syrup substance which goes to Chris and then he creates.  Once that is completed, they send the syrup substances to Space Station which does the manufacturing and testing for the completed products.  After finalizing, Space Station then ships the final product to Nabis where it stores and records the inventory of their SKUs and is distributed from there.  There doesn't seem to be any formalized tracking in the raw material phase which think needs to be ironed out.  He also mentioned the distillate which typically they order at the tail end of the production process given it's short shelf life.

Going to provide Damion a sheet of transactions in order to get additonal information regarding which are related to what point in the process.  Also getting clarification on large number of withdrawals out of checking account that he states has to do with the need for cash transactions when purchasing most of the associated raw materials

Did a comprehensive discovery with the team and found a bunch of issues (see respective work item notes). 

From a tax standpoint, he had an SCorp but paid $40k in SE tax.  Lots of issues but talked to Caroline and if we just look at the 2022 and 2023 amendments in a vacuum to just move Schedule C to SCorp and get back the SE tax, it'd take about 5-6 hours. 

For Accounting, there seems to be a ton wrong which could impact the tax number favorably or unfavorably.  I requested statements but he said there is some drama in trying to get that so might be a heavier lift than we think. 

He said 2022 might be tough because it was a lot of paper documents dropped off to the tax lady.  I'm thinking we fix 2023 and 2024 from an accounting standpoint the best we can to essentially clean up the books and get compliant but I'd rather focus on getting him set up for 2025 vs trying to make previous years perfect cause we're already saving him $40k in taxes.
column109:

b. 1040 2023 - $250
c. IRS Assistance - $0

column105:
Mark, Caroline, and Ross met with Ryan to go over the results of his SpaceX tender offer. He got 339k of proceeds for some of the previously exercised ISO's. his AMT credit covers the majority of the tax due and he's only going to owe $10,355 (all NIIT) on the LTCG.

We went over that from a tax stand point and I sent him an estimate voucher along with the excel calc & he's going to pay the full 10,355 now to avoid interest/penalties. 

He is also ready to submit 2024 taxes - he just needs to sign, I already re-sent him the draft and the docusign so that should get filed soon. He is going to make the payment on his own through the irs website (i attached instructions on it).

Looking ahead - he now has roughly 74k of AMT credit that he's still carrying over after this tender offer so the plan is to try to get those ISOs out and diversify with Ross. He explained to use that SpaceX makes the ISOs really appealing (they double/triple the amount if you go with ISOs instead of RSUs) so that's why he has a lot of them. He said the past few grants he's been asking for RSUs to try to avoid the tax mess. 

He's also trying to launch some sort of rocket the past few days and the weather has been getting in the way, they're trying again this afternoon. He said the next tender offer might be effected by whether or not the launch is successful sooooo im not sure what they're launching but good to know.

Caught up with Aly who ChatGPT'd his way to a Backdoor ROTH IRA.  Talked to him about the mechanics of that and how there are no tax advantages in the short term but more of a tax diversification tool.  Aly will make between $200k - $250k this year and Benita will make a little over $100k so I don't think they qualify for a traditional although Aly isn't currently contributing to a 401k.  

I talked to him about us doing it for him but he said he already has too many accounts between Canada / US so he'd rather keep the accounts where he has his bank account (Chase).  He also said he wanted to self manage the account and I said he'd be able to do that on Altruist.  All in all, didn't want to push and said I'd walk through how to open the Non Deductible IRA with Chase and then do the Roth Conversion.  We have until 4/15/2026 to contribute to it so we have some time.

Talked with Hunter.  Went through some feedback on the CRM for him.  He was meeting with the engineers afterwards and will discuss the items with him.

They have been making a big push to fix all the little bugs so appreciated the feedback, they are launching the CRM next week. Their whole time has been putting in crazy hours, so hes ready for the launch for things to slow down a little bit but needs to get out and sell as well. Said they had 25 advisors in the Beta. They have 2500 advisors using the pageport video software but because of compliance and agreements wont be able to cross sell them for a while until they can get on firms approved tech list.  They will be targeting all RIAs to start like Motta Wealth Management. 

The price point is going to be $150 a month. He gave us discount so it will only be a $100 a month for the first year, I said that would be great.  They wont start charging the monthly fee until October.  

He mentioned again that he would be looking to do his taxes with us.

Action Item:
Brian O- Can you update Hunter Romanos 2025 discovery request on the work item, to request tax years 2023 and 2024. Also send an email, introducing yourself and Caroline and let him know that you sent out the disocvery request, so we can have his infomation on file and make for smoother tax season.

Caught up with Tyler about this Tax Assessment.  Biggest question was his ROTH Conversion and ROTH 401k.  He said he was on purpose because everything he learned in school and based on his math, doing the ROTH now and creating a post tax pocket early will still net positive in the long term despite the 35% effective tax rate.  

He rolled $46k from his old Traditional 401k from Disney/ESPN to his ROTH 401k at E&Y and converted it to ROTH in the process.  He's going to owe roughly $20 - $25k in taxes as of now but he understands why.  

We talked through other strategies such as Maxing his Pre Tax 401k out (if that'll impact his tax rate a lot) and if the SALT limitations go up to $40k.  

He sent us all the paystubs for the year so think we can use the Tax Estimator tool on this one.  Might be a good project for Grace.
column109:
When we talked to him, we estimated his advisory fees to be $100 per quarter with quarterly (1 Hour) Tax Advisory meetings.  

I'd say we turn his recurring work item to "TAX | Advisory (1040) | Steil, Tyler | 2025" and that'll be a repeating work item.  

Not sure what we billed him for previously but let's do the $100 upon completion.  He won't need quarterly estimates but Dat to put a meeting on the books for October and then in April.  We'll bill him at that point.  

I'm pretty sure the 2025 return was part of the assessment but if not, we can include in the advisory plan.  He's an easy W2 so not a heavy lift plus he'll probably be a Financial Planning client as well. I'm sure he'd be the type to max out a backdoor ROTH every year.

column105:
D-Block called me briefly mostly to catch up and vent about Deloitte (which I somewhat expected because this is around the time they dish out raises, promotions, bonuses, etc.) because of the typical stuff we're commiserated about for years and we say every time that it won't change.  

He's done with his National Office rotation so doing client work right now and also hates the teams he works on and says he thinks he's done with Deloitte.  

He wasn't ready the last time we talked cause there was still some things he had to figure out with his wife/kids as they just moved into a new home but think he might be ready to make the jump.  

His wife called him so only got to catch up with him for like 20 minutes but he said he'd call me this week because if he does leave.. he's not doing another Deloitte busy season.

Caught up with Russ/Ross about the Tender Offer and a plan to move forward.  He didn't get as much as he'd like (only like 15% I think) but that means his tax bill will be lower (roughly $80k for this tender offer).  One thing to note is that the had another tender offer earlier in the year where he saw Cap Gains of ~$775k which we didn't factor into the plan (Not sure why they didn't bring this up earlier but okay).  ACTION ITEM: Let's refresh all of our numbers based on the first tender offer and as well as the items we discussed on the call (budgeting, salary, etc.).  

He started working again and had a heavy month in August but says that he anticipates to make $25k - $30k per month with his new job.  He also says he has a 50 mile commute each way to work which is tough but they are building whatever kind of government building he needs to work in closer to him which will help.  

Ross talked through financial planning with him and mostly on budgeting because they are living a very boujee life right now which Russ understands.  He had 3 open heart surgeries and left his old job so it was a "Treat Yourself" money. Especially after he just cashed out a million dollars of SpaceX stock.  

Ross is going to build a budget for him and we will use that as a base for salary.  He'll make $100k - $150k so we can estimate a salary based on the 60/40 rule on that front.  

Action items for us is to finalize a pricing sheet for Russ and get the proposal out to him.  Now that we are going to start all the services, I think we finally get him to sign.
column109:
N/A - Already billed for estimates... for $75.

Let's re-look at his pricing and come up with an Advisory Plan.  This was Pre-Ross and we're still setting up the partnership there but kind of an in between so let's talk Ross once we have the pricing to see how Ross wants to handle that.

column105:
Caught up with Eben after a few months.  He said he really enjoyed his conversations with Motta so far and that BU is still ass.  He does say he's considering getting his MBA at BU as he's trying to make a career change but not sure if he wants to go back to school. 

He says he's in the office Mondays/Wednesday/Fridays but said he's home and pretty flexible Tuesdays/Thursdays.  He also says he can work nights as well since the workload at BU isn't incredibly tough.  

I'm not sure if or how he'll slot into the team but he said he'll call me this week to see if something will make sense.  If he does come on, he'll be competing for the full time Client Mgmt role.  He said he'd ideally like to leave BU before their year end which pretty much aligns with busy season so could work out but he'd have to ramp up relatively quickly. 

I'll debrief with the team to see where we'd be able to use him and how we can ramp him up given his schedule limitations.

Gave Matt Coleman a call to check in on his broken leg. 

He is pretty down in the dumps.  He is actually out in San Fran with his friends, was leaving a bar and said the stairs were weird and slipped and broke his leg. He said it wasnt the alcohol but he also, got up and walked back to the hotel before waking up at 4am in extreme pain. Went to the hospital and had to have surgery they put metal rod in his leg to stablize it. 

He was hoping ot get out of the hospital yestreday and fly back from Cali, which had to be a miserable plane ride. 

His recovery is 4-6months. He is hoping to make that short. He mentioned MA FAMLI, i looked into it for him and he should be elgilble. He could potentially get 20 weeks paid, if it gets approved. That would be huge.

I had alfred create PDF resource on the process for applying for FAMLI and emailed it to him.

Nick called Mark to discuss a alumni mentor being assigned to the Crown Legends team.  

He is going to connects us on email but just wanted to make sure we were ok with it. I believe he said the guys name is Ryan, has a lot of experience with logistics, started his own company etc. I said there is no issue on our end, I can prob learn alot from the mentor as well. 

Nick was worried about stepping on my toes as the team leader of Crown Legends. 

He is sending out a date for lunch meeting.

Talked to Robert and his partner (name began with an E and sounded middle eastern), who own Apex Estimators (https://apexestimators.com/about-us/) 50/50.  Their business is exploding and they need accounting help.  They currently has a bookkeeper who categorizes their transactions every month and a Tax Prepper.  They've had the same experience as we typically hear from people who had dinosaurs for CPAs. 

They are looking for guidance essentially.  They had a large tax bill last year and on pace to make $900k this year.  They have a W2 office manager, a few contractors, and also 5 contractors in the Philippines that they use similar to how we have P24.  

They said their current tax person doesn't give any advice and they just want to know what they can be doing to save on taxes.  They brought up Solo 401k, biz owner expenses, etc. but seems like their tax person just wants to prep.  

I walked them through what it typically looks like for a Tax Advisory engagement with us with monthly meetings for the first few months to get started then quarterly meetings to do tax estimates as a base model.  I said we'd be able to work with their bookkeeper but they said they'd like to see what pricing would look like if they moved their bookkeeping over to us too.
column109:
I'll send out Thank You emails but we'll need the following work items: 

1. Tax - Tax Advisory (SCorp Prep, Tax Planning & Estimates, Review and Assessment)
2. BKPG - Monthly

Caroline/Matt to price this one.  They asked about Solo401k/SEP IRA so there could be some financial planning here as well.

column105:
Spoke with Justin, who is my brother's friend who has his own payroll company, Bayview Payroll Services, based out of Florida.  Talked about potentially being a partner for payroll and essentially handling any and all processing/management including withholding/remitting taxes and handling notices.

He was very excited about the opportunity and said that he would personally handle our account with everything we needed.  He said that they don't charge an onboarding fee for clients, but that they do a fixed fee of $50/payroll processed, and they have an additional $10 for each state included in the payroll.  That is due to the extra filings they need to do as a result, but again those fees cover all necessary correspondence related to tax issues/notices.  

In regard to relationship, assume we will take a similar approach with Gusto of getting all the necessary client information and then providing it to Bayview, who will then set it up.  

For pricing to our clients, we can either include the processing fees into our bill amount or just have them come out of the clients account directly when payrolls are processed. Personally I think we charge an onboarding fee, and then maybe a $50 management fee since the expectation is the client would come to us with issues or questions, and then we would work with Bayview to resolve them and let the processing fees just hit the client account. Think we use some of our recent new pipeline payroll clients (La Crue / Upirri) as FGAs with what we think would work better.  Once we get those sorted, we discussed potentially moving clients from Gusto over in Q4 if we feel comfortable with the switch

Below is what he provided me as their required information list:

Item 1: Company Voided Check

Please make sure that you provide the appropriate account number for payroll, payroll taxes, and fees for service.  The bank routing and account numbers must be clearly displayed on the MICR line of the check.  If you do not have company checks, please provide documentation that is not handwritten or typed showing the routing and account number.

 

Item 2: Proof of your Federal Tax ID Number

Any document showing your EIN number and legal number.  People also often refer to EINs as an “Employer Tax ID”.  This nine-digit number can be found on Form 941 (quarterly report preprinted by the IRS), Form 8109 (tax deposit coupon), or miscellaneous IRS correspondence.

 

If you cannot locate any IRS documents with your EIN, you can call 1-800-829-0115 to obtain it.  You must be a corporate officer and be in the presence of a fax machine.

 

Item 3: Proof of your State Tax ID Number and Current Year Rate

These numbers can be found on your state unemployment/withholding quarterly filings, or miscellaneous state correspondence. This document must show the state tax ID number as well as the ER rate for the current year.

 

Item 4: Employee Information

Please provide W-4 information (SSN, name, address, pay rate, marital status, number of dependents, hire & birth dates, departments, and per pay deductions (if any)) for every active employee.

 

Signed Direct Deposit Authorization forms and a check copy for all active employees wanting direct deposit.

 

Please provide the following W-4 information (SSN, name, and address) for every terminated employee with earnings this year.

 

Item 5: Completed Beneficial Owner(s) Addendum Questionnaire

Follow this link to complete our BOA Questionnaire: https://www.bayviewpayroll.com/boa

 

To help the government fight financial crime, Federal regulation requires financial institutions to obtain, verify, and record information about the beneficial owners of legal entity customers. Legal entities can be abused to disguise involvement in terrorist financing, money laundering, tax evasion, fraud, corruption, and other financial crimes. Requiring the disclosure of key individuals who own or control a legal entity (ex. Beneficial Owners) helps law enforcement investigate and prosecute these crimes.

 

Item 6: Employee and Company Balances

Payroll Summary Earnings Report by Employee from January 1st to September 30th.  This report should show gross to net breakdown totals per employee for payments check dated in this date range.

 

Item 7: Electronically Signed Service Agreement

Bayview Payroll Services will send you a completed service agreement via Adobe Esign.  Please review for accuracy and place your electronic signature in the required fields. 


He also provided me with their welcome packet which I have attached.  

ACTION ITEMS (Matt):
- Use La Crue & Upirri as FGAs to test the Bayview Relationship
- Create a Client Request with the required documents provided by Bayview

Patrick Caine called me but it was to give me an update on Matt Coleman.  

Matt Coleman fell down the stairs and broke his leg pretty bad. Had to get surgery yesterday.  So Matt is concerned about losing some big contracts. 

Pat was asking if Matt had health insurance. We had connected Matt with insurance broker and I know Matt was provided some quote but I dont know if Matt ever followed through on it. So that sucks for Matt.  So he is going to sign up now but not sure if any of the rehab will be covered or might just have to hit his deductible than they will cover some of it.

I know he has worker comp insurance but injury didnt happen on the job.  

Other that Patrick Caine has been looking to get back into the workforce.  Hasnt had any luck finding a job or even getting interviews. He says hes not being picky.

I floated the idea of him doing some work for MWM, he should still have his FINRA licenses.

Caught up with Raquel for what turned into 1.5 hours.  Lots of stuff going on in her world. 

She pulled out of the fight because she was having lots of pain in her back and her left arm was going 'dead' for hours at a time.  She also didn't think she had full strength in her right arm.  She knew she had 3 slipped discs but she got it looked at and she has bone spurs that are rubbing up against nerves or something.  She is going to a doctor and thinking about doing the surgery.  The doctor says she'll be back in the gym within 6 months of the surgery and she's leaning towards that option and coming back better than ever.  

Doesn't seem like she's going to fight in 2025 so she'll definitely qualify as a RE professional.  I think she has 10 doors and she manages all of them in various capacities.  

She called me because she needed her tax returns and an income verification for a property she came across through Donald "Cowboy" Cerrone who is good friends with her.  She said Cowboy's dad is a realtor and that Cowboy made most of his money outside of fighting (which he noted that I told her that's her future).  The house is worth $350k owned by an old couple and they accepted an offer from Raquel for $200k.  She wants to get a loan on it with 25% down and then immediately get a HELOC on it to get her money back for the next one.  She noted it was a trick we talked through for Dan Johnson and we joked about how she didn't know what she was doing on the first one but she's a pro now.  She says she loves it and wants to keep buying them to provide income post fighting.  

She even said Tecia has heard her talk about all these opportunities and is more motivated to get her finances in order.  

Another transition but Tecia isn't fighting for the rest of the year either.  NOT PUBLIC INFO but Tecia and Raquel are trying for another baby.  Last time, they extracted an egg from Raquel and IVF'd it into Tecia.  Now they are doing to use the same donor but to see if Tecia's eggs will hold.  They said there were complications with Tecia last time but just starting the process so fingers crossed. 

Tecia's on a really good run in the 125 division and Raquel's still a contender at 135 but they've both started to have different priorities in life with Alayah and Raquel's new ventures.  

Raquel says she'll get her taxes done by this week because she needs to in order to get this house.  I said the last time we did her taxes was because she needed to buy a house as well so I said I'd talk to her in April.  

Funny side note,
column109: We still need to get that Sponsorship program set up which I brought up to Brian O months ago.

column105:
Caught up with Mikey along with Mark.  Mikey got promoted to VP and says he really needs to get his finances in order.  We have talked throughout the year to do all we can from a tax standpoint (i.e. estimating this taxes, maxing out his 401k, etc.) when he got his bonus in May.  

He says he got a $25k increase in base pay and that his bonus will go up but it'll be prorated for his Associate Pay vs VP Pay so it'll be more but he won't get the full VP amount until 2027.  

We talked through things like buying a house and getting married and he's thinking the marriage part will start to happen in 2026 with the house a couple years later in New Jersey in the suburbs.  He doesn't think he'll ever move back to California but who knows.  Anna's from New Jersey and his job is in NYC so think he'll be there for the long run.  

Most of the discussion after we told him there isn't a lot to do on the tax side was on the financial planning side.  He says he has 2 old 401ks out there and he doesn't really know where they are or what they are invested in.  He wanted to consolidated and Mark talked through how consolidating helps make sure he's properly diversified.  Mikey said that's exactly what we're looking for.  

He has $75k with us in a money market and $7k in a backdoor ROTH which Mark can determine if that's a viable tool.  Mark brought up Permanent Life Insurance as well and think that could also be a good tool. He'll be in the 35% tax bracket until he makes life changes (i.e. wedding in 2027 and house in 2029/2030) which he understands but he agreed it's better to start diversifying sooner rather than later.  

Mark to take over from the planning standpoint as well but we'll stay close to see how that impacts taxes.
column109:
His fees for 2025 taxes will be $100 federal and $50 state.  Add Tax Planning and show $1,500 and discount down to $50.  

Only thing due today is the $50 for Tax Planning (upon acceptance) and Tax Prep will be due upon completion with no deposit.  

Mark to price the planning side of the house via MWM.

column105:
Talked to Jenna for a budgeting meeting.  She got into credit card debt when she had to change jobs going from Ohio -> San Fran -> LA -> Nevada.  Couple stints of unemployment before.  Looks like she's had a hard time finding a job (marketing) and got into a hole with debt.  She's basically teaching pilates because she needs the extra income to live.  She definitely can cut down on spending (she knows this) but went through her budget with her and came up with a debt payoff plan for her.  

ALFRED helped me look through options and think we're going a Balance Transfer Credit Card first and she's going to put the $1,200 she makes from Lagree into her bank account in Ohio cause it's harder to get to.  She opened a Chase cause her old bank was regional so think it helps she already has a relationship there.  

The other option I looked into was a Debt Consolidation Loan with Lending Club but think we go Balance Transfer first.  

She also has about $11k in an IRA from the Oakland A's.  She said her dad had rolled her 401k with an IRA with his advisor and she asked if that was an option.  We talked through the penalties / taxes associated with that and told her that our CFP, Mark, would say that's not a wise financial planning move.  I don't think we have to go there but she seemed option to using that to pay down the debt as well.  

I sent her the budget and the Balance Transfer Option.  I see her all the time so I'll walk her through that process.
column109: Proposal is out there I think

column105:
Set up a call to talk to Al about SEED.  He onboard with everything and happy to meet in person a couple of times but let him know majority can be virtual. 

He would like to focus on there website from a client function standpoint. Marketing Jaylen brown Hat drop Oct/Nov doesnt have a date yet.

Consulting - Review general best practices as far as running a retail store, inventory tracking, what are other stores doing. 

Funding - Review current loans, and options for future financing.  He is hoping they are done needing loans and not planning t give up equity unless its to friends and family for the work they put in. They could probably benefit from a LOC if they were able to secure one. 

Accounting-  Bookkeeping Update and Financial Reporting;

Dat and Mark met with Eric, Cary's Dad. Generally a pretty high level intro call to financial planning and budgeting. Mark introduced himself and we talked about Eric's 3 sons for a while.  He is very proud of them, he did all he could to pay for as much of their education as possible. 

Eric is worried that they are draining his 401k at a rapid pace and they need to figure out their fiances and plan for the rest of retirement. He retired with 1mil in his 401k and in a few years it is down to 250k. 

They have an interest only 1.3mil mortage that they paid 43k annually. He mentioned they might downsize and move to a smaller house or cheaper part of the country, which would free up some cash.

He was very appreciative of our work on his tax return and is excited to work with us more. 

Action Item:
Send out requests for additional info on all their monthly expenses and to develop a sustainable income plan for retirement.

Dat and Mark met with Aaron Lovelace. He is originally from Pittsburgh, a big steelers fan.  We talked about the NFL for a while, he has some family that play in the NFL, his cousin or sister married Plexico Burress.  He spoke highly of the Rooneys and Mark shared that he played football with Dan Rooney at Dartmouth. 

Overall the walk through of SmartVault was lack luster.  He showed us SmartVault using Proseries, which is Intuits older software similar to Drake. Proconnect will launch in October, they are waiting on Proconnect to finish their side of things. 

Integration with Karbon will launch potentiall in the first quarter of 2026.

It is a clean and easy way to collect documents that will directly interact with Proconnect.  The files themselves can show up on your document center, same as onedrive, so we would be able ot connect Karbon to the smartvault folders. Pricing was between $50-70 per user and $500 onboarding fee, that includes 4 sessions that they would record. 

It is something to consider and maybe do an additional walk through when we can see proconnect but I dont think Dat or myself are in a rush to sign up for it.

Talked on the phone with Nik who is a Jared Tishler client.  He's a Doctor (W2) for MGH and also Brown University.  He works in Internal Medicine and specializes in Obesity.  He's a typical doctor who only knows medical things had doesn't believe in money.  

He's not sure if he hasn't filed taxes in 3 or 4 years so I'll send out the request for his info so that we can request POA.  We'll probably need him to create an IRS online account as well.  

He said he always got refunds before (Guessing before he started making real money) and that he never cashed the checks.  He also needs help with getting those checks re-issued from the IRS.  

He says he's not good at this stuff and is ashamed because he tells his patients to make changes in their life so that they aren't fat anymore and they don't do it and also that he has had people tell him he has to figure out his finances yet he still ignores it which he knows is wrong.  He says he hopes he doesn't exhaust us and I said if he throws us the keys than we will make it as hands off as possible for him. 

He has a thick Greek accent and says he wants to go back September 23rd but he's here on a Green Card and he's concerned that his tax situations will cause complications.  He asked if getting the tax returns filed by then is realistic and I told him yes.  

He's a big soccer fan and going back to see some Greek professional team play in Athens.  

This is most likely: 

1. 4x 1040 Tax Returns - 2021 to 2024
2. IRS Assistance 
3. Abandoned Property Assistance.  He has a bunch of old bank accounts and things like the IRS refund checks that's probably with the state because it's been years since he looked at it.
column109:
I'll attach the text chain with Jared but he said "It's going to be expensive but you have to clean this shit up" 

The returns are straightforward but he'll need advisory right away (IRS Assistance, that abandoned property bullshit which is more financial planning... maybe just call it consulting hours, tax estimates, etc.) so let's get a pricing sheet together for that.

column105:
Caught up with Niki who has a full time Controller who she describes as a bookkeeper.  I talked to Kurt later in the evening and I was told it was a particularly bad day cause they found something else (which is good for us obv).  She does everything manually and resistant to growth.  Things are slipping through the cracks and she's burying them in the books.  She's also just not doing the bookkeeping great. An example is that Highline "TopCo / Mothership / Cash generator" has a plywood wholesaler but Ellekin (Cabinet subsidiary for Highline which is a construction company) uses a lot of the materials yet there is a $0 on Ellekin's books for 2025.  

Kurt had talked about similar frustrations where he doesn't have the information he needs in order to properly estimate work and the finances around the Cabinent side in general.  Cindy (The controller) also seems wayyy behind on her stuff and doesn't really pay Ellekin any attention because Highline is already overwhelming her.  Kurt says it takes her so long to do everything cause it's all excel spreadsheets.  

Niki was looking for someone to integrate their Business Software (HomeBuilder or something like that) into their QBO which it should do already but Cindy is resistant to change.  Cindy doesn't really come from an accounting background so I'm guessing their processes are sooooo bad.  Although Niki seems super sharp and you can tell she wears a lot of hats.  

They have a Fractional CFO that they are paying right now (his name is Gardner) and he is about 65 or a dinosaur as Niki said.  He suggested the integration overhaul which I think Niki already had in her head to do so nothing earth breaking there.  They basically need to restructure their finance department (Matty used to see me do this when we lived together) where they bring in Consultants (us) to take Cindy's job and keep things afloat for business continuity and as we clean up and install new processes.  They will find a new Permanent resource (whether in finance or Ops and outsource finance to us.. which is a new DLe idea).  

TAX
They have a tax person who is "Super aggressive" who they say they like but not married to him.  

WEALTH MANAGEMENT
She also said they have a financial planner they worked with 3 years ago who charged them $3k and they got nothing out of it.  Niki admits they didn't submit the documents they asked for but also because the financial planner made a comment about their credit cards because of their high balance but Niki pointed out that it's paid off every month and it's just the general business line of credit so it goes up and down. Easily can install Mark on the Business and Individual front.  


Niki asked for the following: 

1. What the pricing would look like for a CFO Services engagement for Ellekin.  This would be full invoicing, helping with estimates, and WEEKLY reporting.  Ellekin makes about $1m top line but currently not profitable (although with bad numbers, we don't know if they are or not).  

2. What services we offer and how we might be a better solution than their current set up.  I think it's super easy: 

a. Gardner is old and is going to die soon
b. Gardner is old and doesn't know how to use an iPhone. Asking him to help with integrations is a tall task.  
c. He was going to subcontract out the job to another firm which will be less efficient and not scalable for the business.
d. We can grow as they grow.  If they need more finance help, they have a team that is trained that they can deploy vs having to hire a full time resource or new contractor.  
e. We offer all the things under one roof so it's a one stop shop for them. 
f. We have Dat Le aka DLe3 aka the Big Bad Booty Datty who can help with custom integrations if necessary.  

Overall I just think it makes sense but that's some of the ways we can be better.  

3. She asked for pricing for all of this so we have to be thoughtful about this one because it's a $100k annual job potentially.  We should do pricing for Ellekin by itself (Bookkeeping & Taxes) and then Highline & Ellekin with the thought being that the Ellekin price would be cheaper if we did all of it.  

When I talked to Kurt afterwards, we talked about the benefits of this relationship and how it's a win-win.  He also doesn't think their current solution is going to help them scale and we can do that all under one roof.  He said during the meeting Niki said "Well what are we going to tell Gardner" and Nik (husband) goes "Who gives a shit".  Kurt also brought up a good point that even if we're more expensive than whatever they are paying Gardner, if we get it done in 75% less time isn't that still better? Good point Kurt.  

We'll debrief as a team but I think this could be a couple of CFO jobs.  They make about $10 million total top line with about $8.7 million coming from Highline and a million coming from Ellekin.  


Ellekin Karbon Work Item: https://app2.karbonhq.com/4mTyp9lLRWTC#/work/3N5sNFB4hDl3
column109: Further discussion required.  They need a consulting job to get them through the interim but this could be a massive set of projects so let's level set and talk as a team, present them the proposals, and then see what the work items / scope of the work items will be.

column105:
Caught up with only Chris and Kenny for the weekly catch up. Dame was away for a wedding and Tone didn't have any updates.  

They put me on a group text and there's a zillion messages going on so I don't really keep up but there seemed to be some sort of operational emergency they were dealing with.  I gave them our updates which is mostly that we're working through their accounting and waiting on the Nabis API access.  

He knows he owes us a statement and he also said they are changing distributors and it'll be cheaper.  I created a Karbon Client Task and sent out the request for the updated contract because that'll definitely be relevant for the forecast.  

He also says he might have a beat on the $100k from a family friend who has a family investment fund who is looking to get into cannabis.  All of these things are contingent on the numbers so let's prioritize that this week.

Went through Cary's outstanding items he had with Mark including: 

1. Paid off 50% of his student loans via FirstMark (old student loans).  That was about ~$43.5k

2. Applied for a Refi student loan.  He'll send the screenshots of the options.  Got a base rate 3.75% and 5 year payment term at 4.84% at ~$821 per month.  Went through his budget and he's paying $1k now so basically his payment goes down $200 per month and he'll be free from student loans in 5 years if not sooner.  He has no idea what he's doing with this stuff and had his money in a savings account so think this is a better use of his money.  That's impact people! 

We went through his budget and after all his savings (including the life insurance), he's basically netting $8.5k per month after taxes.  Not too shabby.  

We walked through Altruist and ACTION ITEM for Mark is to delete the duplicate accounts for him.  

We also looked at his 401k and there's still $19k from his Caesars 401k that could be moved to his rollover IRA he already has open with us and his old Roth 401k which he'll probably never contribute to again.  I know 401ks are a higher compliance item so I'll let Mark work with him on that though.  

He was super appreciative of the help with all of the above and kept saying that either me or Mark have to talk to his parents about whatever they have going on because they're definitely not using their money efficiently.  

Another sidenote but Mikey Smilove also texted me because he deposited another $50k into his Money Market account with us.  He also just got promoted at his job and says it's been on his To-Do to talk to us about Tax / Financial Planning.  He says Fridays in the summer are easier so maybe Mark reaches out with calendar links for him to book some calls.

Caught up with John with Caroline because my internet was being stupid.  

Wasn't a close meeting for the 2025 advisory stuff per se because we ran into some discrepancies for his 2024 return.  The amounts from his Property Mgmt did not match the 1099 and it was because he didn't have the Dec 2024 statements.  

We also talked through interest allocation for his ADU but it gets to the same place so think that's closed. 

We talked through some advisory strategies and income for 2025 and think he'll end at around $700k a year between Salary, Cap Gains, and Rental Income.  He also has some RSUs vesting in October to consider.  

We are going to file his 2024 taxes first because he is a mess of a person but then jump into the Advisory stuff.
column109:
We just need to set up the proposal in Karbon.  Fees and everything have been set.  

One thing to note is that he will need stock compensation analysis because he will try to get cute with equity comp.  I can talk to Caroline whether we add it to the advisory model and how we should include these in general.  Initially I'm thinking we either add it for people as part of it if we know they have it or as an ad-hoc with an advisory discount.

column105:
Dat & Caroline met with Jason and Vamsi to go over their advisory plan one more time. They are on board and approve of the draft (ill attach it here) so we're good to move forward on the proposal for it. 

they're going to do monthly meetings with us for now until things start to get automated. most of the call was just telling them the value we'll add and how we'll be planning for the year. jason wants to do a cost seg study for the tucson property so we'll need to kick the tires on that to make sure its worth it.

Note for the future that Vamsi mentioned that as long as we're under 10k that she'll stay on board - she definitely doesnt want price change surprises and she's a lot more price sensitive then jason is. 

To Dos:
- Caroline to set up a meeting for first week of september with them
- Caroline/Dat to send out tailored discovery requests for planning
- Caroline/Dat to look at what we need to kick the tires on the cost segregation study
- Andrew/Matt to get Vamsi set up on gusto to pay herself a salary. dat/caroline will help figure out what the salary should be.
- Andrew/Matt to reach out to Vamsi to get her quickbooks set up and automated properly - she needs help here
- caroline to get the tax plan/estimates ready for first week of september

Dat, Mark, Caroline & Grace met with Ryan to go over his SpaceX tender off analysis results. His ultimate goal is to get 50% of his holdings out of spacex to diversify because he is currently extremely over saturated in spacex. We had sent him a few options for the tender offer - 50% models and then 20%/36% options for today's call since he said he doesn't think he'll get 50% out this tender offer. He is ultimately wanting to go with the 36% option and he'll submit his request based on that one. He is going to regroup with Ross on it as well to make sure we're all aligned. I sent Ross my notes and included him in the karbon documents i sent so he should be good to go for that meeting.

follow ups:
- Caroline/Dat to look at scenario #2 (36%) option and kick the tires on whether any of them should be weighted higher than others in terms of priority.
- he said he was good on the 2024 tax return so ill circle back with him next week once the dust settles to get him to upload his banking and sign it (both of these things have been sent to him already, he just needs to complete them)
- post tender offer we'll do a tax plan for him & then it'll lead into getting him on the advisory plan moving forward

Talked to John who missed the 2:30 PM meeting which he was super apologetic about.  He had a work call come up while he was running to Wal Mart for one of his properties and also had to go pick up a puppy that him and his wife just got recently (Aussie).  

He asked to move the meeting to 1:30 PM on Friday which I can take Han Solo.  I said Caroline can send out any questions or outstanding items.  

TOMMY POINT to the tax team on this one (Caroline/Grace) who did a Review / Assessment and found like $9k in tax savings.  The old CPA is straight up incompetent which helped us a lot.  Great job to the team on the turn around there.  When I told him she put his Backdoor Roth IRA as taxable, he yelled the F word and said "Yeah, I think I've had my last conversation with her".  I said Caroline drafted the return so she can essentially just punch in the numbers but he isn't confident that she could even pull that off so he's asked that we file it.  I think we charged him for a Review/Assessment so we can just count that as the prep since we basically spent that time doing that.  He was super appreciative of that and also I specifically brought up that we've already saved him almost $10k and he said that all of that is coming back to us.  

He says he wants to do the LLC cause he wants to start getting things buttoned up but he's not the guy that wants to do it so it's been procrastinating.  He says he already knows he can trust us so he finally wants to get all of his finances situated.  He said "I want all of it" when it comes to planning and all of that stuff.  Great case of doing an assessment, finding some issues and turning it into an advisory client right away.  

I can talk to him tomorrow about the returns and advisory model. I remember he also asked about tax credits for buying a Tesla so maybe we ALFRED that.
column109:
Pricing has already been determined.  I can go through it with the team to confirm and talk to him about it during the meeting.  

I think our pricing sheet had him at ~$600 per month.  I think we'd be able to get away with closer to $700 ish even if it's just a pure tax advisory client.  It might be more actually.  Maybe we make a copy that includes financial planning.

column105:
I did a bi weekly catch up with Andrew Piatelli.

He is in charge of educational webinars for their 401k plans I signed up for their next webinar o see what it’s like. He said the info is pretty basic, intro to finance stuff but they need to do education webinars annual for plan compliance. 

He’s been getting a decent amount referrals, we talk about pricing fee based vs aum. 

He going to NH this weekend with his family at lake house.


He might have referral for a coffee shop owner in Boston, he asked what their CPA does and said they just file taxes and meet with them once year. So he will position us said they need some planning had one coffee shop just expanded to 2 coffees shops the husband quit his teacher job. Currently just operating as single member llc.

I got coffee with Matt triosi. Matt is a nice guy, I ment him at a chamber event about month or go. He is 25 has his own bookkeeping business only has like 12 clients right now, says he can get his work for the week in only a day so has plenty of room for capacity. He is all quickbooks. Talk about different tech platforms and general business. 

He is looking for a cpa to refer business to, said he might have one client with an immediate need. I mentioned we would keep him in mind for any overflow or potentially white labeling if we wanted. 

He went to unh, does some photography on the side, he likes doing some photos shoots but doesn’t want do that full time so that why he started the bookkeeping firm.

He grew up in Billerica and still lives there him and his boyfriend bought the house across from his parents house. 

No action items

Michael Holt (TX_Holt_Michael_6020) from HomeSmart called me about Michael Yu's CPA Letter (https://app2.karbonhq.com/4mTyp9lLRWTC#/work/2VyXl7sYTYnB).  He basically just needed some details taken out because he was concerned about the underwriters so I made those changes and sent the updated draft along to Michael Holt.  

He also said his mother was a CPA and had her own shop for over 30 years and it would have taken her 3 weeks to turn a letter around and it would have been thousands of dollars.  This is to give everyone an idea of pricing and how valuable this service is to the market.  

I talked to Michael and he wants to set up a referral type relationship.  He said that the first person we did a verification letter for plans to use us for taxes.  I don't know if he's just being a salesman but if Brian can find that work item for whoever we did the Verification letter for and add them as a prospect for 2025, that would be great.  These are often times HIMAR clients and they are from a Non-Financial-Advisor so could be a good source of organic leads.

I told Michael these range between $500 - $1500 depending on the scope and how quickly they need it turned around.  I think we say standard turn around time is 1 week but if they need it sooner (Expedited) than it's more money. Caroline/Brian to create that service. 

Caroline, Grace, and I utilized the PDF Services Agent and created a CPA Verification Agent that will read all of the statements, convert to data, create the financials and expense ratios (taking out transfers) and writing the letter to the specifications of the requestor.   (See agent here: https://mottafinancial.anyquest.ai/agent/bf542de4-52e1-4333-bb95-e1a3f4a6e031) I also added it to the Karbon Work Template. 

Furthermore, I created an Airtable form (https://airtable.com/app29FvStmjP1Vyb2/pagggLgnehv2sJED3/form) for future CPA letters.  

My next quest is to somehow get ALFRED to do this process start to finish.  If you think about it already, we can already take a process that takes the industry 3 weeks to do and turned it into a 30 minute exercise.  Try and compete with that.  

Michael says Phillip Morris is HomeSmart's COO and said he'd want to talk about some sort of partnership (think they're just looking for bulk pricing).  Maybe we can white label that service for a "Set Up" or "Licensing" fee and basically just have this ALFRED Agent be an ATM machine.  

More to come but I'd say a productive afternoon for DLETrey5.

Mark, Grace, Brian & Caroline met with Luke Peach who was a DJ Roberts referral.

Luke is a real estate agent but he's scaled that back over the past year and has been mainly focusing on his advertising and marketing company (ads, websites, things like that). He was incredibly long winded and scattered but overall he wants a one stop shop to handle everything for him. His old/current CPA gives him one word answers and doesn't research things for him - seems like just a prepper, so Luke is annoyed with him and wants someone who cares more about the advisory side of the relationship. Ex. he asked his current cpa about s-corp election and his cpa said 'you don't need to do that right now' and didn't explain or say anything else. the main focus for us right now will be the 2024 tax return because thats extended but not done. i dont think it makes sense to try to late elect s-corp for 2024, think itd be cleaner with the irs to just elect for 2025.

He currently handles his own book keeping and says 'he's pretty good at the day to day' but then admitted to not having 2024 completed...we got accountant access and matt saw that he's moving money out of  the business and into his personal investment accounts etc. so there's going to be a fair bit of clean up there.

He wants the following services:
- tax prep (2024= 1 1040 + 1 state; 2025=most likely s-corp + personal, + 1 state for each)
- tax advisory, quarterly estimates
- wealth management/financial planning
- book keeping - we talked about quarterly and monthly so we can show him prices for each

He asked if we do a bundle of services so lets just pitch the advisory plan for him and then if he wants to pay per service we can do that instead.

for the sheet i think we should do two options:
- one with monthly book keeping
- one with quarterly book keeping

for tax planning/MWM -> we should do a bundled price for the two services that we've started talking about

i'll start the draft of the advisory sheet but matt after you look at his books if you could price the book keeping options with the clean up in mind. think we can just pass the excel file back and forth between our different areas to get the total price built out.
column109: DJ Roberts referral and DJ is part of 3PM so if we feel that warrants a discount then we can add it in. Think we'll do an 'advisory relationship' small discount anyways so might be fine.

column105:
Caught up with Kurt briefly.  He had told me last time we talked that the company was growing fast and they recently brought in a Fractional CFO.  The CFO was trying to reconcile their CRM (Hometrend or something? Kurt says it's a big one for construction companies) to their QBO and found some major issues.  

Turns out, the Controller was tracking the entire enterprise on an excel sheet and only using QBO for invoicing... all manually.  They found out that she was invoicing clients for Change Orders (as in additional work on projects) because she was overwhelmed / disorganized and she just swept it under the rug.   I don't know the scope of how pervasive this is but think this will be a heavy onboarding job.  

I don't know if the Controller was full time or external.. if they are external than that accounting firm is getting sued.  I think she might have been internal.  If they are looking to outsource that, we can essentially replace that full time worker for them.  Could be a big job for us cause I think we can parlay this into replacing their fractional CFO as well.  

Kurt runs Ellekin which is the cabinet side of the house and says they are about to open a massive shop.  They're in Burlington MA and think they do luxury projects.  Growing fast, Kurt was the first hire and think he said he has a team of like 10-15 people.  

Talked to Matty before I said yes and he said we can do it so this client isn't my fault.
column109:
Lead intake - Pricing to come but I think: 

NEW SERVICE: "Controller Services" which is basically between Regular Bookkeeping and CFO services.  

Or we can just do all the different services itemized.  Matty's call.

column105:
Caught up with Cam who met someone via a Cold Call at his current job that has a source in Asia for Peptides (ALFRED, please do full research on this).  He says they've been a commodity but this guy can get it for cheaper?  He is essentially looking for a distributor and would pay Cam commission via 1099.  

What he is weighing is if he wants the TopCo to take care of accounting, payroll, etc. and he gets a smaller commission or he can essentially start his own business and get more commission.  

We talked through pros and cons in depth and Cam will go back to the Company with follow ups.  Jared pushed for getting the full commission and hiring Motta and Cam was leaning that way.   

He'll most likely go that route and will be just him so pretty simple to start but he'll eventually have a sales team and he wants to be as hands off as possible so we'd be doing the commission payroll.  They use stripe with codes for each sales person so think we can somehow automate this but maybe easier said than done.  

He asked if we should start a new LLC but he already has one established that he hasn't done anything with so we can just use that.  Let's just do a compliance check to make sure it's in good standing.  See link and PDF attached.  

I think this is gonna start small but escalate quickly.  Maybe we put a 1 year term on this one? 

If he does go with the Motta route, he'll need:  

1.QBO Set Up
2. SCorp Return
3. Payroll Setup (with more commissioned contractors eventually)

I'm not sure if he'll need ongoing services yet but we'll be onboarding either way.  

LLC:
https://search.sunbiz.org/Inquiry/CorporationSearch/SearchResults?InquiryType=EntityName&InquiryDirectionType=PreviousRecord&SearchTerm=CGB%20PROPERTY%20USA%20LLC&SearchNameOrder=CGCCONTRACTING%20L240000846080&ListNameOrder=CGCCONSTRUCTION%206683770&Detail=FL.DOS.Corporations.Shared.Contracts.FilingRecord

Mark, Caroline & Grace all met with Tosh who was a referral from Antonio Parks. She started the meeting explaining that she had met us before but we were out of their price range in the beginning. Now that they've grown, they have also outgrown their tax prepper - and they are coming back because now they are really looking for tax advisory and not just prep. Antonio spoke highly of our advise and how we're doing quarterly estimates - so that was nice to have that work payout in this way.

They have EXPLORINGNOTBORING BLLC and Robynhood LLC. ENB is the operating business and Robynhood is the MMLLC they created this year to hold ENB. ENB has two partners (1065 Partnership return) -> the CTO that vested this year and holds 5% and ENB that holds the remaining 95%. Tax and entity structure is definitely foreign to her, so we walked through their setup to explain how everything should be working which she appreciated.

She wants to know if they should convert Robynhood into an S-Corp which could be the move, but we want to see the P&L for ourselves first before we lock into that. 

They're going to be going from 100K TOPLINE in 2024 to 500K TOPLINE in 2025. We then asked about profit and she thinks it should come in around 300K for 2025. 

She wants tax prep but she also wants advisory, so this might be a good one (depending on how the discovery docs look) to pitch advisory to right away. She wants to start paying estimates so the estimated tax work will be starting pretty much once they sign on. She also noted at the end that she wants advisory in her proposals and 'she's happy to outsource us for that' aka she seems like she'll throw us the keys at least for tax.

Brian - can you please create the following work items:

- EXPLORINGNOTBORING BLLC: 2025 1065 tax return
- Robynhood LLC: 2025 1065 tax return (might switch to s-corp but lets keep it as 1065 for now)
- Kaysie's 2025 personal tax return
- Tosh's 2025 personal tax return (we have this one already)

In terms of proposals we need the following (subject to change when discovery docs come in), but lets also have an advisory sheet prepped so that if we want to pitch that we can.

- (2) 1065 partnership returns
- (2) 1040 tax returns + 1 state for each (i think we can do a small discount since they're doing the business returns with us)
- Quarterly Estimates/Tax Planning, i think we can do a lumped fixed fee for this one for now: 2K? Dat/Mark lmk thoughts here. Only two more quarters technically so open to thoughts on this one.
column109: I think steve was the original referral? do we need to discount for that? but now its antonio parks. we can discount the 1040s if we want since we'll be doing their business returns but i dont think we need to do any other discounts.

column105:
Mark met with Emily King, she is Drew King's wife. They live in South Carolina. She stopped working when then relocated from GA to SC, just focused on planning their wedding. 

She is now looking to start her own business Emily King Design. It is a back drop rental business. Basically set up back drop for photos, at weddings, showers, other events. 

She needs help setting up the LLC and general tax advice. So far she has spent about 3k in expenses, to get backdrops and set up equipment. Should be a pretty lean and mean business moving forward outside travel expenses. She has tracked all her expenses on an excel so far. No income yet. 

For income, her pricing to start is $250 plus travel fees and has some add ons they can select. 

She will open business accounts once we create the LLC for her. 

I went over business use of car and business use of home expenses tracking; self employment tax. 

Need to research if any local county consideration in SC for taxes. 

Note: For this operating agreement, lets edit a blackburn operating agreement, no need to pay blackburn for single member llc operating agreement. 

Action Item:
Emily King Design LLC name is available in SC. LLC creation fee in SC is $125 Brian can you add a line item on the draft proposal for State Filing Fee $125

Talked to Greg who is Cam Colby's father.  He wasn't on camera and we weren't sure of the relationship but it seemed like it was his dad.  

We had a meeting with Cam later that afternoon and he says he was talking to him about Cam's new venture and his dad was complaining about some of the issues he's having and Cam said to come to Motta.  

He's been with his accountant for 10 years and says it's been a good run but she's on an oxygen tank and about to retire.  He said he was going to retire a few years back and then didn't which caused issues but there's been issues anyways.  

She actually failed to file his taxes 2 years in a row.  The first year she said it got mixed up on papers so he gave that a pass and the second year she just failed to push the file button.  He found this out when he was trying to get a mortgage and they said he didn't file is taxes.  

I told him about how that caused more issues with other clients and he said that also happened to him.  Seems like she's pretty terrible but he still stuck with her until she retired.  Low bar for us.  We just have to bat above 80% in just getting the return filed and we win.  

He started a business "SCorp" in 2024 doing real estate and has an admin who he says is extremely diligent with receipts.  He says the 2024 books are clean and done but the accountant still hasn't gotten to them.. yikes.  

He has payroll but says he needs better info so that he can plan cash better.  He probably also needs some tax planning but we need to get his 2024 return done first.  

I sent the thank you email already but I'll also send requests for QBO access under his personal tax return item because there is no business work item yet.
column109:
We need the following: 

1. 1040 - 2024
2. 1120s - 2024
3. 1040 - 2025 (work item already created)
4. 1120s - 2025
5. Quarterly [Quantity = 4] Payroll Filings (Form 941) - New service so work with Caroline on creating this.  

Caroline / Mark to price this one out after we see what the books look like.

column105:
Mark attended weekly Chamber Coffee Connect. 

There was about 15 people that attended today. Everybody went around the room and shared a little bit about the cyclicality's of their business, if any.   

Talked with Mark & Joey, Mark is the president of the chamber, and they are a husband and wife the run a remediation company. Ive built a pretty good relationship with them. Also talked with the owners of Empower Cafe, a coffee shop in cummings park and the Sharon who runs Conors Kindness Project.

Sharon is actually Keith and Kyle Morris's aunt, who were a little older than me in high school.  Sharon is very nice and Conors Kindness Project just hit its 4yr anniversary, they deliver kindness kits, to children at shelters and hopsitals. Also started doing outreach presentation at local schools. Very nice, she said she has sister in law who has made nice business being CFOs for non -profits, suggested it as an area to look into. 

Russ- runs business accounts for Astound Sales (use to be RCN) in the area.

No action items.

Spoke w/ Elly & Ashley.  Ashley will be doing the bookkeeping for Elly, who put her two week notice in on Friday, so her last day will be Aug 15th, and she will be starting up herself on Aug 18th. 

Walked through the COA with them and talked through different potential scenarios she may run into.  Ashley said she has good QBO experience but told her while they get going if anything comes up that they may want to run by us, they can reach out and we will help as part of the "onboarding".  They appreciated this and asked if we could do a touch base in a couple months just gauge how everything is going and talk through potential tax estimates.  Will put something on the calendar and if needed will include Caroline for a tax perspective.  

Brian O, we should be good to bill the second portion of the Onboarding fee.

Mark's notes from meeting with Ryan:

Looking to redeem SpaceX Shares with tinder offer by Aug 12th.  Motta Team is working on Stock Comp Tax Analysis. This will be delivered by end of week. 
His former Financial Planner, had a lot of knowledge on Spacex, the SpaceX CFO used them as a financial planner as well
His former Financial Planner, was impossible to get a hold of, no formal financial plan was made, they would meet to discuss taxes and tinder offers a couple of times a year. Planner filed his taxes and did financial planning for him, (what he is calling financial planning, doesn't seem like they did much.)
Wants to diversify out of Spacex, he loves SpaceX but doesnt want to be 100% in it, old planner was for him keeping all the SpaceX stock for the upside
I mentioned $3900 annual fee for financial planning, he seemed fine with that number, said it was in the ballpark of what he was paying before
Wants/needs to set up investments accounts, has company 401k and Traditional IRA with 6k.  I explained to him the difference between Traditional IRA and Roth.
Overall his goal is better communication, making a plan and setting up investment accts for diversification. 
Personal side- he is on the launch team for Starlink, basically they are launching satelites into space daily and so he is basically working 7 days a week on that. They have multiple launch pads and basically every luanch pad launches a satelite into space every 4 days. They about 10000 satelies currently that cover the whole world. Went into detail about Starlink and the spectrum they are using is different than the traditional spectrum, working in an area previously thought wasn't really usable for data transmission. Mentioned the deal they just got with Delta.

Mark met with Cary to go over student loan game plan.  Cary is going to start off by paying down 44k of his 88k principal balance and then work with Sofi to refinance the remaining amount. 

Cary is going to submit his basic loan info to Sofi and upload the difference options for us to review. He has 12 years left to pay off his current loans but likely looking at 5 or 7yr repayment plan when refinancing.  We will review the monthly payments and rates for the different scenarios. 

General note, his student loans have high interest rates, which Cary is a little upset at his dad by. I notice his loans were variable rate loans, so when his father signed up for the loans they probably  had a good rate, but with the rising rate environment we experienced, it was just a really poor time to have variable rates loans.  Im sure his father never thought to look at the loans again or even remember they were variable rate,]just signed up for the cheapest rate at the time and didnt pay attention when rates rise, which im sure the student loan company was counting on. 

Overall lesson, if you are going to sign up for variable rate loans, you need to know the rate is going to move and understand the potential consequences if rates go up

column105:
Caught up with Victoria after doing my monthly tax sync with Paige Borchers.  

Victoria started going through her expenses and she was literally going on her phone app, pulling up the statement, and punching the transactions into a google sheet.  She said the same thing with Venmo because she says she has business / personal.  I told her if she goes to the website, you can export the excel which will save time and she was grateful.  

We talked about her "Egg donation" which I was confused about at first because there was a $40k payment when I pulled her IRS info.  I thought she had chickens and she donated eggs but I didn't understand why she'd get $40k for that.  I found out it was for her lady eggs.  She said she called the office and they had changed ownership so she couldn't get the form but I said we found it via the IRS tax pro.  

She says she was a barber / content creator going back to 2021 as well.  I thought this was a newer venture and that she was just getting started but if she's been doing this for awhile, she's gotta step her game up.  

She'll continue to work through her expenses. She was super ashamed she got behind this much but feels better that she's finally getting to it.  

She also snuck in that she is also declaring chapter 7 bankruptcy.  She says it'll be finalized over the next couple of months but she has to find the money to pay the attorney to file the paperwork.  

She asked if there were any tax benefits to declaring bankruptcy and I don't think there is but maybe ALFRED can research this.  

I pulled her docs from the IRS and saved them to the client folders (you're welcome tax team).  So I think this would be a good easy one for Grace to practice prep with (including completing 2021, rolling to 2022, so on).
column109:
Do a proposal for $100 each (For 2021, 2022, and 2023), IRS Assistance complimentary.  Do these as monthly payments as well.  

We didn't talk about pricing (she almost cried and I felt bad).  She doesn't have any money and already talked to Caroline about this one.

1040: State Return
