column105:
Talked to John Hernandez which was a Chris Martin referral.  He was the guy that asked about our Google Reviews after I sent our intake form so I was going to let that lead die because I thought he was going to be a high maintenance guy but he's actually pretty chill.  

He also started the call by saying he did research on me and listened to the Podcast I was on with Gibson Sotheby's so that BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT I did last year with that pod cast is paying dividends now.  He probably Google'd me and it probably came up under real estate so starting to become a "Thought Leader" which could be a good base to be a social media influencer.  He also says I came highly recommended from Chris Martin.  

He was skeptical because his current CPA is a complete moron. It's Ginny from Mountain Bookkeeping & Tax Solutions (https://www.mtnbookkeepingllc.com/).  He did a screen share and she does use Karbon but he says she's manual and slow.  He also said that he first said he owed $80k and that she got him down to $70k but then he talked to someone else and went to her office to do the return live. Turns out, she made some rudimentary error and he said it generated a $6k refund? She also sent all the docs without the password which frustrated him (I don't know if he checked the Karbon task so might have been user error) but it shows that once you make one mistake, the clients are on super high alert for your stuff.  He then said she tried to upsell him the Advisory services.  He said she charged him $1k to do his return and he was more on the side of asking for that money back vs paying her more money.  

Had a long conversation with him about his income.  He worked with Chris Martin while at Oracle in Burlington but then moved to CO then reconnected with Chris after Chris moved out there.  

SCHEDULE E (Rental Properties): 

He has 3 doors (2 units) in the Lawrence area, 1 property in Colorado, and he's building an ADU (90% done) on his primary home.  He says he sometimes AirBnB's his Primary home as well. 

Ginny said he should open Quickbooks and he was out on her so he wasn't about it but he said if we recommend it than he'd do it.  He uses a property manager who tracks income/expenses and he says he spends 2-3 hours at the end of the year working on it so I said Bookkeeping probably isn't necessary because the Property Managers already do it so the only value would be to get live info in a cloud based platform but it's a rental property so it's pretty flat (from an income / expenses standpoint) anyways.  

He hasn't filed his taxes yet but he already has them just about done, Ginny just has to hit file but he doesn't trust her.  I told him we could basically "Prep the return" and see if there's anything else that she may have missed.  Let's have that be the project for now.  He has all of his tax docs so he'll send that over. 

SCHEDULE D: CAPITAL GAINS

John has made $300k in REALIZED gains in 2025.  He's really into Ai stocks and also just follows Trump trades.  He also had 1 BTC.  He is REALLY into day trading and admits he's one of those people who will tell you about his Robinhood account.  At least he's making money.  Ginny actually said his return takes so long because she manually inputs all his trades.  He knows he's going to owe like $30k in taxes from that (so far).   

He'll be a heavy Schedule D client so factor into 2025 Advisory pricing. 

He doesn't have the properties in an LLC right now so he said that will be on the to do.  He says he's terrible with all this accounting stuff so I gave him our typical rizz on that.  A lot of our approach seemed to resonate with him in general.  

So I said we'd collect all of his 2024 tax docs and "Do the return" but Ginny will push the button since he already paid her to do that.  We'll use the 2024 docs to do a FULL discovery for an advisory model.  Brian/Grace (with Caroline oversight) can put that together.  I think this could be a good FGA for Grace to prep as well. 

Let's send discovery docs for 2025 and in the 2024 tax return request, ask for the draft that Ginny prepared (he emailed her for the password when we were on the call) as well as his "Tax Docs".  

Ask him to send any other docs he wants to share as well.. I'm sure he's going to dump a bunch of shit.  Maybe reference the costs related to the ADU, we're gonna need it anyways and I said that there are some energy credits he could leverage before they go away.  See the new service for Energy Credit Analysis in the fees below.  

He said "That's exactly what I need" about the following things: 

1. Doing a review of his 2024 taxes so that we won't have to re-do it because Ginny fucked up.  
2. Bringing up stuff like the Energy Credits because we saw he was building a house. 
3. Get the 2024 return done, he was anxious they weren't filed yet because Ginny was so slow.. he had to file the extension himself.
4. I said we can sync up after we do our review and then come up with an Advisory Model to talk through for 2025 forward.  He wanted to do Tax Planning basically and I said the whole "Let's review 2024 and we'll come up with recommendations / services for 2025".
column109:
Let's send a proposal for a Tax Review and Assessment.  I think it's like $500 or something but discount it down to $150.  

We should put together a pricing model for the following: 

-Tax Prep 1040 [1 - 2025 return]
-State Return(s) [TBD -] 
-Schedule E [2]- We can fit 3 rentals on 1 schedule E, he has 5 so he'll need 2.
-Entity Formation
-Schedule D - Might need multiple, pending discovery.  
-Tax Planning (Potentially Financial Planning)
-Tax estimates (Comprehensive)
-NEW SERVICE: Energy Credit Analysis

column105:
Mark & Caroline met with Christina Warsheski about questions regarding her LLC and her paystub after moving from MA to WA. 

Her paystub all looked good and we told her that if she gets any additional bonuses or if something changes to let us know, but as of now everything is being withheld properly. Her tax rate is low and her relocation bonus was withheld at the standard 22% which is above her rate so that helps from the w-2 side. The big outlier with her income is her self employed income from her business - she is going to get us an estimated # for income and expenses so we can see what the SE tax implications will be for 2025.

Her LLC is for her resale business (she does designs and then gets them screen printed and sells them to stores). She currently moved the business' address to her boyfriends address in Peabody for the meantime while she was moving to WA. She wanted to know what options she had for the LLC now that shes in WA and we originally were going to shut down the MA LLC and re-open a new WA LLC - but on the call she told us that her screenprinter (who prints and ships all of her orders) is in MA so she still has nexus in MA. It now looks like she'll need to go the foreign LLC route and register her MA LLC as a foreign LLC in WA since she is still doing the designs running the business in WA (so she has WA nexus there by 'operationally conducting the business' there). 

Follows ups:
- Christina is going to send us her YTD income/expenses for the business 
- Caroline/Mark to follow up after reviewing the YTD income from the business and send her the information on the foreign LLC process

Mark & Caroline met with Matt La Crue to go over tax planning and financial planning. 

We discussed payroll and the logic behind why its important and also how its required by the irs when you have an active s-corp. He likes the idea of budgeting and paying in some to the IRS throughout the year to avoid the big year end tax bill so it was an easy conversation. I told him we use Gusto since it is a no-frills service but they'll file everything for you for a reasonable price. I need to send him two proposals - one for just payroll set up/onboarding and a second for if we did everything for him. 

Next was tax estimates - i explained the two ways to do it (safe harbor vs based on actuals) and how estimates will prevent the year end underpayment penalty. He likes to stay liquid so he was wondering if he could kind of pay what he wanted which we explained was also totally fine - just wanted him to know if he had a tax bill at year end then that means underpayment penalty. I said I'll send him both proposals (safe harbor vs actuals) and he can think about it - its likely that he might just pass on these and have a year end tax bill because its personal preference.

Mark then went through retirement plan options with him and explained all the different types and options - the SEP makes the most sense for him and it will only help at year end tax time. Mark also offered the money market account to him since he doesnt like having the money just sitting in his bank account (and he mentioned he was looking at HYS options). Mark is going to follow up with Matt to set up a time for next week to get everything set up.

Finally circled back to the 501c4 org that he's now running with Ellie & he wants us to handle the taxes for it. The name is "Workforce Housing Coalition" and I guess they brought on matt and ellie to lobby for them and its centered around housing - he also said basically all of the money they raised is going to him and ellie to lobby for them. They started it Nov 2024 so he didn't realize that the tax return was due in May.  i told him that if they get a failure to file notice then we should be able to get it abated because 1. 501c4 and 2. they genuinely didnt know that they had to file for the two months. he said to make the proposal out to the business name and then he'll present it at this months budget meeting to get done asap since its already late. ill send this one in a separate email to him as well.

last note is he bought a porsche and was wondering if he should just keep that as personal/if it mattered - we told him that if he incorporates it into the business (even just 20%) that it will help his taxes since last year he got a ton of depreciation exp on the cadillac. example i gave is if your entertaining clients and want to use the flashy car then use it and just track the business and personal uses.

To Dos:
- Brian: i dont think we have work items for the following yet. can you double check and create them as needed: payroll, 2025 estimates (the ones for the exempt entity and for WM are already there)
- Brian: two more proposals to make 1. i think our current payroll proposal is for just onboarding/set up with gusto - can you create a second payroll proposal for if we ran payroll for him? then he'll have the two options to choose from 2. can you create a proposal (under the business name mentioned above) for the 501c4 entity tax returns
- I'll then send him emails with the proposal links and explanations like dat did for ellie so everything is clear
- i'll send a second email with the 501c4 proposal seperately
- Mark to follow up with Matt and set a time to go through wealth management
column109: n/a - keeping prices standard with ellie's prices. for the 501c4 - i dont think we need to discount this because they'll work our fees into their budget & ideally were moving away from discounts. Dat/Mark feel free to lmk your thoughts

column105:
Amir asked me to call him to discuss update on Pure Bliss Real Estate.  The client is shutting down his S-corp that is Pure Bliss Real Estate but opening, LVTD Real Estate that is a 50/50 Partnership with his wife. LCC is going to manage one rental property the family owns, its a long-term rental so income should be consistent and then just some monthly bills.

The other item the client is looking to do with in this partnership is management the demolition and construction of a "dream house", currently not primary residence and wants to take depreciation during construction, need to do some research on this scenario, Amir was onboard with the plan and I believe he is going to be filing the taxes but not sure how aggressive strategy this would be. Also, does the LLC have to own the property, he said the client was open to transferring to LLC but Amir didnt seem to think that was necessary. Want to do more research on this front. 

This will be a brand new Quickbooks set up, no data to transfer. 

Overall Amir is very happy with the partnership and loves Andrew and Matt. He said he only marks us up 100-200 dollars. I reminded him the additional value in RIA has that is offering these types of services and he agreed. He appreciates that we are down to earth and willing to work with him depending on the opportunities for each of us. 

Andrew/ Brian - There was a monthly bookkeeping work item already but no onboarding work item currently. 

I emailed out updated ignition proposal to Amir.

Caught up with Ross/Russ about the (1) SpaceX tender offer and talked through the Memos, Tax Calcs, and Scenarios around his tender offer.  (2) Debian Guys Set Up (3) New Business

He's most likely going with Scenario 2 but going with check with EquityBee and things of the sort.  He doubts they'd give him the full Scenario #3 but also said maybe he asks to sell more and they'll meet in the middle.  He's going to look into that.  

Ross said the idea was to diversify over the next couple of years so maybe this is the one we use to pay off the EquityBee loan and he knows there will be 2 tender offers in 2026. 

ACTION ITEM: I think there were some numbers that were off (Owned Shares, Salary, etc.) so think we need to clean up the analysis and calculate based on Scenario 2 in more detail.  I think we also layer in scnearios where they only give him 75% or 50% of the requested shares.  

 DEBIAN GUYS SET UP

Russ said August will be his first full month working and it's been slower because he's taken a bunch of vacations this summer (Noting they went to Europe for awhile and spent too much money at the Louis Vutton store but "You only live once").  He wasn't sure about salary and think he's still skeptical because he isn't sure how much he's going to make (or need) so think he's gun shy about that.  Right now he just calls Ross if he needs money and Ross liquidates some of his brokerage.  He said he was going to keep doing that and let the money in the business account sit there but I don't know if I agree with that.  I don't think Ross does either.  I had emailed Ross after to Debrief because I think we're on the same page about that one.  

Also talked through Solo401k because he asked if we needed payroll set up for that but we confirmed that we didn't.  

Seems like he hasn't worked much and hasn't had a lot of business expenses (0 by the sounds of it) so think he's punting on BKPG/PYRL again but this gives us more time to put together an Advisory contract for him and think we have a better idea of the amount of Planning/Advisory that these clients will need.  

NEW BUSINESS

His friend from Unicorn got laid off but his job was to take technology from the Department of Defense and license it out to people so seems like he has some tech that could be something.  Russ says he didn't pay any money in and basically only answers tech questions sometimes (the other guy is the Biz Dev guy) and he's not sure what is going to come of it but he owns 45% of it.  

We told him he might still be entitled to the losses (which would help offset taxes for the tender offer).  That's all we know on that but basically he should just track hours/expenses related to that activity.  Doesn't seem like it'll move the needle overall but maybe this is another prospect and another business to merit an Advisory model.  

DAT

I'll catch up with Ross to get on the same page about using is income instead of pulling from his investments along with the other considerations.
column109:
Proposal already out there but he punted again.  I think we need to tweak it based on updated info (another business, etc.) and let's plan on talking to him in August after the tender offer is paid out. 

He also said there will be 2 tender offers in 2026 so factor that into the pricing sheet.

column105:
Mark talked with DJ.  Carly was stuck and traffic and couldnt talk so, we are rescheduling. Carly likes to ask questions about her business to make sure she is doing it right. 

I ended up talking to DJ for a while.


I believe outstanding items are Carly Photography busines P&L and then she started as a realtor in 2024, sold 1 house, so need P&L for that business as well.

DJ emailed me his 1099 for 3PM for the income he recieved as a branch manager. We already have his W2. 

He will email me the HUD statement for the house they sold. I think we may already have the HUD from when they bought, we have the depreciation all set up.

Smalled talked about the twins he is having and they are in the process of building a brand new home. havent broken ground yet but they just finalized the plans, said his office got taken away form the plans to make room for the twins. Shot the shit about kids going back to school, his kids go back to school next week. 

Wants us to get out there to see a rockies game before the season is over. Might be time for a trip, did 3pm sign their new contract with Motta yet?

column105:
Caught up with Ryan (which I think the entire team heard) who was a referral from Russ Harvey.  They used to work together when Russ was at SpaceX and they still keep in touch.  He said he trusts Russ' recommendations and that we came highly endorsed (Thanks Russ!)

Ryan has the same situation as Russ (SpaceX Tender Offer is due 8/12) except he still works there so he usually gets what he asks for in the tender offer.  Russ doesn't work there anywhere and they are offering $1.5b so if there are more people who want to sell, Russ might not get the entire amount he asks for but Ryan will.  

Ryan had an accountant in California but they were taken out by the wildfires in the Palisades.  They got an extension due to the natural disaster but Ryan is not confident that the accountants will be able to file his taxes by October so he asked if we'd be able to help file his 2024 returns.  (Brian - Note that we need to request 2023 / 2022 because we are doing his 2024 return). 

He says he has about $2.5 in total shares (between RSU, ISO, and ESOP) with $2m vested.  He says this is about 80-90% of his net worth and with the favorable tender offer, he was looking to diversify out of his holdings so it's not so concentrated in 1 company.  He says he was thinking about a million dollars but that's because it was a nice round number.  

I brought up how we are doing almost the exact same exercise with Russ and also working with his Financial Planner to see if the amount that we are selling is the correct amount then his financial advisor will invest it into the proper portfolios.  

I brought up the financial planning aspect a couple of times and he brought that up and said he would also be interested in talking to a financial planner.   I said Mark will reach out soon to set up a call because it is somewhat important to understand before the Tender Offer Deadline.  

I think we have a request for Stock Comp so let's send him that with his 2025 work item.  His 2024 one will be plain vanilla I think.  


WORK ACTION ITEMS: 

1. Tax Prep for 2024 - Caroline
2. Tax Prep for 2025 - Caroline 
3. Financial Planning - Mark to reach out to Ryan post Thank you email to set up a meeting and see if $1m is the right number to sell.  I saw Brian already made this so great work! 
4. Tax Analysis (Stock comp Analysis) - Caroline / Dat to work on this similar to Russ' stock comp analysis.  
5. Tax Advisory & Estimates?
column109:
We can take a look at his income but I think this is a prime candidate for an Advisory contract off the bat.  

Mark and I talked about selling Tax / Financial Planning under the same umbrella to differentiate ourselves from the market but also because Tax Planning & Financial Planning are the same thing so it's an easier conversion from Tax to Wealth Mgmt. 

Mark, Caroline, and Brian to come up with a pricing sheet for Ryan and see how much the advisory fee will be.  He won't need Bookkeeping / Payroll but he'll need Financial Planning.

column105:
Dat & Caroline met with Tyler, Jason, and Joey to discuss Tyler's 2025 taxes and estimates. They only gave us two numbers - 1M of net business income and 120K salary (on the call they updated this to be 180K, I re-ran the calc and sent the updated sheet to dat on resource planning). 

We discussed retirement plan options for Tyler and he looped in his FA via email. Dat was suggesting doing a non-deductible IRA or back door roth contribution to try to diversify. Overall theres just not a whole lot of options for him to bring the tax bill down when he's making 1M of business income. 

To dos:
- Caroline to refresh the tax advsior estimate plan with the 180k salary and 110k payments made to date -> this is done and has been sent to dat for review on RP
- Dat to follow up on the FA's email chain with the retirement plan suggestions
column109: didnt bill for this, did the quick ten min calc to try to win a bigger estimate project from them but they had a 'it is what it is' mindset

column105:
Al and Manny called Mark. They had a few quick questions about paying themselves and employees.  They just got some additional cash form the Jaylen Brown foundation and wanted to pay their employees. All the employees mostly work on good faith right now. 

Manny went to the bank and pulled out cash.  3k for him, 3k for Al.  600 each for 4 employees and  3k to pay back Manny mom for paying their rent a while back. 

Discussed using checks in the future but Manny, didnt want to go back to the bank to deposit the money and write checks. I need to email them form W-9 for contractors to fill out and keep on file. 

They want to set up payroll in the next few months, mentioned Gusto to them. Highligted pricing said its around $500 to set up initially but monthly fee $50-100.  

They asked about paying they personal car insurance through the business, went over high level but need to follow up with details in email. 

Booked call with Manny to discuss his personal tax returns. 

Follow Up
1. Car Expenses Details - email
2. W9 Form - Email
3. Gusto Payroll info - Email

1040: Individual Return

Sch C: Self Employed
column105:
Caught with with Kara. So the old accountant did not respond to 3 of her emails then she finally proposed a time/date for a meeting and he accepted.  Then he Senior Prom'd her.  She said she also follows him on Instagram and says she sees him fishing by the lake everyday.  She says she knows that's important as well but not when you aren't fulfilling your professional duties.  Easiest close I've ever had.  Literally just wanted for other accountants to be ass and then they just come over.  EZ MONEY. 

She sent him a text that says she's transitioning to us because we offer payroll services as well as accounting so made more sense for her to go with us.  

[MAJOR KEY] I think if a client asks us what to say to the old accountant, pointing to our additional service offerings (cause most of our competition only does Bookkeeping or only does Taxes.. and most of them won't do payroll or financial planning).  

Talked to her about requests and it was a miscommunication on my end.  I thought she had filed her personal taxes but didn't report the Schedule C.  Turns out, she tried to file her taxes last year and got an error message.  She was hoping that the accountant could have remediated it but he hasn't done anything.  It's possible he hasn't done anything cause he's not an actual CPA.  

I think she's gotten a lot of sketchy advice (she asked about deduction the cost of baby sitters.. which I think she might be able to get away with since she has a business taking care of children) but she just wants us to take a look and make sure everything is on the up and up.  

Action Items: 

1.  She brought up that she was IMMEDIATELY overwhelmed by discovery requests because she didn't have her prior year taxes because of the filing error.  She also said that Caroline was saying a lot of "Tax Words" that overwhelmed her so think she's gonna be Caroline's Elly Schott.  (Sidenote, Matthew reached out to Elly/Ashley so I think they are off my back now.. shout out Matty).  

We need to send her (a) Instruction on how to set up an IRS Online Account (b) IRS Authorization (c) Instructions on how to approve (d) A separate email explaining this to her in really really simple manner.  

Once we get POA, we can pull all tax docs via ProConnect and see what's what.  

2. Accounting Team (Matty): She says she was gonna give him until Friday to remove her from the books and add us.  I said old accountants are A-holes all the time so we'd be able to piece it together without them.  After I said that, she said she might as well give us access tomorrow.  

She emphasized the Onboarding process so let's try to use this as an FGA with the Karbon Template and any tweaks to the process we've made to see additional holes in the Onboarding process.
column109:
Quotes (Brian O): Proposal already made.  Adjustment needed for prior year tax returns.

Brian to work with Caroline / Matty to update the initial proposal since there has been a bit of tweak.  I think this should be an FGA for the team to do a full Discovery Assessment so that we aren't under pricing the jobs.  This one is a bit limiting because I had already provided high level price ranges based on her profile ($100k Schedule C) but think there's some additional work on the tax side.  On the Accounting side, Matty to do a full assessment of the books to see what the Onboarding effort will be.  From the intro call, she seems like she has her stuff somewhat together but she also admits she doesn't know what she's doing.  Work items are: 

1. Onboarding (BKPG)
2. Onboarding (PYRL)
3. Bookkeeping (Monthly) 
4. Taxes (2023) - We might need 2022 as well but tbd.  
5. Taxes (2024)

Brian O to also draft an email with all of the Proposal links layed out.  I will review the email and you can send it to her with Me and Caroline CC'd.

column105:
This is an internal debrief regarding prep but I put together a summary (similar to Bennewies) but this is a little more spicy with the job change.  

I did all the calculations through ALFRED (link below and confirmed that Caroline could access it) but did a fill forecast on the following scenario: 

1. If he just liquidated the shares he owns (not likely but wanted to show the implications of just his Owned Shares in a silo).
2. #1 above and Loan Payoff of Equity Bee
3. #1 & #2 above and diversify out of 50% of SpaceX.

Did the analysis and pro forma tax forecast considering the taxes at the various income levels.  ALFRED also wrote memos for all of the scenarios.  

I also did a thorough review of his 2024 returns and something to be mindful of with our clients with a lot of Schedule D income is that the Capital Gains will be taxed at 20% but the total income will be added to the total "Adjusted Gross Income" number to determine tax rate.  Meaning if they made a W2 of $100k that would mean they are in the ~12% to ~18% bracket but if you consider the Capital Gains, their total income is $500k thus would be in the 35% bracket.  That means their W2 wages did not account for the investment income thus causing taxes not only on the investments but on total income.  



Action items: 

1. Attaching the memos (also in the GPT link) and some Verification Memos we did for Riley Harwood.  Basically just need to Copy & Paste the content so that the memo is in that template with the proper disclosures - [Caroline / Grace]

2.  Caroline to review the threads and we can finalize and send to Ross tomorrow prior to our meeting with him on Wednesday.  - [Caroline]

column109: One thing to note to the team is to make sure we understand the scope of the project before finalizing fees.  Think we already discussed this one but this is about a $2k job we did for $75.

column105:
Caught up with Riley about his sister who was widowed in February.  She's 42 with two daughters (one is almost 18 and one is a little younger).  Her late husband was an electrician in the IBEW union and she's a realtor with Keller Williams (See Kyleen Hawes -https://www.mowergroup.com/our_team).  

Riley said he had mental health issues and it was a tragic event but with some silver linings from what he was able to unpack.  I'll provide a separate Debrief on his financial planning but he is ELITE as far as personal finance.  When he got into her finances, he was very troubled. 

They had $170k in credit card debt and even with both their incomes, probably couldn't afford her mortgage.  Based on his assessment, her net worth was -$300k.  

Since February, he's gotten her almost out of debt with $30k in the back which he promised her when he started on this financial journey with her.  He has access to all her bank accounts and tracked/reconciled all her spending.  Also broke it down to do an analysis.  His conclusion, not enough money coming in and a lot of unnecessary spending going out.  

He had a bunch of questions around the various lump sums of income (Death Benefit, Charity funds, Social Security, etc.) which I researched and put below.  

Also replied to Riley with the research in lieu of a "Thank You" email.  We'll be working with Riley on this one and he says it's for our benefit.  He says he loves her to death but there's a lot of reasons why it's better off if he helps provides documents and stuff.  I think we still technically need her to sign for stuff (tax return, etc.) but for now, we're just doing some tax forecasting.  They are still not making barely any money so there's some planning to be done.  

I did some internet searching cause I got some of her details (Name, Job, company, town) and found her contact info so updated her Karbon contact with that.  

I also sent out requests for tax docs as well.  


ALFRED GPT: https://chatgpt.com/share/e/6883f67b-cadc-8000-a943-55625c02eb04

ALFRED RESEARCH SUMMARY: 

Client Tax Summary – 2025 Tax Year
Client: The Hawes Family (Kyleen Hawes, Widow)
Prepared By: ALFRED Ai | Motta Financial
Date: July 25, 2025

Family Overview
- Filing Status: Head of Household (widowed with two dependent daughters)
- Dependents: Two minor children (one identified as Cora)
- Year of husband’s passing: Within two years prior to 2025 home sale
Income Overview
1. Self-Employment Income (Kyleen)
- Amount: ~$70,000 (real estate 1099 income)
- Tax Impact:
•	  • Subject to self-employment tax (~$10,710 est.)
•	  • Eligible for SE-related deductions (e.g., home office, mileage, SEP IRA)
•	  • May be liable for quarterly estimated payments
2. Social Security Benefits – Children
- Cora: $24,000 in benefits (likely not taxable)
- Second child: $14,000 in benefits (likely not taxable)
- Benefits are the child’s income and not taxable to Kyleen unless the child has other income
Non-Wage Lump-Sum Receipts
Summary of lump-sum receipts and their tax treatment:
Source	Amount	Tax Treatment
IBEW Union Death Benefit	$5,000	Non-taxable (not from pension)
Other Union Death Benefit	$5,000	Non-taxable (similar treatment)
IBEW Cares / KW Cares	$10,000	Not taxable (hardship reimbursement)
GoFundMe Campaign	$26,000	Not taxable (personal gifts)
Sale of Primary Residence
- Gain Realized: $185,000
- Owned and occupied for 4 years
- Sold within 2 years of spouse’s death
- Full $185,000 gain excluded under IRS §121 (widow exception up to $500,000)
- No capital gains tax due
Recommendations
•	• Document everything: SSA-1099s, GoFundMe campaign, funeral reimbursements, sale documents
•	• Track self-employment deductions and consider a SEP IRA or Solo 401(k)
•	• Make quarterly estimated tax payments due to 1099 income
•	• Monitor any additional earned income for either child (may trigger filing)
Filing Snapshot (Estimated)
- Filing Status: Head of Household
- Dependents: 2
- SE Tax Liability: ~$10,710
- Capital Gains Tax: $0
column109: Pro Bono. I think we still need a proposal but I haven't got the green light to communicate with his sister so I'll talk to Riley about that.

column105: Spoke with Amir today to go through our current active N Financial clients.  In the process, got an update from AJ (also owner of Ola Mate), that he will be officially launching Scordio Productions as of 8/1.

I talk to Jenna all the time but she brought up that she's in a lot of credit card debt.  When she first graduated, she moved to San Fran to work for the Athletics then the team was relocating and laid everyone off basically.  She then was unemployed and bounced around jobs for a little in 2024 (as we've seen with all the W2s) including having to live in LA for a few months which she also had to pay for with Credit Cards.  

She was pretty anxious about it but I assured her that there's no judgement here.  She is also not good with all this finance stuff.  

I'll attach the text chain but I will most likely just work through her budget with her and potentially some credit card consolidation loans potentially.  She might have a few 401ks out there so she'll most likely be a financial planning client as well. 

If/when Cary and Jenna get married, it'll be super easy to already have their assets under 1 household.  

I'll handle this one and potentially hand off to Mark (similar to Cary but maybe earlier in the process).
column109:
Doing this Pro Bono - This is Dre's girlfriend so I consider this helping Cary.  I'm also a huge fan of Jenna because she doesn't make me feel like a third wheel whenever I'm hanging out with them.  

Also similar to how when we first started doing taxes, we did a bunch of "Low Risk for No Money FGAs" to get our reps up with tax prep.. I consider MWM in the same stage right now and think the FGAs we have taken (most recent example with Cary) are good reps to take in this area.  

From a firm perspective, I think we need to think about the "Tax Prep to Tax Planning to Financial Planning" process.  Mark and I were talking about making merging those two services under the same roof so Tax Planning can say it includes Financial Planning and Financial Planning can say it includes Tax Planning which will allow us to charge more and make us a superior product in the market.

column105:
Got a LinkedIn message from Stan Lesy (I put the screenshot of the message in a note in the Karbon Work Item) who is looking to connect and I'm not sure what.  Guessing taxes but he works in Investment Banking now and asked about our accounting platform so idno. 

Added his contact into Karbon and his LinkedIn Profile.  His email was on his LinkedIn so added that as well but I don't have any other details around him. 

I met him when I was at WilliamsMarston and on a consulting project for Steward Medical.  He was there for less than 2 weeks and from what I remember, he only took the job to get the M&A industry job title on his resume for another opportunity which he got.  I didn't really get to interact with him much but if that's how he treated the Steward opportunity, it doesn't necessarily tell me he's a loyal teammate so if it's for a job... that'll be a hard pass.  Put out good film, folks! 

I sent him my Calendly so we'll see if he turns into a Prospect but adding my notes on him for now.  Brian O - Add him as a lead in RP 2026.

Caught up with Riley but specifically about his sister (Might be Sister-In-Law but I'm pretty sure sister) recently lost her husband unexpectedly.  Brad / Riley both took it pretty hard and they have two young children so super tragic in general.  I think he was late 30's or early 40's I want to say.  

She's a realtor but I gathered that she only did it part time because of the kids and he was in the electrical union.  

Riley says he's been supporting them financially and that him/Brad split the cost of the funeral because she wasn't going to be able to afford it.

Riley reached out to ask about Death Benefit proceeds from the Electrical Union.  It'll be $10,500 paid out in two payments.  I did ALFRED research which I'll paste below but usually Life Insurance proceeds aren't taxed if the policy was paid for with after tax dollars (i.e. if you buy a policy yourself).  If you get a Group Life Policy through work, those are usually with Pre Tax dollars thus the Death Benefit would be taxable.  

Death Benefit from an electrical union is usually paid for by the members with union dues thus would not be taxable.  I relayed that to him but also asked for the policy or any letter they got to confirm that.  

Riley says she's a realtor and does her own taxes but it gets cumbersome.  I offered to help with the Bookkeeping / Taxes for her (potentially some Financial Planning) to take that off her plate.  I'm talking to him Friday 7/25 to talk through and confirm but lead for now.
column109: Pro Bono work. Brad / Riley Harwood have treated me like family since I moved to Vegas and it breaks my heart to hear about their sister struggling financially because of an unexpected death.

column105:
Caught up with Cary who has had a frustrating week.  When he was home in LA, he asked his parents about his student loans per Mark's request and uncovered some really bad news.  

The original loan was for $125k and he's been paying $1021 per month since May of 2016 (roughly $110k) but the principal is still at $88k.  He was expecting it to be in the 40s.  

The problem is that it was a private student loan and the interest rate is 8.47% (yikes!!) so most of his payments have been going towards interest.  

I used ALFRED (AnyQuest) to research how much he would have saved if he refinanced to market rates years ago and the principal would estimates would be around what he thought (~$40k).  

He said he almost broke something when he found out about this.  He vented about how he knew his parents aren't the best with finances but he was legit angry when he found out about this.  

ALFRED provided some refinancing options but note for Mark to work with him about refinancing those ASAP.  I put the research in the task on the work item. Also attached the paper statement he provided from his dad.

He also said that in talking to his parents, they still have a mortgage of over a million dollars on their home in LA.   He was shocked because they bought the place in 2000 for $300k.  They also just a MAJOR addition to the home when he was in middle school and I'm not sure how much that was for but it seems high.  I think we need to take a look at all of their finances.

Note for Mark they will need a full fee based financial plan.  Friends and Family but when Eric asked me to help with Taxes he wanted to pay for our services because it's business.  They will get favorable pricing cause they are essentially my new family but think this will be a decent amount of clean up.  

MOST IMPORTANTLY: Shout out to the Big Boy, Mark Dwyer for uncovering this.  Shows the value of working with a legit Financial Planner who will force the client to do a full analysis and uncover stuff like this.  Admittedly when I was doing some informal financial planning with him, the student loans wasn't something I really dug into but good job Mark looking into this.  If he found Motta 10 years ago, it would have saved him about $40k in interest.  Think about the opportunities there are out there with situations like this.  I'd say that's making and impact..

I was going to prep this one with Grace but Sol wanted to talk about it so I just prepped it and recorded a loom.  10/10 documentation if you ask me although I wanted to use this one as a walkthrough with Grace but there will be more and Caroline will be back at that point so maybe she can teach her.  

Anyways... 

You can get the full brief in the loom but basically he sold out of his 401k from the Brooklyn Nets in order to pay for the move to Las Vegas.  He was explaining how moving was a gigantic leap for him and he had to sell his car / get out of his lease for the job (and related move).  

I'm guessing that he didn't get the 1099R at the end of the year because he was in Las Vegas at that point.  It wasn't anywhere on his Tax Return so guessing it never got to his aunt thus never got on his tax return.  

I pulled the penalty and also the reported 1099s from ProConnect (pretty cool feature) and re-did the tax return.  I need to clean it up a bit but think it's like 90% done.  

One thing that was weird was that the IRS letter said he didn't report this Student Loan Interest Deduction but I see it on his tax return.  It's possible that when it was filed, the EIN or Name didn't match up but I think we have to look into that more.  

Action items are for Grace to draft an IRS Abatement Letter for Sol to get back Interest & Penalties if possible.  We'll need to attached the tax return as well as our calcs (including the student loans that I think they have wrong).  

Grace / Brian to watch the Loom and also find time on my calendar tomorrow to go through.  There are some details to clean up but I can talk through it and maybe finish it.  

It'll most likely take a few months between MAILING them the letter & return, hearing back from them, seeing what the net balance due would be, then Sol can pay that amount off.  We can bill him once we mail the letter out even though this project isn't "Done" until we pays off the balance technically.  We aren't waiting 3 months to bill on this.
column109:
He asked if he's paid us or not and said he thought he did but wanted to make sure he did.  

He admits he's been busy with work and he moves into his new house tomorrow along with this stuff so "he has a lot of balls in the air".  

Not too worried about the payment but if we can check in on that.  I'm thinking it was the deposit and he owes the rest upon completion so we'll bill the rest once we draft the letter but confirm that.

column105:
Max called me because he was getting a weird Auto Reply from Mark that had no information in it so he wasn't sure if Mark was still with the firm.  

He wants to start an LLC because he's come across a couple of opportunities to do (1) Financial Literally for a Media company (2) Corporate Mental Health for some firm.


He is looking for: 

1. Single Member LLC with no Operating Agreement.  

2. Registered Agent Services: He wants to use our business address.  

He basically just needs the business registered so that he can get an EIN cause he's hoping to open up a bank account by Friday.  

He asked about cost and said he wants the most basic set up possible.  I said Registered Agent is around $100 per year and that LLCs are usually $500 - $750 (basically the state registration fees and the IRS fees to get an EIN which can vary by state and entity type).  I said if he wanted an Operating Agreement that will range from $800 to $1500 because a lawyer drafts those.  It's a Single Member LLC and he wanted to keep costs as low as possible so basically just Business Registration (under Motta address) and an EIN. 

One thing is that he's a Colorado guy but his client identifier is MA.  Let's check is address and do a full scrub of his Karbon contact as well.  

Brian O to create the additional work item (I'm tagging this to is 2025 tax return for now) and draw up the proposal.  We can walk through how to do LLCs in the morning and record it for training purposes.  

I think there's a work template for Entity Formation and also a template for Discovery Requests as well so Brian O to send those out after he creates the work item.
column109:
See above.  Let's do: 

Registered Agent Services: $99

Entity Formation: $750 discounted down to $550.

column105:
Went to Kenny & Lauren Cottrell's daughter (Kennedy's) second birthday party.  I intended to go in there, have some cake and go home, 1-2 hours tops.  I was there for about 4 hours because Kenny kept introducing me to his friends as his CPA and then they asked a bunch of tax questions.  This is why I tell people I'm an accountant, then they don't want to talk to you.  

One of the people I met with Rony Delgarde who is in the same Doctorate program at UNLV with Kenny but a year earlier.  He has a Non Profit that he's been running for a long time where they take paint from people's garage and from commercial projects and send them to Africa.  The 501c3 is called Global Paint for Charity.  

I added Karbon Contacts and LEAD work items in Karbon.  Brian O to add them as Prospects in RP 2026.   

He took a picture of my business card so I'm sure he'll be reaching out soon.  He was floored because Kenny used to be his CPA before Kenny got his license revoked and said he was super impressed with Kenny's work so how good am I where I'm Kenny's accountant and he says I'm the best.  

At one point, they looked at each other like "Yeah, I think this guy can help us" so think they'll be coming our way for taxes with the upside of other accounting services + business development.  

The guy was a big fan of me in general and kept on dapping me up.  He was a little drunk I think.  His fiance was also there and I talked to her for a little bit because she didn't want to talk about work.  They are getting married in Lake Como (Italy) this year or next year I think although I don't think they have anything planned yet..

Met with Hunter Romano and got access to Pageport for Motta Wealth Management. They walked me through how to use the CRM.  It has some pretty cool features and they want feed back and are willing to implement and work on improvements you recommend.  Pageport is still in beta.

They are working on building out the pre-built agent library that you can choose to activate for your practice or not. You can also manually build your own agents if you want to but they are happy to build them for you currently. 

Mark needs to get all the wealth management leads into pageport.  They dont have a way to do bulk upload currently from excels or anything but still offered to manually help with the process. Not an issue for MWM as we dont have a massive pipeline but could be a lot of leg work for Accounting database. Im sure we could figure a work around but currently only sync of with 1 or 2 CRMs for mass uploads of data.

Had our Bi -weekly seed Director Call it was Mark, Nick and Chris Hill. We went over the class format for the first 6 weeks in detail, how we will be breaking up in student groups.

Each director will have 2 teams that they will be in charge of managing the client calls and work.  Nick cant be on every call this semester not scalable. 

Chris went over marketing videos he will be creating for SEED,  5 part video series. Also, will be working with that ladys marketing firm to help create social medie presence for SEED.  They will be SEED students that will be in charge of running the social media each semester. I recommended this would be an easier way to integreated AI  as well.  Could have the students create a social media agent.

Mark met with Cary, finalized the Whole Life insurance, he is purchased from his Aunt Gaye. He provided some updated numbers for his bank accts checking and savings. 

He paid of his car already, but just went over the rational for paying down debt if possible.  He is going to get me the details for his student loans, says he pays about a 1k month currently in student, loans so going to review that decide what to do with some extra cash he has on the sidelines right now, most likely either pay down debt or add it to his money market acct, he wants to maintain liquidity for real estate opportunities in the future.

Small talked, he was out in LA for a 30th birthday, so was going to be haning out with friends all weekend and than going to Dodgers game on Monday, got some great sets from his company behind the dugout.

Dave called me at 5:30 AM on a Saturday with some Tax questions.  He finally filed his taxes and moving his Bookkeeping over to his mom.

As he's stated earlier this year, he is moving his taxes over to us.  He sent me his personal / business tax returns.  I'll also send an "Intro email" with the team and we can request access to his QBO accounts.  

I put together a Tax Plan for him based on our conversation.  Model FA is growing FAST, he says he averages $80k a month in sales and hopes to get to over $100k per month by the end of the year.  He projects that he'll make a million dollars so wants to start planning.  

I did a full review of his tax return and inputted 2023, and 2024 into ProConnect in order to generate a tax plan.  He had his businesses as Schedule C's but also SCorps which I found weird but also think the SCorp election is applicable for all entities.  

He should pay himself a salary and he said he's not sure if Kennedy is going to work once the Baby is born on 9/1 but he wants to pay her out of his business so she can still contribute to a Solo 401k.  He also wants to do a Solo 401k so incorporated that into the tax plan.  

He's made great money over the past couple of years but he's also purchased a giant house on the water in St. Pete's with a ton of renovations and also tons of expenses for the baby but that's just about wrapped up so he's looking to buy some stuff to treat himself... but with business purposes. 

He's going to look at a Mercedes G-Wagon (over 6k pounds) today so we talked through the Section 179 expense on that.  He has a Mercedes S Class or something and he was going to trade it in but might keep it.  I told him if the G-Wagon is 100% business than the Section 179 is applicable and having a Personal Vehicle helps with that.  He says the G-Wagon is 88 inches high and his garage is only 84 inches so he's most likely going to keep both cars with the G-Wagon being solely for business. 

He said he's also starting to look at Yachts worth around $1 million dollars.  He has a dock at his house and has always wanted a Yacht so that he looks like a baller.  He grew up boating with his dad as well and said this has always been on his bucket list.  

He says he wants to hold Model FA events on the boat where he'll charge $5k for clients to come on the boat for a weekend and they'd go to a hotel and have Mastermind / Work sessions.  He said hopefully doing that well help pay for part of the boat and if he does that, he can deduct part of the expenses of the boat as business expenses.  He does hold events like that with the FAs, CPAs, Lawyers, that he works with so having it on a Yacht isn't out of the norm for him. 

I left the note in Karbon but Brian O to create all his businesses and related work items for David, Kennedy, and all their businesses.
column109:
Can we create a Pricing Sheet for all of his tax Prep? 

His mom will be doing his bookkeeping but he'll need Tax Prep for 1040c, SCorp, 1065, and Tax Planning.  

Initially I'm thinking $150 per month.  Gross prices for Tax Prep is $2,500 - $3,000 alone without planning but thinking between $150 and $200 per month is the right price. 

Dave won't care whatever we charge him but he's provided a 10/10 business development network for us and has helped us a lot.  

He also said Motta can use the Yacht in exchange for these services.  I'm making it clear to Brian O specifically that this is a Motta plug, not his personal plug unless he can generate enough income to merit a personal trip on the Yacht.

column105:
Boris is someone I hired back at Outseer who worked on the AP and Procurement side.  Basically his job was the "Purchases and Payables" business cycle where he managed Outseer vendors, invoices that needed payment, etc. I know he worked a lot with Eben because COGs was a mess with the software.  

He was laid off recently and asked me for a recommendation for jobs he's applying to.  I needed a work item to tag it to so figured that I'd enrich the Karbon Client Contact.  

Consider it a lead for now, only action item is for Brian O to add to RP 2026.  Added the contact with Email, Phone, and socials.  I don't think there's a client folder for this one yet either.

Caught up with Ross about Russ' tender offer with SpaceX (I added attachments to the Debrief so I'll attach all the relevant docs there).  

Basically we want to build something similar to the Bennewies Stock Comp example.  He has $6.4 million worth of stock with a basis of $350k.  He does have a $600k loan that is triggered that he would have to pay back.  He has a portion of the shares he outright owns and a big chunk that was financed.  

In speaking with Russ, he wants to start to diversify because he's highly concentrated in SpaceX (and from what Ross says, he kind of hates Elon) and wants to liquidate 50% of his shares.  He also got a pretty good tender offer so it'll be a good opportunity for it.  They are at the mercy of SpaceX and the leadership (i.e. Elon) can be mercurial so wanted to sell off so reduce long term risk in a lot of ways.  

He sent us most of the info but we're going to build a Stock Comp Analysis for this tender offer at 50% and also some scenarios (although the current plan is to keep the remaining 50% he has at SpaceX) and also take a look at which shares he should sell if he does sell.  

Ross also says he has able $6.5k in taxable losses from distributions from his brokerage.  He hasn't started his new job so he's been pulling from his savings to sustain life over the past few months.  I think it would have been awkward if we sent the proposals at that point.  He would have paid it, but think it was a better client experience to hold off.  

Caroline is on vacation so I'm going to play ISO ball on this one, call it special teams.
column109:
This is a full stock comp analysis and ross client.  It's going to be a lot of work but also don't think Russ has a Advisory relationship with us (yet) so I think we'll just roll it into that.  

We might have a Tax estimates proposal to him so we can just count this towards that.

column105:
Dat and Caroline met with Cam to go over LLC formation options to ultimately build his own 'death star'. Cam wanted to open up three more LLCs but it seemed excessive so we talked to him to explain that we could re-purpose his Renegade Racing Dynamics LLC (not sure the status of it but he said he opened it himself in VA) to be Renegade Sports and then have the wakeskate, marine detailing, and cars under this LLC. Eventually he'll have a topco holding company that holds this LLC, then a contracting branch and a real estate branch. More to come on that front as he grows and adds more businesses etc.

To do's:
- Caroline waiting on VA SoS login to go into his account and see the status on this LLC. Then I'll be able to restructure it
- Eventually: Dat and Caroline to develop a plan for the rest of the business structure, including renegade contracting and other entities
column109: Advisory relationship so Dat and I discussed that for any additional LLC's he opens, or for general LLC fillings - he'll pay us the cost of those fillings and our time spent doing them will be 'free' aka wrapped into his monthly advisory fee
