During the mortgage process, Meredith said one of the things that failed them was that Cole got income from one of the businesses but Joey never filed the 1099 so that caused a bunch of issues.  Cole also said he doesn't think the guy is taking any deductions for the farm equipment because another red flag was that they didn't see depreciation on the return.  Terrible.  

They need tax prep (and potentially PY clean up but 2024 first) but they were going to need to get extended anyways.   Joey usually doesn't file their taxes until the fall (extension deadline) so their one of those people who have to extend cause they're waiting on K1's.  

From a 1040 standpoint, they are just 4 K1's (basically 1 Schedule E) so their actual indy is easy but there will be some clean up and the variable is what Joey is doing with the businesses.  Because he always did the business AND personal, they've never seen a K1 ever.  It honestly wouldn't be surprising if he's embezzling money but that's a big accusation.  

GlowCo will need an SCorp business return and the Compost business.  They said they both have QBO and I sent them instructions for them to provide us access.  Joey is currently the accountant on it and she didn't want to remove him until we talked but she's probably going to do so shortly.  She hates this guy.  They are actually in a blood feud because they won't pay the invoice for his "Consulting Fees" for his help for their failed mortgage attempt.  I told them that he legally has to give him those documents I think but we will also request POA to pull what we can on our side.  

I think this is a "peel back the onion layers" client and the upside is that we are able to get 4 business clients from this guy.  This is a 3PM referral so Financial Planning upside as well.  


Action Items

[1] - Brian O to create all the businesses from the 2023 tax return in Karbon.  I think we're at least going to do their 1040 and GlowCo or whatever which I think is an SCorp. I don't know what the other ones are (1065 v SCorp) but those are prospects for now.

[2] - Caroline to request POAs for both of them and also create 2848s for the businesses.  This will be a large poop clean up project.  

[3] - Proposal for 1040 Schedule E.  Think that is around $700 or so.  

[4] - Proposal for SCorp (GlowCo) 

[5] - Potentially an SCorp for Compost

All of these will be extensions but we'll need a deposit!

Talked to Mikey briefly, he was super grateful for me being so flexible with him.  He's essentially in Banking / iBanking so the tariffs have caused chaos on his side.  Their deals are based on the market and highly dependent on interest rates so all of this is blowing up a bunch of his deals.  

He's all in on the Backdoor IRA and essentially is on the side of "I don't know about any of this shit so here are the keys" and asked what he needed to provide us and I said because he does his taxes with us, we already already have everything.. I just needed his approval to launch.  He said "Ohh.. Yeah obviously, do whatever".  I opened a MM, Traditional, and Roth IRA.  The plan is to put $7k into the traditional and immediately convert to a ROTH.  I said he'd get an email to connect his bank account and he said once he gets it, he'll probably call me (the kid is a very smart kid but this is not his world at all).  

Debriefed Dwyer on this and Dwyer will most likely need a Risk Profile before we invest into anything (it's all in cash right now, the purpose was to open the account to get the tax deduction).  You're welcome for the AUM

Now I know ya'll are thinking to yourselves, why did D-Le do a $250 CPA letter in the middle of tax season? 

Tyler sent me an email on the side that they just started working with this Mortgage Origination team (Similar to 3PM but I think they are bigger? Idno) but Meghan also called me to say that Motta had "Saved the Day" and the loan was processed.  The Mortgage team was super happy about it and Meghan said the letter was "Perfect" and that she's going to introduce us to their team cause they were already highly impressed.  

I explained to her how we usually work with the 3PM team in a similar capacity and she said that's good to know because she has not found a good CPA to work with on mortgages.  It's been a tremendously good referral channel for us and it's not like they are doing us a favor.. they just need a good one and can't find one anywhere.  

She said she was super super grateful and if there was anything that we needed to give her a good.  Think we got some goodwill in case anyone on our team is looking to buy some property... hit up our folks at Hancock! 

Brian O to add those guys (as well as the Mortgage company) into Karbon as I would anticipate a potential 3PM level referral channel.

Caroline, Mark & Andrew met with Ariel and Ryan Richards to go over their tax returns. They mainly just wanted to check in because of the swing of owing tax to now getting a refund because Ryan's withholdings were left off draft #1. They're good with everything and going to be signing tonight.

Ariel wants to do quarterly estimates based on actuals with how her business is doing, so we'll need to create a proposal for this. It wont be a big lift because its one entity, id assume $150-300 each quarter? lmk thoughts.

caught up with Camille on the phone - she was just wondering how they should fill out their W-4s to avoid owing tax next year. I sent her a Karbon request to get their current W-4s and said we would review and let them know how to adjust them.

side note - she just became an attorney (she was a law clerk before) so her income is going from 64k to 110k in 2025.

Talked to Stephanie and Phil (who is CC'd on the emails so add him to Karbon and the work item) but they are referrals from Ross but only recently started working with him.  They've had bad FAs in the past so think it helped to get our endorsement.  They said they sold their house in Austin to move to Colorado and the FA told them about the 1031 exchange but they didn't qualify for the 2/5 rule so they got slapped with a $49k tax bill.  Told them about the benefits of us working with Ross to make sure they've got their bases covered.  

She said they were pretty straight forward but I'm confident they are going to be complicated.  I briefed Caroline & OCP on it briefly.  Brian O also helped do some research because Ross emailed us beforehand with the questions, Brian O researched it, then I used the research in Rizz form in order to close the client.  10/10 team effort there.  

So she's W2 and her husband is from the UK (cool accent) and he just started a business that he says is 1 LLC (4 owners) and the "takeaway" (British version of take out) portion of the restaurant is open with the rest of it opening in July.  Brian O I think we're going to need a 1065 for the business... I think he put it in the name of the restaurant in the intake form. 

Another complication is that his dad died 3 years ago and from the UK and I don't think ever had a SSN in the US although he had a property and bank accounts here.  They just sold the house but can't get the payout because the company needs a SSN.  We need to get a W7 (which Brian O researched) and think it'll get spicy because his sister is the executor so she'll need to sign the W7 / POA based on my research.. which I'll also post.  

Caroline / Brian to work together to get the full requests and quote out.  I think for everything related to the W7 it would be like $1500 or something.  That's not including prep.  We need to build a request list for the W7 and also the service in ignition.  Also need to get doc requests out for the businesses and indy.  I remember Caroline saying that we're probably not done with business returns and she is correct.

Talked to Jonathan who indirectly works with Clinton.  He was actually heading out to go grab lunch with him because Jonathan works with VAs and has a team in southeast Asia (I think the Phillipines or Indonesia) because that's where they met while they were on their mission.  

Sidenote, I plugged Indochino as well.  

He is 1099 with Clinton but also he said he was doing a thing where he would open Bank Accounts / Credit Cards for the bonuses so he has a bunch of 1099s for $200 - $600 dollars...wtf? 

He said he stopped doing that but he started trading Pokemon cards which he alledgedly keeps good track of.  

I'm not sure how many Schedule C's this is, anywhere from 1-3.  The issue is that Clinton said it would be like $150 which is not the case.  I said we'd request full documents and send a proposal at that point.  

I gotta get to prepping so Brian O to send out full document requests and draft a proposal.  He said he was going to get to the documents this weekend... I told him I can't guarantee he doesn't get extended.

Caroline went through 2025 Q1 estimates with Antonio Parks. He is really trying to learn all that he can and stay on top of these things with estimated payments and check ins. He had some sticker shock with Q1 so i walked him through how i calculated the numbers. it all made sense to him and the large SE tax is influencing his desire to switch to S-Corp this year. He is going to pay 1/2 of my calculated numbers since he doesn't have a lot in the business account and we figure the tax will decrease with s-corp switch and I told him we can always make up for it in Q2/Q3/Q4 as we go if things start to rapidly increase. he also moved from Utah to Montana so thats a change. He is also going to spending a lot of time overseas this year.

He asked about retirement options - i told him theres a self employeed retirement option for him since hes self employed and told him mark is the expert there and has set them up before so he is going to schedule a meeting w/ mark to discuss those options. He had a question too on quickbooks and having an investment/trading account for the company and he wanted to know how to get that to work within quickbooks so i said I'd connect him with Andrew for help on that.

He wants to make the switch to s-corp this year and we walked through the salary piece again - he asked if we would tell him a number and i told him that would definitely be something we can calculate together and analyze from how much his business continues to grow this year. i also told him that we can help with the payroll set up etc.

he is definitely someone who will be growing with us and we will continue to have more services to offer him.

Action Items:
- Caroline to send revised estimated payments to Antonio
- Caroline to send an email to Antonio, Mark, and Andrew to start the conversation around retirement options and his quickbooks questions on how to integrate all of that

Caught up with Tristan briefly on what he's doing with the market uncertainty.  I'm asking this because our Financial Planning client, Cary Jacobson, has about $1k a month to invest and he wants to start diversifying and getting into the market.  I think it's a perfect time to start to DCA into the market.  

Talked through the portfolio I built ("Dat's Picks" in Altruist) which is basically my brokerage account but modified to be a little heavier in SPY (S&P 500) and Bonds/Muni's.  

He said one of the funds that's a staple for him lately is the Fidelity Blue Chip Growth ETF cause it has all the 'Magnificent Seven' tech stocks (Meta, Apple, nVidia, etc.) and the fees are super low on it.  It's also an ETF so a lot safer.  Swapped out the Vanguard Large Cap ETF for that one and also lowered the allocations for the M7 stocks.  

Tristan is a "Money Manager" which is under the wealth management umbrella like Mark but as a CFP, the focus is on planning and long term plans vs Money Managers are people who manage Brokerage Accounts for High Net Worth Individuals.  Like our client has $1k per month to put into a brokerage account which might be $50k total AUM.  Tristan is working with $1 - $50m client brokerage accounts that he manages on a daily basis.  He says his firm doesn't do a great job of making their clients aware that they also do Financial Planning (i.e. Managing the clients entire portfolio and not just the brokerage accounts) but his current shop lacks awareness.  He's looking to hit free agency soon and will be looking to move his book of business somewhere.

Talked to Jared briefly.  He says he probably won't buy a house until next year (this is due to the market being down LOL) but the original plan was to minimize deductions cause he'd need the income (Self Employed) but he's punting on that.

Cary Jacobson's 1040 will need to be SUPERCEDED.  I talked to him on Sunday 4/6 about some personal financial planning as well as the Back Door ROTH for 2024 and 2025.  He's got a 19% tax bracket right now and due for a promotion (as well as his income trending upwards for 2025 but still relatively low) so I think this super makes sense for him.  

We went through his current 401k withholdings, his budget from a Cash Flow / Total Income perspective.  He's paid quarterly commissions which makes up a bulk of his income so a little more involved of a budgeting exercise than a typical W2.  He also had about $140k in a savings account so he's looking to see how to allocate that.  He's just starting to see his income jump so he wants to make sure he's doing all the right things.  

For him, he's a "Single, High W2" and starting to diversify with things like a home purchase in 2024.  The Backdoor ROTH will look a lot better in a few years when he's in the 30% tax bracket and he has a Post Tax Asset in his portfolio that was taxed at 19%.  He transferred $14k from his Wells Fargo Savings to his Altruist MM account in order to make Non Deductible IRA contributions of $7k for 2024 and $7k for 2025.  I think Mark has to do this and also get compliance stuff if we're going to invest it into anything.  

He also transferred another $40k into the Money Market cause it earns a lot more than his WF Savings account but he really wants to start dripping that into the market.  I told him it's a good position to be in for entering the market but I'm loyal to the "Dollar Cost Average" principle and talked him through some of the vanilla funds I'm in (Basically Mutual Funds and ETFs that are tied to S&P, Crypto (XRP), and Rates/Commodities as a hedge.  I'm sure there has to be a risk profile for the brokerage as well.  I'll talk to him tonight about starting to get some recurring trades going but think he's looking to invest around $1k per month into the market.  In 2-3 years.. that's going to look soooooooo much better.  

He's going to move forward with Life Insurance that Gaye (His aunt and our FA partner kind of) had presented him a $1k per month WL policy which I thought made sense.  Decently aggressive but he can afford it and think that it's similar to the ROTH where this will create another Tax-Friendly Asset in his portfolio to make him more flexible in a few years.  I said he should just do a Annual Pay because he usually has a good buffer in his savings from his quarterly commission checks but his Paycheck is only on his base so doing Annual Pay will help from a monthly cash flow perspective.  

He did ask if the Altruist MM would be able to pay bills.  I checked briefly and I don't think it can but Mark might know something that I don't.  

From a tax prep standpoint, we just need to supercede the return and add the [1] Contribution to IRA (Non-Deductible) [2] Distribution / Rollover into a ROTH IRA.  Basically on the 1040 it should say IRA Distributions on the front of the 1040 for $7k but the Taxable Amount should be $0.  

I think it makes sense for Mark to take the reigns on this one for compliance reasons.  I know there's a lot of documentation necessary so think safer to have the CFP do it.

Talked to Bill Whitesell who is Prospect Ed Whitesell's (who was my landscaping guy) dad.  He has already gotten his taxes prepped but saw a big number so needed a second opinion of sorts.  Didn't see any numbers so kind of just gave him a high level overview of what might have happened.  I need some more work done on my backyard so hopefully getting some discounted services out of it and a LOMAR prospect in 2025.  Not a ton of upside but call it a 6th round pick that can turn into a 5th.  

He's retired and got about $100k of earned income between SS, IRAs, Pensions, etc. but they also sold about $400k of stocks this year where he said he withheld about $80k (~20% cap gains).  He thought that was enough but his CPA is saying he owes another $30k.  My first thought was that the CPA missed ST vs LT but feel like if he got another $400k of income that his tax bill would look a lot larger than that.  My guess is that the $400k moved him up a few tax brackets thus his withholdings on the other stuff was too low so the tax bill is driven on that.  It makes sense, $100k and going from the 12% to 32% or 35% bracket will hit you quick.  Should have talked to an accountant beforehand.. 

Gave him my email and said we'd take a look once he gets the return back from the CPA and he said he'd come to us next year but we'll see about that.  

I'll pin communications to the timeline and put under "Lost - Timing" but should be a client in 2025. No proposal needed.

Talked to David & Amira for about an hour to sort through all of his taxes.  ALFRED said that it would be unlikely that he would get equity for $0 but that's exactly what happened because he was one of the early founders of BodyArmor.  He has received K1's from them until 2021 when they were acquired by Coca Cola.  He said at the time they specifically told him to get a CPA because this was not a straightforward situation which he tried to do but the guy was ass.  

He's not the most organized person in the world so I'm not sure that the CPA understood that David was an owner of BodyArmor not an employee with stock comp.  He sent us all of those documents (like.. ALL of the documents including the sale agreement between Coca Cola & Body Armor) and I prepped it on Friday.  

David also had a CPA tell him to buy an Escalade for Highlite Media Group LLC (which I guess he started in like 2017 or something) when Coke bought BA but then he got a new Financial Advisor who was also a tax prepper and the person didn't let him write it off because it wasn't registered in the business and he also said the expenses were too high for so little income because he also has a W2 income (even then he was technically self employed because it was essentially SE with W2 salary).  If you know David you will know why this next part is entertaining but he was SUPER upset because he bought the Escalade literally on 12/31 so that he can get the tax break for it (Coke bought BA in November) and they didn't have the trim and sound system he wanted LOL.  David always wants the top best of everything and annoyed that this Escalade didn't have a Sun Roof and stuff like that.  Side note, that CPA was also wrong because he actually needed a vehicle over 6k pounds to carry DJ equipment around and he was doing higher class events which would deem it "Ordinary and necessary" for the business.  Just bad CPA advice all around.  

I redid the return and he's probably getting about $30 - $40k back.  I'm not sure if I did the amendment correctly so Caroline to review what I prepped for 2021.  The only thing to note is that I played around with moving Highlite into an SCorp which would help with taxes but other considerations make it not worth it.  After 2021, we'll definitely amend 2022 and 2023.. which probably should be done before we file 2024.  

Once he heard about the refund he was activity engaged and was firing back documents rapidly.  Amira also said she was waiting to the call with me and blocked off this weekend for taxes cause she knew she'd have homework so think I've seen them get docs over this weekend.  

Amira was also on the call (also forwarding me his documents as I was asking or them because whenever he gets anything important he forwards it to her and she organizes it for him LOL) and said she's talked to Caroline/Andrew over the past few weeks and she's a big fan of both of them and appreciates them for helping to sort out both of their messes.  David also texted me "We're team Motta!" 

I think they might become an advisory client which would be insanely clutch because David is probably the most well connected man I know (and that's saying a lot) so think this could rapidly get Motta into some nice circles.  He will also most likely move this assets over.  I think I saw he was paying ~$5k a quarter in fees or something and he was getting a ton of dividend income which I don't know makes sense for someone at a 35% tax bracket but I'll defer to Dwyer on that one.  

We're building a brand and we're getting that brand into some pretty cool circles quickly folks! I'll send him a proposal for the amendments too.  He's getting like $30 racks back so he'll probably pay whatever.

Dat, Mark, and Caroline met with Ellie and Nick on the business and personal tax returns. They owe a ton for their personal return because of the lack of expenses in 2024. They dont want to contribute to a retirement plan so they dont really have any options to lower the tax due amount. They are going to send Caroline some more home office deductions but that wont move the needle much at all. Dat is going to send them the MFJ/MFS comparison to ease their minds. 2025 they need to add a salary for her s-corp to get the expenses down.

Caught up with Hunter who I've known since the banking program in high school.  He was like 4 years younger than me but he was one of my early Padawans.  

He's Mormon so he went to BYU and just stayed out there.  He has worked in Product Management in SaaS his whole career and a couple of his close friends at BYU started a SaaS platform that helps sales type companies who buy leads.  Essentially when you get a lead, they send an automated video to introduce the person which they've found to help the customer close clients.  For us, I can see us using this for after they schedule a meeting on Calendly to get a video of who we are and our client onboarding process so they are more prepared for the meeting.  

He said they just hit $1 million of ARR (Annual Recurring Revenue) which he said isn't much but they are proud of it.  A lot of their clients love their software but are looking for a full on CRM.  They are working non stop to build out their platform to a full CRM but I think it's still in development.  He says they've found that this software is super useful in the financial advisory space along with some tax practitioners.  He says it integrates with some of the "RIA approved" CRM platforms such as Wealthbot or Redtail.  

From a tax standpoint, I talked through our process and he says he used 2 different people over the past two years.  The first one he made an appointment and went into an office which he said was a sliver helpful but this year it was all through email and he got nothing out of it.  He said he just filed otherwise he would have went with Motta.  He says for sure for 2025 so I'll gather his documents now to queue us up for it.  He also says he wants to do some tax planning and says he doesn't really have a lot of money but said he'd move his funds over to us (although he says he doesn't have a lot so asked if he had minimums).  He'll be a tax prep client for 2025 taxes but potentially a Wealth Mgmt client in 2024.  

I'll send out doc requests to gather his info for 2024 just so we have it but no proposal or anything necessary yet.

Sorted through Chris Martin's accounts for his other property on East 27th Street in Denver.  I strongly suggested he open a bank account for it so there's less poop to clean up and to put it in an LLC as well (especially because it's subsidized housing) and he agreed.  

Luckily I created a QBO account for Chris already and got the accounts synced up so the plan (for Andrew) is to turn the Christopher Martin QBO account into the "E 27th Street LLC" account for the rental property.  I started to create a COA for that one but I know P24 has built a rental COA for my personal rental before so think they can set this one up.  

This will be: 

(1) LLC Entity Formation for SMLLC
(2) QBO Set Up
(3) Quarterly Bookkeeping ($149 a quarter) 

Do QBO at 50% off (I basically already did it with tax prep so this is kind of what we pitch to clients) and LLC Formation at 15% off for his loyalty but Chris Martin says he appreciates the discounts provided but said we're elite and he'd be lost without us so he wants to pay us.  That's actually how this project came about, he goes "Can I pay you for something? What's the next important thing I need to get done, let's do that".  

We can push to after that season but Brian O to get the proposal out to him.  He is getting like a $20k return (from doing so much real estate so take notes people.. RE is the answer!) so we can send it out and say we are getting started on it.. which we kind of have because we opened a QB account for him, synced up the bank accounts and categorized some transactions.

Caught up with Nhung who is a family friend down in Miami.  She said she's planning on moving to Hawaii this year which will be the first time she's leaving the nest.  

She's a teacher (W2) and does some bartending (W2) / grant writing (1099) on the side.  I talked her through expenses related to her 1099.  She said it was in Key West so it was a 40 mile drive 1-way... tons of miles. She doesn't know where her last year tax return is but she's a LOMAR so I'm good with filing without PY.  Only thing to note for taxes is that she confirmed she definitely has over $300 in educator expenses.  She teaches science or something and I don't think Florida spends the most on the education system.  

I already sent out full tax requests along with the proposal so just tossing this in awaiting docs.

Dat & Caroline talked to Matthew Smith and Becca Jacobson about their 2024 tax returns. Matt and Becca both need to gather more business expenses because they have large (for them) tax due amounts. They plan to gather the information over the weekend. 

We also discussed Becca's 2021 and 2023 IRS payments that are outstanding. Becca logged into her account and it said she is at risk of a lien and levy :(! this is from a fan duel winning ($10 bet on a 9 game sunday football over/under parlay that show owes $2700 in tax for). 2023 she tried to set up a payment plan and it didnt go through so she gave up. that amount is outstanding as well - i think it was $5900? goal is to get both her and matt down to zero this year so that their first year MFJ is a fresh start. 

Matt also wants to elect into S corp this year so he is going to schedule some time to discuss that/payroll setup post 4/15.

Dat, Mark & Caroline met with Russ and his FA Ross(Springbok).

The meeting was to discuss, Russ' transition from W2 to 1099 job in May.  He wants to set up an LLC and elect S-Corp designation. He will need payroll set up as well. Ross will handle benefits, retirement accounts. 

Russ said he will make $165hr and plans to work 2000hrs. 

Went over details around S-Corp, deductions, potential to hire family members. 

Russ said he would look over his personal return and sign it for us.  He appreciated all the help on that front. 

Brian create a work item and draft proposal for "Single Member LLC" Creation and "payroll set up & onboarding"

Talked to Nate for about 30 minutes.  He's a referral from Harrison.  They played football together (he was an LB) at CSU but then he transferred to Tulane where he quit football and pursued a career in medicine.  

He's a doctor of Emergency Medicine who's just wrapped up his first year of residency.  He thinks he'll be done this year and doesn't seem like he's going to specialize.  

He made $32k in W2 wages last year and we talked through the Pro's / Con's of extending his taxes in order to save on student loan repayments.  I told him there's a risk to doing that and at $32k, I don't think it's moving the needle too much.  

Game plan is to prep the return and he can see if he wants to extend or not based on what the student loan repayments look like.  

Talked through process and quote.  He makes NO money and was concerned about paying it so I said we can work something out (maybe like a 3-4 payment plan or upon completion).  He asked about pricing and I said our base is around $500 but he's pretty easy and he said he had all his documents organized so I said we'd be able to do it for a couple hundred bucks ($300 ish).  

He was very appreciative for the conversation and looks forward to working with us.

column50:
Mark and Caroline walked Daren and Angie through their 2024 personal tax returns. They feel good about them and once we get the Sinco K-1 we will drop that in and send them final numbers -> Sinco K-1 expected tomorrow, 4/2

Angie wants to pay the tax due online, Caroline will send her instructions on how to do so w/ the updated draft.

They want to buy Daren's dad's timeshare with one of the businesses and use it as part of the business. Caroline/Mark to do more research for them on that and the mechanics.

Caroline & Mark met with Antonio - he had planned for the amount of tax due, just wanted to talk through it and plan for 2025. He is expecting the business to make around 110K in 2025 so he wants to consider the S-corp election. However, the month to month income isnt fully stable so we discussed paying estimates now for 2025 (as if he is a schedule C client still) and continuing to check in on progress over the year. He wants to pay the 4/15 Q1 payment for 2025 to just get out ahead of things so i told him i could run that (i probably should have paused because I am realizing we'll probs need a estimate proposal). Mark & Caroline are meeting with him next week to discuss the estimate payment if needed. 
Action Items:
- Finalize the draft (i sent the updated version w/ the max IRA deduction and now just need signature and banking)
- do a Q1 calc with his QBs
- Check to make sure he booked the JE for the term loan correctly in QBO
- eventually going to meet in June ish to discuss progress and more s-corp details

column105:
Caroline and Mark, did 2024 tax return review with Antonio. Super nice, down to earth guy. 

He is an optimization specialist, said he works with a lot of real estate and financial services companies, on streamlining and scaling their technologies. 

Only adjustment was to adjust is IRA contribution to Max. Caroline resending draft, he will sign and provide bank acct info.

The tax return was in line with his expectations, went over Self Employment tax and S-corp designation in detail. He is projecting on making 110k in 2025, so this year mostly likely makes sense to transition to S-corp. He also wants to open a brokerage account for the business. Wants to meet in June to discuss these two items. Typically most of his business comes in the summer months. 

Action items, wants to make an estimated payment for Q1 2025 and asked us to double check to make sure he set up his loan correctly in QBO. 

Confirmed Ignition Payment details he is all set for us to bill him.

Talked to the IRS (who asked for the 2848 again so I'll attach it to this Debrief as well) but they said received our return that we filed back in the fall but the SCorp election wasn't complete at that time so they rejected again.  I've told Mitch this before but they've received everything and started the process the return again when I talked to them last time (after they confirmed the SCorp election).  Due to volume, they said it can take 16 weeks from today to have it show up on the account.  

I'll respond to the email to Mitch saying what I just said on the debrief.  I think he said he sent over all our missing info over the weekend so let's just try to get his 2024 return done

Mark, Caroline and Andrew met with Devan and Isai. 

1. They want to close deal for sale of Bronco Tires by May 1st.  Have a verbal commitment from a friend for 200k.  50k up front and 10k per month until paid off. Need to submit to Blackburn for contract agreement or if has a contact to do it. Want to work in closing costs are paid by buyer as well. looking for easiest possible agreement that covers their ass legally.  (Mark)

2. State Tax Compliance Issues - Square isnt able to process their FAMLI CO tax, they gave access to info@mottafinancial.com while we were on the phone, Andrew is going to look into getting this cleaned up and to the point where Square does FAMLI automatically.(Andrew)

3. Personal Returns - Devan needs amended, after tax season (Caroline)

(Andrew) 
Isai to resubmit W2, but i guess we can pull it from square ourselves now.
(Andrew)
Edgar - Isai said he would take lead on Edgar's return and to send him all the requests.

Dat and Mark met with Keir(female) and Neal(male), referral from Josh from 3PM. 

They have a rental partnerhship Sugar Shores LLC for a property on panana beach florida. It is listed a Condotel, which causes a bunch of issues with the mortgage company and lot of banks wont lend to you because they view them as high rish properties consisting of all people who dont actually live in them, higher risk for defaults.  Even if you have good credit, if you own a condotel and there is a string of defaults in the building could have a big impact on the HOA ect. 

Talked about the rental property for a while, is it worth maintaining the llc, her dad had suggested just buying liability insurance and getting rid of the LLC. We advised keeping the partnership and LLC in place for added protection. They currently have the property listed for sale, have been having trouble renting it in 2025, so for the right price might sell, if not they want to refinance in the fall. Currently have  8%mortgage rate.

They have not filed the partnership return, so late with that and they need their 1040 done as well.  They have used turbo tax in the past but would prefer if we just handled both this year. Dat mentioned financial planning, they would be interested in discussing that after tax season, they recently bought some life insurance and were unsure if they were getting good advice or just being sold. Also in the process of designing a trust as they have 4 children and sounds like they both make a lot of money. 

Keir is head of marketing for and AI cyber security firm and Neal is in sales for an HVAC company. Neal was a firefighter for 18yrs, prob has a pension from that too, so they must be sitting pretty comfortable. 

Mark sent out client requests and proposals. Dat said it would be no problem getting the 1065 and 1040 done before April 15th. Sounds like they wanted to get us everything over the weekend. And Keir seems like person that gets shit done.

Dat, Mark, and Caroline met with the Skellig Finance Team - Padraig, Jim, and Dave. 

All nice guys, went over Motta's background and Skelligs Background.

They havent had any specific issue with their current cpa other than they have just never met them haha.  Jim has worked at Skellig for 2.5yrs and hasnt met the current CPA.  They are looking for more of partnership and open line of communication on compliance and research questions that come up as they grow and expand into different states and add 1099 contractors. 

Overall good conversations all very down to earth people. 

We need to send discovery requests and follow  up with a proposal once we review their discovery documents. Put together some slides as far as their Motta Team and how they would contact us. 

They want monthly communication/compliance check ins and annual tax filings.

Did a phone call with Tim, walked him through the return numbers.  Highlighted their Cap Gains, Div, Int Income. Also went over their lower withholdings.  I ran the numbers for him, they withheld about 10% effective tax rate was 15.5%. 

He still has the esign, he will take a look at that and needs move some money into his bank acct to pay the tax bill. He will provide his banking info, when the money is in there and said we can just leave it to be take out on April 15th.

FaceTime'd with Witt York for about 1.5 hours to talk through his taxes and basically how to split his property up between (1) Primary Residence (2) Rental Property (3) Storage Barn.  

I didn't realize how much shit was there.  (Barn) His barn is massive and he's putting solar panels on that thing.  I told him about our network but he had already got 3 quotes on them.  I told him about the benefits and tax credits on panels which will help for 2025.  He has to build some sort of thing for it but he said it'll take him a long weekend to do.  I said to make sure he's tracking hours / costs on that project.   (Rental) This was way nicer than I thought it was gonna be.  It's big but only a 1 bedroom, 1 bath, and a kitchenette... it also has a full 3 car garage? Either way, he built all of this stuff himself which is pretty impressive. 

His wife (who I think is way younger than him and also not sure what she does but she seems to come from money because he keeps talking about  how his father in law helped him build everything and probably built $15m worth of property on the lake they live on.  He has done custom homes for like 30 years) also wants to add this 2 story addition type thing to the rental or something.  It's gonna be attached to the house and shaped like an octagon and the way it seemed, his life was looking to build an irl princess tower.  He also has a W2 job and cooks / puts the kids to bed.  It seems like she just asks him to build things and he has the specific skill set in order to do so.  These are tax deductions as well so wins all around except for his free time. 

He also said he got a letter from the IRS for 2022 for $10k in gambling winnings.  He also said he paid his 2023 tax bill.  The man just seemed defeated and didn't want to dig up the expenses because he know he didn't do a good job of it.  He said he wants to pay it off and just get on the right path going forward.  He said these discussions have been super super insightful and when he talked to his old CPA and asked how he can itemize deductions she literally said "find more than $27k of deductions to get over the standard deductions".. she's technically not wrong.  He says he understands this a lot more and this is exactly what he needed.  He was spending all this money and doing all of this stuff aimlessly so he just needed someone to provide a little financial literally.  

He also said he wanted to put everything into an LLC so I said he should definitely do that.  I also talked to him about having the LLCs be put into a trust so that the beneficiaries can get the Step Up basis on the assets.  

REAL ESTATE GENIUS: If you have an investment property and depreciate it down to $0 than you've taken all the tax benefits from it then get hit with depreciation recapture.  Maybe if you're a loser.  Then you say 1031 exchange.  Doesn't fit a lot of the times and buying a new property is contingent upon market.  That's like your run of the mill CPA answer.  If you put that into a revocable trust, the assets will get step up basis and your beneficiaries get it at FMV.  So depreciate it down to $0, die, then no one pays taxes.  

I said the team had some follow ups and he told me that he send over the last docs and responses to questions but to let him know if there's anything else.

Mikey called me about his tax return.  He actually didn't even know he owed or not but reviewed the whole thing.  He's in ibanking and really good at his job (as you can tell from his income) but completely lost with this stuff.  He got a giant bonus (think I did a debrief on that but forget the amount) this year and told me it hit but the government took half of it basically.  I explained to him that he's rich now and he says he's never ever had any money so this is a very new and uncomfortable feeling for him LOL

I said he needs to "start doing rich guy stuff" like buy expensive shit and do drugs like a true Wall Street guy but he responded by saying "Yeah dude, we gotta make sure I'm putting it in the right places".  Way too modest for me but Dwyer probably loves it from an AUM perspective.  



He's for sure a long term Wealth Management client.  Super humble kid and nicest person in the world but it seems like he's got an inheritance coming his way down the road.  I said I want to make it a point to have some sort of tax planning meeting with him in 2025.  I think he should do a back door IRA for sure to start to build an after that pocket.   

He also said he moved from California to New York on 6/1 and then he was at his previous address until 12/1.  He was a multi state resident so I'm not sure how much that factors into the state tax calcs.  Can we send Blackburn a copy of the return, W2, and the dates and addresses of his residences? I just want to kick the tires and make sure we're being diligent if it means saving him a bunch of money.  Think we're taking an L on his return in general because I thought he was going to be the easiest W2 ever but forgot about the multi state.  Call it goodwill for future AUM.  You're welcome Dwyer

Mark talked with Rob and Amy. Rob just wants to get everything cleaned up but worried about getting a big tax bill he cant pay. I reassured this is going to be the best course of action to avoid continuing to compound interest and give him an idea what he needs to dig out of the IRS hole. he agreed. 

Currently IRS is taking $1017 monthly and MA $200 for what sounded to be for back taxes fo 2018-2020. Which thinking about it now makes sense because they said a firm Obrien Tax Services in Natick filed them but never sent them any info or answeres there calls or emails.  He said it order to talk them you had to book 15minutes and they charged you for the 15minuts. He said they were just too old and didnt care anymore about being helpful. 

Need to confirm with IRS POA for the business and perosnal. Rob believes they need to file 21, 22, 23 and 24 tax returns. 

Amy mentioned some issues with the current balance sheet that has been carry forward loans that were paid off. They use a bookkeeper that does quarterly reviews for them but Amy does day to day transaction categorization. Amy and the accountant are working on cleaning up the balance sheet. 

I send out a proposal & Doc Requests.  POA requests need to go out when proposal is signed.

Spoke with Grace (Seed Student ), she is going to finalize Systemics Chart of Accounts this week. Request a marketing budget from Jessica. Also, as part of Jessica's training she needs to understand the Balance sheet. She is having issues with negative equity because she is loaning the company money than taking owners distribution instead of marking it as loan payment.

Talked to Sydney who is Brian O's tattoo artist.  Bright kid and super diligent.  He started his own SMLLC as an independent contractor for his tattoo work but also just opened up a tattoo shop which officially opened in 2025.  He says for his personal LLC, he tracks all of his expenses/miles/etc. on excel but has it's own bank account and he seems very organized.  Also keeps biz/personal funds separate so hopefully not a lot of poop.  

He said there were a lot of expenses to build the shop in 2024 that were all paid out of his LLC account and he was wondering if that was okay.  I said that's actually ideal because that's basically his LLC (him) contributing to the Tattoo Shop and the LLC should own the shop anyways so the numbers are already clean.  He also has a partner who also has their own SMLLC and has their own accountant.  They split everything 50/50.  

They have a bank account and says they don't have any expenses yet cause they just opened.  I talked him through doing a QBO set up for his own LLC and the business books and the benefits of that.  He was blown away about being able to sync the bank account with QBO cause he usually takes his bank statements and punches the transactions into excel.  Told him about the automation aspects of it and he really resonated with that.  He wants to keep it automated so that he can focus on other things.  

I used the rizz of "Why pay for Tax Prep, which is a compliance expense, when you can pay for us to set up your QBO.  Now you've just invested in your business infrastructure instead of paying tax prep fees".  On our side, getting clients from excel to QBO makes Tax Prep sooo easy going forward so basically charge them the same for the tax prep fees and makes our job a little harder now but way less work going forward.  

He also needed the BOI filing ASAP.  We would need his biz info (EIN, address, etc.) and the owner's drivers licenses.  He'll need it for the Tattoo Shop and for his personal LLC.  

I'll send out the requests now so that we can get this going.   Brian O can price this one but it'll be a QBO Set Up (you did this with OCP for your other boy BP) & BOI filing for both entities then SCorp Prep & 1040C prep for 2024.

Talked to Eric briefly.  He had thought he missed a couple 1099s or something because his tax bill was less than half of what it was in 2023.  I talked him through the differences and he was VERY appreciative of the team and pretty blown away by the difference in quality & experience.  He said it was "extraordinary" and tbh.. the only real difference was that we were diligent about getting all of their expenses. 

He was interested in talking about his assets/income streams to build a plan to make sure the math still maths and see if there are any tax efficiencies we can gleam (I'm almost positive we can).  So I'll start to gather docs and talk to them about it next time I'm in LA.

Caught with Christina, she still is having trouble finding a job since she got laid off.  She is actually working part time at a tax firm right now, so she thought that was funny. Johnson & O'Connor in Wakefield. This job ends when tax season ends though. She is interviewing with Brooks and a couple of other companies in the coming weeks but those jobs would require her to relocate to Washington or PA. 

Walked through the tax return she didnt really have any questions. Went over the schedule C in detail. She said everything looks good, doesnt think her CPA counted all her expenses or double counted her shopify last year but she just want to leave it behind her. 

Confirmed E-sign and is all set for us to bill her CC. 

Booked an appt for June 10th to check in. Need to follow up when it gets closer. Bill her$149 per hour for her check in. TBD no action item.  She also mentioned she wants financial planning but I dont think she has any money so, we will see on that front as well.

Talked to Mitch about the 3PM and his personal tax return.  We'll continue to work through the 2022 return finalization but alternatively he can to get the returns filed for 2024 (they need 2 years of returns).  

We talked through both and that he had a $60k tax bill.  Talked to him for awhile about that and the conclusion is that he's getting into too many JVs that require upfront cash but they won't see revenue for a quarter after they are ramped up and close on their next sales cycle.  He is also moving their business to basically only sell United Wholesale Mortgage product because he makes 40 basis points off those deals.  Changing to that product was in Dec / Jan.  In conjunction with the new JVs ramping up (along with the sales people having a big Feb so slacking off in March) is causing lumpiness in revenue.  

On top of all of that, he's looking to maximize the valuation of 3PM in hopes of selling it.  He's the sole owner of 3PM and it netted $277k of income + $65k of depreciation recapture from his car.  So he gets why the tax bill is happening and why he makes $350k of taxable income but feels broke.  

He understands all of this and said he'll do a review of the Biz Returns and get those filed.  Also said his wife will get over the rest of the info when he's back at the house.  

I told him I had class tonight so he understands.  Be ready to file the 3PM biz return and to wrap up the indy.  

Brian - I don't think we ever sent a proposal for the tax prep.  Get the prep to like $750 and $89 for his personal.  Double check to make sure we didn't already have one but we also "filed" his 2023 and 2022 returns so check what we charged them for those years as well

Mark caught up with Max. 

He has his W2 that he will upload along with his last expenses from his financial advisor career in 2024.  Had to pay back Northwesthern Mutual and had 3k in lead generation software. Going to double check on income but doenst beleive had any income, but than he mentioned he might of saw something from Northwestern for around $600 so needs check on that but will take loss and be his last time filing this schedule C.

He likes his new W2 job but is planning his next trip into entrepreneurship. he has been brainstorming a life coach, basically focus on healthy and career goals for individuals. So he is thinking about how to get that started. I told him we are obvisouly here on the tax side of things but happy to just talk shop on entrepreneurship in general. 

This should be an easy prep once docs uploaded, 1 W2 and a schedule C with a couple of expenses.

Super nice guy, down to earth. Talked about beer and the nicer spring whether. He is mainly a light beer drinker but has been doing more guiness. 

He has down his own taxes and seems to feel good about doing the,.  Said he just has a W2 and some fidelity statements asked what i thought about people doing their own taxes.  I said it can make sense for smaller clients with W2 but not for people with 50k tax bills and he laughed about that agreed with me. 

He mentioned he messed up sold some RSU that were short term gains and know he should of focused on the long term gains. I explained to him the difference from a tax stand point and that is something that we could definitely help out with. 

He asked about pricing, I went over base tax prep fees and suggest a stock analysis plan we usually charge around $1500. I emphasized this is all flexible and based on what exactly he is looking for. 

i asked if he does tax estimates or anything and he said he just lives the dark on that stuff. So again opportunity for planning their, so he doesnt have 50k tax bill everyyear. 

He wants to think about everything, might do his taxes for one more year and then start with us for 2025. This is all new to him and he just started making a bunch of money a couple of years ago. 

I told him I would send over a base proposal for tax prep so he has something to review, along with sample stock plan analysis and stock option resources. 

Brian O - create a 2024 Tax proposal discounted to $399. Fed $399 and State $0.  I will send over proposal in my follow up email. Thanks

Talked to Shania about her taxes.  She has dissolved Shade & Travel as an entity in May of 2024 (she still actually runs the business which is concerning given the nature of the business).  

She had a partner but it seems like they had a falling out so they dissolved it but they have an excel spreadsheet of all the income / expenses they've had since the inception of the company.  

This is basically a nothing business but the upside here is that she was thinking of incorporating "Career Workshops & Business Seminars" into her trips because there are often a lot of business owners and entrepreneurs on these trips.  She was thinking Motta might be able to join the trip (as a vendor) for to put on these seminars and potentially network with some of these clients.  

We also talked about how there are a lot of influencers / content creators at Motta and if we'd specialize.  She was in marketing and seems to have a good feel for this kind of stuff.  I came to the realization that Vegas might not be our biggest markets because the market is different than other cities.  There aren't a ton of corporations out here so the only "clients" aside from small businesses out here are more "Entertainment" type clients such as influencers, content creators, etc.  

Came to the realization is that depending on what city we're in, we have to target our client approach on what the market has to offer.  For example, we're gonna get a lot of farm clients in the midwestern part of the country.. we should be targeting our efforts into getting into farming networks.  In Vegas, it's content creators and other solo type SMLLCs / SCorps.  

Where I don't think these are going to be incredibly lucrative clients (although some influencers make a couple hundred thousand a year and I hear OnlyFans models are paid better than NBA players) but it could be a way to get our brand exposure out there via the influencer channel.  

I'm going to help her with the final returns for these bad boys and she is also a flight attendant with JSX (a semi private airline) so I'm doing an exchange of services for this one.

Steve is the 1 million cups guy but also an Advisory client (with biz Partner Evan) for Northern Farms and that Power Plant.  He's referred us a handful of clients and also kind of worked here in the beginning stages before I told his brother to Fuck Off then fired him as a client (and him from the blow back). We've talked about it and he understood why I was pissed off.  We're good and on the same page.  

He wanted to be an emergency prep resource (I know Dwyer is not about this) but he also needed to get his taxes done so I'm going to prep it with him.  I set up the work item and added Proposal notes to the task within the work item.  Also sent out full tax doc requests and asked him to send them over prior to the meeting in order to be more efficient with the prep

Rhonda and her husband called for tax prep. They are good friends with Kylee's parents. They use to do it on turbo tax but her husband is having mental deficiencies. 

I set up contact, work item and sent requests. 

Needs to be added to resource planning and proposal sent.

CC'd Brian O on email - standard tax proposal.

Federal 450, State 50 with a 15% discount.

Texting with Eric Jacobson a bit about his taxes (pinned his initial text to the timeline).  He's retired (although still looking for contract work on the side) and at the "Wealth Preservation" stage.  

He asked to sit down and talk through if there are any considerations when he's taking money out of his retirement accounts.  I assumed that Gaye (Wendi's sister) would be their financial planner but I'm not sure if that's the case.  He didn't say he was working with an advisor so there could be a Financial Planning / AUM client here as well.  

This is Cary's (my roommate) family so they get the VIP / Family treatment.  I think I'll handle the planning here but might loop Big Boy in since he's technically the CFP

Talked with Drew who was a referral from Ross.  He actually isn't even working with Ross and just met with him for an intro about a week ago.  

He is the "High Income, Single Filer, no Assets, gets Equity".  He makes about $185k a year and gets quarterly grants.  I don't think he gets a life changing amount of grants but still a good chunk from what I gather.  

He used to get his taxes done by a family friend who is a CFP.  He's a typical prepper and he said his fees keep going up, which is fine, but his issue is that his tax situation has gotten significantly more complicated but he's gotten no additional questions or suggestions on what taxes are even.  

He had no idea what the difference between tax prepping and tax advising.  Talked him through that and also example of some of the tax advising clients we have.  I said if he wanted us to do (1) Tax Prep (2) Tax Plan (3) Bi Annual Tax Planning Meetings that it would be $1750 with the tax plan being a 1 time cost and the Tax Prep / Bi Annual meetings would be recurring.  He was very open to it but ultimately started with just the tax prep. I think this is a situation where since we already do more "Advising" than tax prep, he isn't sure if that will be sufficient for him or if he'll need a full on plan.  I think he'll come on board, he seems to know nothing about all of this and his tax situation is already more complex because of his equity grants.  

From a Proposal standpoint, I said it'd be the $450 for the indy, no state fee, and 15% Partnership discount through Ross.  

I'll send the thank you emails and all tax requests as we already talked through pricing and proposals with him.

Talked to Tishler quickly about a referral.  It's one of his best clients that is 29 years old and works at Meta.  He makes $1.0 million per year ($450 - $500k salary and the rest in Equity Grants like Drew Humphries of RISEilience).  He has $500k with Tish and moving over another million.  He gets more equity every quarter so they have quarter calls on it which he says might be a good idea for us to join.  

He just made the intro via email he said but he was hesitant because he wasn't sure if we had capacity and because this guy isn't a business owner.  Think he's too concerned with that stuff. 

Also talked briefly about White Labeling the services and the structure we have with UFPG.  He says Baystate allows a little more freedom than Northwestern but still some red tape so we'll take that one step at a time.

Talked to Mallouk a couple of times over the past few weeks.  His company is just about out of business so I introduced him to DL2 Search (Brett Leuders) to help find his next venture.  We talked about the potential of John coming back to Motta.  He had come on in the Summer of 2023 and I cut him from the roster in December of 2023.  Nothing personal, just didn't make the opening day roster.  John then started his own Advisory shop and said to me "You're probably not gonna be thrilled but I opened a shop of my own" and I asked him why I'd be mad / how can I help.  Can't break off from a company and start my own then get upset when someone else does it.  

Well he has come back and now we can help him.  He has 1 client who is a friend of his and he gets all of his business through Thumbtack.  We talked through different White Label structures and he says he doesn't have the infrastructure in order do the full on White Labeled Services but he'd like to do a Rev Share partnership.  I said I'd do it at 25%.  

He said he'd talk to those prospects and introduce us via email.  The friend has a small business that I believe is his side hustle and the person on Thumbtack is looking for tax prep.  This is Pre Intro so we don't know a lot about the company other than he isn't sure if the person has filed taxes in the past two years.  I don't know how this keeps happening

column41: Tax - Ind. w/ Sch C (1040 + Sch C)
column44: Low volume Schedule C this year. Primary income is from W2.
column94:
Federal Individual Return (1040) - $450
State Return - $50
LLC (1040 with Sch C) - $450
column109: Large discount as a wedding gift to longtime friend. Final price at $300.

column105:
Talked to Dave DeCelle and Dan Allison over at Model FA about ALFRED, potential BDO portfolio acquisition, and a zillion other ideas.  

I was coming from the gym and mis timed the meeting so I was in a sweaty hoody. Dave called me after the meeting and told me that Dan is a VC basically and has made $20+ million dollars on two company exits.  Dave says he's also swung and missed a couple of times but that's the nature of the beast.  Dave says Dan LOVES us and even talked about how he had an accountant for 15 years and referred him hundreds of thousands of dollars in referrals but fired him because he was unresponsive. He has a new accountant for all of 3 years and already hates them.  I think we could potentially win his business soon.  

Dave says Dan LOVES us (despite my attire but I think that added to my charm) and was really really excited about the potential of this thing.  Dave says Dan has told him for years he's doing this consulting thing but it's professional services so you can't sell it for a gigantic multiple so he has been looking for a "home run" that has a potential for a $100 million dollar exit and he thinks that ALFRED has that potential.  

We talked about all the different applications of it but at the end of the day we need to build it. I'm meeting with David Hischfeld tomorrow to start to build the platform but he's more the front end guy vs I think Dimitri is more of a back end developer.  

Overall this is an exciting meeting to see a VC see that potential in us.  He works with Parthenon (spelling) which is a portfolio of 7-10 large firms which Dave estimates their total clients to be around 400k.  They LOVE Dan and he has helped them grow those practices for awhile.  Model FA can absolutely help us Market, Price, and Distribute ALFRED across their vast network and think they'll be a key partner to Motta's growth overall as all of this only works if Motta works.

Talked to Dimitri at AnyQuest.  We met him through Suffolk.  He doesn't actually work for Suffolk and has spent his career in the Software Dev industry and really has dove into the world of Ai.  He is the "Head of Ai" at Suffolk as it is one of the biggest parts of their strategic plan.  He does workshops and helps Suffolk build the Ai curriculum.  

We talked about AQ for SEED purposes but also from a Motta perspective.  We talked about AQ on the huddle but it's essentially a platform that combines a bunch of Ai models (ChatGPT, Gemini, etc.) onto one platform that is on a private server.  ChatGPT is open so all the information we put into it is in OpenAi's ether.  With AQ, we can plug it into our software and create a private Ai platform that is directly connected to all of our client info and platforms.. while also being able to access the IRS tax code.  

When Dimitri demonstrated the tool at the BXC Seminar, he created an "Agent" that would do research on a company/person, then an agent to aggregate the data and sort for relevance for our specific firm and specific services, summarize into an automated report, generates an intro email based on extensive research including how we can specifically help the client.  

Dimitri says he implements AQ with "Use cases" so he asked us for an example of a client so we can build the platform and he'll show us how.  I think we use this for: 

(1) Skellig: Research on the client (like the example above) along with pricing maybe.  

(2) WM Referral from Trevor: I saw that AQ has Wealth Management Applications so maybe we see if Dimitri can link this to Right Capital.  Dimitri is also interested in Partnering with firms like ourselves to build and license these platforms to other firms.  This is perfect timing because we met with DeCelle earlier in the morning and Dave says he has a GINORMOUS market of firms that he'd deploy ALFRED on.  

(3) Any new Indy: Maybe a HIMAR prospect coming in the pipeline but want to use an example that is typical for us.  

Dimitri expressed high interest in collaborating on a platform.  I think with our engine (Motta tax engine) and our distribution team (Model FA), I think we can provide all things Dimitri is looking for as far as building a SAAS platform for consulting firms.  

Mark and Me to run point on this but I'd like Brian O to be involved in the beginning because we are using AQ as a client research tool to start. 


Sidenote.. this might be a good example for our friend Azat's company which is an Ai proposal tool.

Caught up with Ryan for my regular doctor's appointment but also got to catch up with him about PP.  They are growing fast! As expected.  Couldn't be happier for them.  I asked how many patients he saw a year ago and he said about 30 a month.  In 2025 they've seen 145, 160, 187 for March.  They're killing it.  

Ryan also said they started doing ketamine treatments in February and they've already done over 20 treatments.  He said he had a patient of his that has had crippling depressing that he hasn't been able to shake so he's just been on heavy anti depressants forever.  Ryan said the guy has done a 180 since starting treatment and said that it has changed his life.  Pretty cool stuff.  

He said last month was the first month that they had enough to cover all of their expenses and salary and they expect the same for this month.  Also said they have a couple practitioners who want to come over.  Him and Frankie are both super happy and couldn't be more thankful for all of the help we've provided over the past year.  He says everyone at Motta has been great and they are just about at the point where they are profitable and says he wants to pay us at least market for whatever we are doing for him.  

Textbook Motta imo.  Help the people get started for basically no money but "good guy" stuff and help them get on their feet.  Now they are thriving and that nothing client will grow and be a big client who will pay whatever we ask while being an advocate for us.  If we do this like 1000x more times we're the biggest tax firm in the country I think. 

Note for Mark, he also said Sean Elder is moving to New York in a couple of months to be closer to his daughter.  Between this his financial, really seems like the guy's biggest concern is making sure his daughter is taken care of. Wholesome stuff.

Mark met with John.

John was nice, real easy going, they had done their own taxes in the past but think they may of messed some things up and just dont want to deal with it anymore.  John grew up in winchester and just move back to his childhood house about 5yrs ago. He inherited the house. 

He has been with his wife for about 30yrs but they just got married in 2021. Thinks they have filed MFJ the last few years. John works at MGH as a social worker and his wife does not work. 

Only thing they have extra sounds like a schedule D for investments, but no mortgage, no side hustles only income is one W2.

Also, need to do mother in laws tax return she is 99yrs old and in a nursing home.

Draft Proposal - 2 1040s and 2 State Returns. 1 Schedule D.

Talked to Jason for a little bit.  He was his usual "reserved yet engaged" self and was straight to the point as usual (but in a good way?). 

He was completely on the same page as us about the pricing for the 2024 services first then the ongoing 2025 services.  

I sent the breakdown for the 2024 services and I'll pin it to the debrief but it'll be $3k for his 2024 tax stuff (which I prepped 80% of already) and a $15k service total for 2025 for Tax, Bookkeeping, and Planning/Advisory.  Talked to him about the total cost and what it would cost on a monthly / quarterly basis. The other area John discussed is just making sure the surgeons businesses and products are all in compliance with state laws.  John recommended working with lawyers in whatever state the company is located. Potentially needing to involve IP lawyers depending on the products and companies involved.

Shania is a friend of mine out in Las Vegas.  She used to work in Digital Advertising (which I'm learning is a big market for us in Sponsorships, Marketing, Advertising space) Vegas but her firm's biggest client was Google who didn't renew her contract so she got laid off.  She's from New Jersey originally I think but think she comes from a military family.  Nice person, a bit oblivious and 'tells it how it is' which I respect.  

She just started at JSX (the Semi Private airline I took one time) as a flight attendant so this might be a plug for Semi Private flights.  She just got done with training so maybe a longer term play but they fly out of Vegas so could be useful. 

She also has a Schedule C (Shade and something?) where she organizes groups on trips all across the world.  She was telling me about it one time and it seems different.  Basically her company gets people to join a pool of like 10-20 people.  The company will then book the flights, hotels, etc. and get preferred rates because of it? Seems like she organizes dinners & activities too.  For me, if I'm going on vacation I want to do my own thing but guess it might be fun to be part of a group as well.  She says she usually gets the travel for free because of that so basically gets free vacations for organizing / supervising.  Kind of makes it not a vacation though.. 

Either way, she says she hasn't really made any money off the business and she had multiple people tell her that since she didn't make any money than she doesn't have to file taxes. I don't know why people think this. I think the expenses were pretty minimal so maybe we just do a first year Schedule C this year but I'm going to have an intro meeting with her just to make sure we don't have to go back and amend. 

Sent her our intake form so I'll have the intro meeting with her and she's a friend of mine (and I'm mostly doing this for a flight plug) but just wanted to start the process while the info is fresh in my head

Caught up with Dave regarding his Financial Advisor referral (Amir).  He wanted to give me a heads up that the client that he is going to refer us to who is a very high net worth individual.  Amir is a CFP & Enrolled Agent so he does all the financial & tax planning/prep.  His client is looking for a bookkeeper.  Dave said to be mindful of staying in our lane which we are well versed in with our FA clients.  

He said the client is currently paying $90,000 per year in bookkeeping fees.  Dave says he has a business but believes that most of his income is driven from a large real estate portfolio.  Not sure if that means it's bookkeeping for a bunch of rental properties but this will be a decent amount of work either way.  Think we should start ramping up P24 quickly and consider bringing Matty home.  

Also said Amir will probably ask for a Rev Share of the Bookkeeping fees which I'm very okay with.  Dave said it'll be good to have agreements ready so I'll do some ALFRED work prior to the meeting.  

Also caught up with Dave about Motta and the successes we've had over the past year.  Dave got really excited about that and immediately got in touch with one of his business partners with the idea of buying CPA practices with retiring owners then absorbing their portfolios via ALFRED.  We've explored this avenue in the past but decided on the organic growth route. Plus we weren't at the point of acquiring firms yet but think we're pretty close.  

He talked to his Business Partner (Dan I think?) and Dan said "Fuck that" because he heard that BDO (Top 10 CPA firm in the country) just sent 7,000 letters to their clients saying they are cutting that service line and they need to find new CPAs.  Dave says him and Dan have equity in a company called Domain Money that brokers deals there a firm will "Sell" Domain a book of business and Domain will create financial plans for financial planners or take the clients completely from the financial planners.  Domain will then pay the financial planner a % of revenue for that set of clients.  Dave is thinking a similar structure here where we'd take the 7k clients from BDO and pay BDO a percentage of the client fees.  He threw out 25% but he wasn't sure what it would look like. 

Dave's initial interest was sparked by the idea of converting Tax clients to Financial Planning clients.  He estimates we have about ~$100m worth of AUM with our tax clients just waiting there for us.  Where Dave wants to plug in would be to help teach us how to convert our tax clients to financial planning clients.  He said his fee for that can be anywhere from Pro Bono, Fee based, Rev Share, or Equity (just on the MWM side not the Motta side).  All interesting avenues but Dave is ELITE from a distribution/network standpoint so I'm open to the conversation.  

He says he'll work the back channels for after tax season and that it's critical that we lock our process down to be able to absorb 7k clients.  I'm not sure what client mix looks like but if they are getting tax performed by BDO than they are probably some whales in there.  

He also says that his mom is working her last tax season and will be retiring from her tax/bookkeeping shop in MA so that she can move down to St. Pete's with Dave.  Dave says he's expecting his first child in September so it'll be good to get her closer.  He says she'd be open to working for Motta part time as well.  Because of this, he says he doesn't need us to do his taxes for 2024 but definitely in 2025.  I don't think we would have charged him anyways so less work for us but exciting opportunities!

Talked to Clinton who is a super nice but super intense dude.  We resonated from that standpoint and from an entrepreneurial standpoint.  

Clinton has a Funding brokerage shop where he helps companies get funding either from banks or from private financing.  He says he closed $680m in loans or some ridiculous number and funded 5 companies this week.  Business is growing a lot and he seems like he's going to get into the Hedge Fund / VC space soon enough.  

From a tax standpoint he said he used to have an accountant and his taxes weren't that difficult but he's since been divorced and started a business.  He said he did his own taxes as a business owner with other ventures going on all in TurboTax.  He has a $42k bill from the IRS for 2023 and he said it's been hanging over his head and he wants to be done with it.  He says his new wife gave him shit for it because she wanted him to be debt free before they got married.  His business partners are also giving him shit for it because he helps get companies financing but he's in debt himself.  He says he put aside a majority of his commission on deals aside so that he can level set on taxes and just get everything fixed and paid off.  He's pretty confident he didn't do his 2023 taxes correctly and was very open about how it's a shit show.  He wants us to help with the abatement (IRS Support / Consulting) which he estimates would shave off like $11k and also an amendment.  He also wants 2024 tax prep done but 2024 will be less noise.  Only consideration is that he took all his income as a distribution and not a salary which he knows probably is going to hurt.  

Talked through the pricing cause he said "Give me a price and I won't hold you to it" and I said to get everything cleaned up for 2023 and re-filed than probably around $1,000 - $1,500.  I said once 2023 is done that our tax prep is min $450 but 2024 will be vanilla so we'd be do it for around $250 - $300 for just the 1040 portion.  I said we'd be able to help as much as we can from a pricing standpoint but he said he wants to support business owners and he gets it.  

Despite this, seems like he's still building the company through our conversations about entrepreneurship.  He also said he's already recommended us to a few different companies and also that he knows a few CPAs in his network and he doesn't give them any of his financial information so seems like he'll be a good partner overall so I'll take care of him.

Mark met with Tim and Peter. 

Tim and Peter, are both very nice, in there mid to late 50s. They file married filing jointly.  Tim has filed taxes in the past through HR Block but doesnt feel like doing it anymore and they now have an inherited IRA and created a trust account for their house and other assets so, their situation is starting to get a little more complex.

They both currently have W2 jobs. They own their primary residence outright no mortgage and own 50% of Peters family house with his brother. That house is located in Eastham on the cape, their primarily residence is right by Avana Sushi in Reading Center. There house is marked as commercial zone, so potentially change to rental property in retirement. 

Peter works from home mostly, mentioned the home office deduction. There office is 15 x 15 but not a dedicated office space, also guest bedroom. 

Outside of their W2s, they will have 4 int 1099 form bank accounts, Trust Acct income, real estate taxes and retirement contributions. However most likely taking standard deduction. 

This will most likely being 450 federal and 50 state with potentially schedule D. They submitted discovery documents while I was on the phone with them.

Met with Camille for about 30 minutes and had a great conversation with her.  Think she'll be a good client and she was super appreciative for the conversation.  It was on Zoom phone and I'm not sure how to access those recordings or summaries but I called from the Main Line.  

Camille is an attorney who used to be a Legal Researcher & Writer for a judge but she basically would sit in a quiet room writing 1 document for weeks and she hated it.  She's a defense attorney now and she's really enjoying it.  Seems like she's on a commission structure because she said her income is continuing to go up.  She was big on seeing if they should MFJ or MFS because she has student loan interest and other potential credits that she'd probably qualify for ordinarily but when they factor in her husband than it doesn't work.  Her big consideration is her student loans because it is income based, I believe.  Most likely MFS for that alone but we'll see.  

Her husband drove for Lyft last year and think had another W2 job (in HVAC I think?) but now he's a W2 bartender and think she said he made like $100k from that so there income is around the same this year.  

Talked through our fees a bit and she had already asked about what we charge hourly and if there was a fee for the consult.  I told her that it's already considered into our fee so that we don't have to invoice clients for 15 minute phone calls.  She found this refreshing as she lives in a "Big firm billable hours" culture now.

I think I commented on the Proposal to go $250 but think there will be some noise and she seemed to resonate with our value/fee structure so I think we get this return at $350.  

I'll send thank you's and tax doc requests but she also says she's weird and saves everything so think she'll turn around docs relatively quickly.  Also says she handles most of the finances so she'll run point but it also wouldn't hurt to get his contact info for our client database purposes.

Mark did a phone call with Lonsdale, (no recording or AI notes).

Caught up with Steve / Evan for about 15 minutes.  They need another financial statement forecast for the power plant they had reached out to us about a few months back.  

They are applying for a gated loan where they would get $8.75 million, then $45 million, then another $30 million.  The plant makes $12m right now in "Bypass" but it's not functioning.  They need this loan in order to get the plant running.  They need a 5 year projection for that.

Talked to Matt & Becca who are engaged and will be getting married this summer.  They just had their second child (daughter - Olive) in 2024 and their first child (Son - Wylond?) a couple years ago.  They also purchased a home in 2024.  

They are both Self Employed.  Matt is an Insurance Adjuster and Becca is a Realtor.  We talked through business owner deductions and they said a list of potential deductions would be helpful. 

Matt had an IRS bill which he will be done paying off in March and Becca has a tax bill that she's making payments on in 2023.  Matt says he made estimated payments this year and I said we'd review Becca's 2023 return in case there was anything that the previous CPA missed.  

They also asked about who should claim their two children and the mortgage interest.  They purchased their home and actually bought points (i.e. pre paying interest) which is also deductible.
