The Mortgage is under Matt and his parents Co-Signed so that he could get the loan but they aren't on the deed.  Becca is on the deed and I think you can still split up the Mortgage interest but let's do some research on that.  

They said they are still working on getting their tax docs (W2, deductions, etc.) so we booked a follow up meeting for Tuesday 3/18/2025. They just wanted to get on our radar before it gets too crazy.  

They also said their parents had an accountant of over 20 years who passed away last year so he said they wanted to make that introduction soon.  They are retired so should be an easy return.  

For quote purposes, they will be two separate 1040 Schedule C's.  Provide a 25% discount through 3PM and Comp the State Return / Tax Review & Assessment for both people.  

I'll send out the tax requests and they said they'll try to get us all their info prior to our meeting on the 18th.

Had lunch with Troy to talk through his 2024 taxes.  Troy's a friend of mine from Las Vegas and started talking to us last April because his family needs to do more tax planning.  

Troy used to work at Charles Schwab and has his Series 6, 7, 65, and 63. He says the day trading made about $65k last year (under his father's name as it's his father's money) and says that he's built a pretty good portfolio that makes money when the market is up and down. His father worked at Raytheon as an engineer for a long time and retired from the company a few years back. Troy hinted at wanting to work at Motta but I told him our Wealth Management practice doesn't have the AUM that requires us to hire someone strictly managing portfolios. Caught up with Mitch Dolman who was a referral from Henry Vincent (who we've never met..) but met Mitch via his wife because Henry cold called them. He has a tax lady right now but he was looking for a new one because him and his wife are now just starting to make some money and looking to invest (real estate, brokerage account, etc.) which she said was too hard and too much work.  Textbook prepper.  

He's originally from Canada and about to get an inheritance from his grandfather in Canada.  He is also part owner of a rental property up there. Caught up with Ryan about his draft tax return.  He was calling to ask about his refund as we had originally anticipated around $5-$10k of a refund.  He wasn't upset or anything but just wanted to make sure we had everything.

Talked to BP for about half hour.  He just started a Recruiting / Staffing company so first time schedule C.  We talked through deductions and the logistics of filing a Schedule C and he would like to use Motta.  Good to send Proposal / Doc Requests

Nothing much has changed on his end but he wanted to see what he can do from a tax planning standpoint going forward.  I told him we can do a Tax Advisor plan but also work with Tristan (his FA) and make sure there aren't any other strategies we're missing for him.

Had an hour call with Jared with the first half about his taxes and the second half about a Partnership with Motta.  

We went though the requests live and he provided PY tax returns, W2, and 1099s.  Also provided a P&L from his bookkeepers with Northwestern Mutual.   He says he logged into his QBO and there were bank accounts that don't exist anymore and missing info (For example, he says rent on his P&L was only $X dollars a month but he knows that it was supposed to be more than that because he had an office for his staff as well).  I think we can populate his schedule C via the P&L we have as a starting point and he said he was going to clean up his QBO a bit before providing us with Accountant Access.  Also talked through expenses such as vehicle & travel that is probably incomplete from his P&L as well.  I sent him all the requests so he can start working through that. From a partnership standpoint, talked through the different relationships we have with FAs and he was leaning towards a Ross model where he is white labeling our services on his team.  The main reason being that he has a friend/client (who started a medical devices company) who has a group of 10-15 doctors who are looking for a financial planner. Had a meeting with LCCB in a shadow capacity while the students let the discovery call with Tracy (owner) for about an hour.  Students did great! 

She talked through her different revenue streams, major partners/contracts, and a lot of discussion around processes such as sourcing, pricing, etc.  

From an Accounting Clinic standpoint, seems like Tracy is still 'wearing all the hats' from a sourcing, selling, treasury, etc. so she has a rough idea (she says highly educated guess) of the numbers and finances in her brain but it's not documented or built out in a structure/process so it's not scalable.  

She also went through a series of products and opportunities but she wasn't sure from a numbers standpoint which products make money and which do not.  She definitely knows the ones that don't make money and the ones that do but again, educated guesses (more on that in a second).  She says she has a bookkeeper but from what I gather, she knows the pulse of the company from a financial health standpoint but doesn't have the exact data (i.e. numbers) to provide specific details.  She does say that every year her and her bookkeeper talk about doing a massive clean up project on her books to really set it up but they always punt to the following year.  Think SEED is a good opportunity for that, we have an army of well trained accounting students to help with that! 

(Picking up from earlier) Talked to Chaim on the side about Bifurcating her business between Non Profit and For Profit.  This would be a similar set up to OpenAi with a hybrid type model.  Maybe the legal or other clinics can look into this but I think this would allow her opportunities from a grants perspective while also being funded by the For Profit side.  Think it might also help from a marketing / branding standpoint.  Think this creates a win-win so that she can do what she's passionate about (feeding kids healthy food which I can't say enough about how important that is. Fun fact, Japan hires a full time nutritionist at all of their schools) that won't make a profit but also grow the For Profit side to fund those initiatives.  

That's a whole project that we can talk through but from an accounting standpoint, I think the first step is to get access to her books in order access her data.  She has 17 different products currently and they don't seem organized so that's step 1.  I know the A-Team is shaking the cage to sink their teeth into their books so as soon as we can get access (and the paperwork), we can get started!

Bob is a friend of mine who I met at the Dog Park.  He's retired at this point and originally from Michigan.  From getting to know him, he's a very nice old man but think made some mis steps in his life.  He's usually at the dog park with his pup (Sasha) every morning & evening around the same time I'm there so I've learned about him a bit.  He said he had a house in Michigan back in the day and not sure what happened but he lost his house and was divorced from his wife. 

He drives for DoorDash right now part time for income and asked me to take a look at this taxes because he started to draft his returns via TurboTax.  

Think I'm gonna do this return out of Goodwill cause he said he was going to owe a bunch of money but I know for a fact that he just purchased a car in 2024 and literally doesn't do anything except drive DoorDash and go to the dog park which is a 2 minute drive from his house.  

I'll do this one myself (especially if it's a Goodwill return) but think the guy is a bit lost and I feel bad for him.

Talked to Kelly for about 20 minutes.  She just started a pet sitting business and registered her LLC recently although she's been operating for a couple years now.  

She was referred to us through Thalia who is in a entrepreneur class with her and some program where they provide "Start up support" including a CPA who does her taxes so she only needs us to help with her Schedule C.  Caroline & I are still somewhat confused on what the actual project will entail but seems like she's going to send us her business expenses which we'll map to the Schedule C and send to her accountant? 

Seems kind of stupid but whatever

Caught up with Justin and Doug.  No big changes to his return except that his Schedule C business did not do that well as he did not have any time to spend on that business this year. 

Already sent over the Proposal which he signed and just sent out doc requests.  Should be a pretty easy returning 1040c.

Caught up with Russ who is a referral from Ross.  The previous background info from Ross and meeting summaries/recordings will give a good summary of the client but main action item is to get a spreadsheet of his stocks and calculate the capital gains on it.  Doubt he'll be AMT cause all his shares have been granted so at this point it's just liquidating them.  

Sent out requests to gather all of his Tax documents for Analysis purposes but also Tax Prep.  Seems like he's almost 100% going to move forward with us.  

From a pricing perspective, toss the Comprehensive Tax Review (think it's already in the template) complimentary and he'll just be the typical 1040 and the applicable schedules based on prior year tax returns.  Toss a partnership discount from the Ross referral on the tax prep fees as well.

Spoke with Sayera last night along with Ross.  Sayera immigrated to America in 2010 without knowing how to speak English and then started a Medical Transportation company, a low risk adult care service, purchased a few rental properties, and then became a realtor.  

She is under LOI ("Letter of Intent") to sell her medical transportation business which was valued around $3.6 million but she's getting offers in the low $4's for it.  She is hesitant because she didn't feel like she had a plan and that the broker was a little pushy.  

He has a bookkeeper and CPA but she says they are more preppers than advisors. I talked about our experience with TLL and real estate properties and the tax benefits related to that.  We said we'd do a review of PY returns complimentary due to the relationship with Ross so I'm going to send a thank you email and send her the intake form.  I don't think we have her and her husbands last name so we'll still call it a prospect for now.  

If she does sell the business, her concern was capital gains tax so think this might be a HIMAR client.  Reminder that this is a Ross client so no FP/WM.

Chris Martin called me last night because he has an investment opportunity with some Ai sports analytics start up.  

The founder is an ex VC/PE graduate of Bowdoin and Chris, along with a group of Bowdoin alum are looking to pool their money together and invest in this start up. 

I don't know exactly what they do but they essentially have an 18-24 month exit strategy so textbook "Start up, cash out, bro down".  What makes me skeptical is that she said she tried to get investors at a $750k minimum, then dropped it to $500k, and now allowing any level of investment.  

A piece of the business is essentially a lie detector test which they might spin off and sell to police departments and shit. 

For us, it'll be a MMLLC or Partnership formation for 6-7 members who are ultimately going to use this legal entity to invest in the start up.  I don't know what the name of the target company is nor do I know who is in the NewCo LLC (we're forming it so not sure what they are ultimately going to call it).  

He asked what it would cost and told him the bulk of the expenses will be with the operating agreement as there are a group of investors and think the agreement would be relatively complex but maybe I'm wrong.  I told him for us, it'd probably be around $5k - $8k and total start up costs are going to be around $8k - $15k ish maybe.  He was okay with that. 

I think we had some sort of Questionnaire to the information we need to form the LLC but I communicated to him what are the key details we'd need in order to form the entity. 

For the entity itself, looking to: 

1. Debrief with Caroline to see what she's seen from a legal entity standpoint for companies like these.  I would imagine she's come across this as her former clients probably ultimately breaks down into SCorps & Partnerships at the base level. 

2. If Mark can talk to our lawyer friends (once we figure out what state we're forming this in) and start to get pricing for the Operating Agreement for this type of entity.  

From a pricing standpoint, I think we had $2,500 for a MMLLC formation or something like that but think it'll take us a little more time due to the speed & complexity of the project.  I'm thinking closer to $5k but maybe we show ~$5k and discount down to like $4,500 or somewhere in that ballpark.  I'll have a better sense once we get more details on the operating agreement

Mark Dwyer talked with Dean, smalled talked about football, dean is a big ravens fan. Wants to get his taxes done as soon as possible, hoping to refinance a mortgage and cant do it until his taxes are filed. He didnt have any additional rental properties in 2024. he does have a new W2 job. There is a solar expense, for 2023 that he did not sent us, may need to add to amended return.

Talked to Jamie who is Tyler's younger sister.  She just turned 25 (Tyler's 37 I think) but she just got out of the air force and her husband is still active duty in the air force.  They are based out of the Saint Petersburg area in Florida. 

She got out in 2024 and started a streaming business (Call of Duty, Horror games?, etc.) but she's looking to make a career out of it.  

She registered her business but she wasn't sure if she has an EIN or not.  Guessing she did the state registration but not the IRS EIN application.  She's a first year SMLLC so it'd be a Schedule C anyways.  

I'll get out the thank you email and discovery documents but they'll be a 1040c for a MFJ return.  Throw a 10% discount for the Hancock Referral as well

Talked to Brett (my agent / recruiter) and they've officially left Fenway Search and their new firm (DL2 Search I think? I asked for his work email with a referral but he said his work email won't be set up until next week).  He's the one that found us our new Tax Manager, Caroline.

Brett is in the process of setting up the new firm as we speak and looking to officially launch at the end of February / beginning of March.  I think the business itself is established but he's working on bank accounts, partnership agreements, etc. 

He said his dad is a retired CPA so he's gonna help with the QBO set up and bookkeeping but would like us to help with the taxes.  He was concerned since it's close to the deadline so I said we can start gathering discovery docs and then just hold off on sending the proposal until after their infrastructure is set up at the end of February.  I think we can get everything queued up and they are doing their own bookkeeping so should give us plenty of time in March if we front  load the project a bit.  

I'm gonna send for discovery docs to get queued up for everything and he said he'll talk to Mike/Matt about their stuff.  

From a pricing standpoint I told him the prices for partnerships and individuals but I'll send him the fee schedule for future reference as well.  Think we bundle the returns for the business and the owners all on the same proposal to put everything for them in one package.  Brian, talk to me about the quote for this one.  It'll be a 1065 and 3 1040's.. maybe an LLC in 2025.

Great talk with Alvis over at Crown Legends.  He's through the seed program so super important to track hours / cost for this one.  

They are 2 Co-Founders (Manny & Alvis) and in their first year they did super well and made $760k.  Then they purchased a bunch of inventory and demand didn't keep up so they overextended with NewERA so had to dig themselves out of a $200k hole in 2024.  I think he said they ended at $183k or so.  He says they've got their stuff squared away and he expects them to have a big year in 2025.  He says Jaylen has been awesome and he said he'd even do a few collaborations with their store to help.  He said we'll be invited

What they don't have squared away is their accounting.  The founders haven't taken a salary and they do not have payroll set up... they'll definitely need that.  He says they use Shopify as their POS and Quickbooks Online.  He says they have it all linked up and it syncs pretty well but I'm guessing this one is an absolute mess so there will be plenty for the students to work on for this one.  

I gave him the layout of how the firm works and the importance of his involvement over the next couple of months to help us the information we need to get their books squared away.  He was super receptive to that and said he'll be available whenever we need. Or Manny, who he'll introduce us to. 

I'll send a follow up email and start getting access to all of his systems so that we're queued up to have the team start working on it.  We could potentially get a meeting for 1/27 (next class) if we've had a chance to do a proper discovery process and brief for the students.  Also if the conference rooms are ready for client meetings.  We'll cross that bridge when we get there.  

Alvis is a great guy and seems like he really wants to get this stuff cleaned up.  Like any entrepreneurs, they started out hot, went through some growing pains, and now trying to right the ship to scale operations.  Accounting is a very important step for launch!

Talked to Hannah & Savannah for Tax Prep services for their Digital Marketing agency (Partnership - 50/50 split) as their current CPAs are just tax preppers.  Referral from Harrison who had nothing but great things to say about us.  Hannah has known HH since grad school and he has been her financial planner since that point.  

Savannah's dad is a financial planner so I think he uses him but she said she "knows enough to be dangerous" from a tax knowledge standpoint.  

Talked through our process and they said their current accountants don't really do much for them from a deductions standpoint and they haven't taken any simple deductions such as home office and what not because the CPA said the standard deduction would be more.  I don't know how they came to this conclusion without even kicking the tires but seems like a easy close.  They also said they keep getting IRS letters for small administrative mistakes so I think the quality is poor as well.  

They wanted to turn around the quote as quickly as possible as their current CPA is sending them an invoice for their 2024 taxes.  I told them I'd bundle their business returns with their individual returns so we can be more flexible with pricing.  Also said they'd get the 15% partner discount via our relationship with Harrison.  

They wanted payroll services as well and use Gusto.  They get the partner discount from their current accountants and just pass through the costs and I said we can have the same set up here (i.e. we pay the monthly Gusto charge and include it within our Payroll services fees).

Talked to Adrienne regarding the CPA letter that Michael had queued us up on a few months back.  It's actually a pretty easy one (I thought he said her husband was going to need a FS compilation but just a simple confirmation). 

These will be easy so I comp'd it because (1) Our current relationship with 3PM is a bit hectic this week so getting back some Goodwill and (2) Realtors {especially the 3PM ones} are phenomenal referral sources.  

She also said she just switched CPAs again but they didn't want to do the letter.  I told her most tax people are tax preppers and she really resonated with that.  She's also a branch manager for 3PM so talked to her briefly about working with her on that front.  She seemed excited about it.  

Long story short, I think she'll be a great referral partner and we'll be working with her a lot through 3PM so think this is a good step towards starting that relationship. 

Plus they're both loaded so they probably are selling homes to HIMAR people who probably need tax services.


..how long before we open an office in Denver?

Anna is the girlfriend of one of my good friends and a client of ours (Mikey Smilove). She's from NYC and I was talking to Mikey about his taxes and he asked if we can help with Anna's as well.  

Really nice girl! They had come out to Vegas for the LSU/USC game so spent some time with her.  Think she's going to be an Indy but also know she's well connected in her space.

Elliot texted me this morning.  He's a referral from Jaden Hanson over at Mile High Lifestyles (and Married to 3PM Branch Manager, Angelica Natale).  

His name is James Elliot but he goes by Elliot.  He's a realtor who just got his license at the end of 2023 and made 1 sale in 2024 so as he describes, "Most of my money is going out".  But he says he keeps drive logs and everything like that so seems like an organized dude.  

He said his CPA retired and he's been getting questions from his client about if they know a CPA so he's already got 1 referral he wants to shoot our way.  He asked if we were licensed in CO and since we're out of state, how would exchanging documents and all of that work.  He also says he'll introduce us to his clients but also not sure if they wanted someone in state or not.  

I'll shoot out the thank you email, resources, discovery requests, and also the proposal for this one just while it's fresh in his head.

Talked with Brandy & Paul Perkins for about 20 minutes.  Very nice and personable people.  They are both Sheriffs for Boulder County and are eligible for retirement in about 4-5 years.  They'll be eligible for a pension so they are looking to buy and RV and drive around the country exploring and taking pictures with Brandy's photography business (Bee in the Moment Photography).  

She said she talked to Mitch about a Refi and told him about the business and he said she should be taking deductions for that business so she registered as an LLC and now has a business.  She spends well over 500 hours a year on this business and actually going to Peru at the end of the month (until Feb 2 I think she said) for a Photography project in the Amazon forest. 

Paul is also involved in a Partnership.  He was introduced to this via his Brother in Law (Brandy's brother) for a Shooting business.  They essentially train shooters and also hold precision shooting events.  He's 1 of 8 partners and says that the income from that K1 is usually pretty minimal (less than a rack the past couple of years). 

He also said since he has a pension, he has all his retirement accounts in a ROTH vehicle.  I brought up taking a look to see if it'd be better to do pre tax or post tax while also planting the financial planning seed.  Explained if they are working with a financial advisor than we're happy to work with them or happy to help on that front if they aren't already working with one.  Told them with their extended retirement plans, might make sense to make sure they are budgeting properly.  

I'll send out a thank you email and discovery documents but should be 1040 Schedule C on the proposal front.  10% discount for the 3PM referral.

Had an introduction meeting with Rodney who is a referral from Harrison Hunter who simply described us as "The shit".  

Great dude, super smart.  Him and his wife are Air Force vets.  His wife has a pension and disability income and Rodney is also a vet.  He also has a Cyber security hacking company (SCorp).  Basically he goes to companies and hacks into their shit to show them the holes in their IT system.  

He says he uses QBO and can give us Accountant access to it.  He also has a Donor Advised Fund which he opened in 2024 and has started contributing to it.  I think he got some bad advice because he's doing the old "Spending a dollar to save 20 cents" albeit he's spending the dollar on savings/investments so not a bad strategy.  

He asked about fees so said I'd send discovery requests, fee schedules, and firm background materials.  

He was SUPER keen on how our safe our IT infrastructure is currently and said we have IT protection and Karbon is a secure document platform.  Please make sure we don't email any personal information for this guy!

Gave client background on my previous debrief but caught up with Amira about her (and D-Ro's) taxes for 2024. 

They've gone through a bunch of accountants who were all old white men and did everything in a very old school manner.  They are just looking for someone with a more modern approach and more strategy vs just a prepper. 

Amira is self employed with an 1120s and a SMLLC.  D-Ro has a W2 and also has a DJ Sole Prop on the side.  Side note, I thought he was DJ'ing (which he also does) but the business is essentially finding DJ's for events.  

David has a financial advisor and Amira says he has some brokerage accounts, CDs etc. which should be pretty straightforward.  Amira's dad does all her retirement stuff.  Another side note, Amira said her dad immigrated from Egypt with $300 and started as a Janitor at some grocery store and now runs all the stores in Oakland.  He retired at like 42 and now is basically a day trader so he manages her retirement accounts. 

Amira also has a bookkeeper for her businesses and she does the bookkeeping for D-Ro's business.  She's basically his business manager as he's not exactly a numbers/finance guy and she knows an impressive amount regarding finances, accounting, and taxes.  Seems like she grew up with that stuff through her dad but from what I gather just from speaking with her, she's a smart cookie and knows more than the average person as it relates to tax rules.  She says her accountant says the same thing.  

Already sent the Thank You email and Proposal for Amira. Also asked her for the QBO access for her businesses and asked her if she'd like us to have her run point for both their tax returns or if I should reach out to D-Ro as well.  My guess is that'll she'll run point but also think his would be a separate proposal.  I'll draft that one as well.

Talked to Chris / Rickey regarding Elmira as far as bookkeeping and taxes.  Essentially, we've done all the transactions we can and there are a handful of transactions & questions that they will respond to.  

I send them the financials and said we'd be able to get them draft 1065s / K1s once those questions are answered.  In the meantime, I think Andrew can start to map the accounts and don't think there is any PY info but if there was activity, we would have done it this year. 


Also don't think they ever paid for the LLC formation (mostly cause it's not 100% done yet and we failed to get the document notarized AGAIN.. It was my fault the first time and Chris' fault this time) but they said they wanted to pay the proposal so that they can get everything squared away for the project.  

Brian - I think there was a quote / proposal from hubspot for them that we moved over to Ignition which probably expired.  Just copy that exact proposal (and make sure we have a Bookkeeping one for them) and send it over.  They are a Partnership technically so I think we have to "Add Signer" and add Rickey to the proposal as well. Also Rickey said he had another accountant who handles his other business as well as his individual return.  So I thought I comped the individual return but I don't think he's taking us up on it.  So we just need TWO (not three like I pinged you) proposals for Elmira (50% off) and Chris Martin's (complimentary). 

So that's 3 proposals.  Resending the Proposal for forming the entity, Tax Prep for Elmira, and Tap Prep for Chris Martin.  Also make sure the Bookkeeping Subscription for Elmira is out there and catch us up on billing if we never sent the subscription over.

Talked to Josh who is the younger brother of my good friend Caleb and son of our client Ellen Wallace. 

Josh is KILLING it.  He just turned 25 in December and all in comp is around $180k including Base, Bonus, and "Carried Interest" which is basically equity compensation for Hedge Funds.  He's going to send over his compensation statement over but I think he said the amount of Carry they gave him as of 1/1/2024 was worth $20k and he wasn't sure what the amounts are going forward.  From what I've seen, if it's $20k in Year 1, it'll probably be worth like.. $200k + in less than 10 years.  

He's young, not married, and earned a very high income so I told him that it's good that he's killing it from a life standpoint but not so much from a Tax standpoint because the IRS puts those types of people in the highest tax bracket.

To do is to send out the proposal and returning client document requests which is basically just 2 W2s.  He also coaches at his Alma Mater on the side so from a Tax standpoint, he couldn't be easier.  I dropped notes in the proposal task but think we do $249 for this one.. it'll honestly take less than 10 minutes to do and he's going to have LOOT in a few years and will need to put that money somewhere.   

I talked to him about some long term financial planning as he already qualifies for AMT tax probably (Single Filer at $180k income) and he'll definitely hit AMT when his Carry gets granted.  I'm going to schedule a meeting with him for October as an annual check in but told him we'd get started and to send his year end tax documents when he gets them throughout the month.

Tanner is a friend I met through Resorts and some of the UFC folks. 

He's married, originally from SoCal originally, and went to ASU but moved to Vegas to work for the UFC.  I'm not exactly sure what he does and pretty sure he'd be an Indy but he's a great dude.

Prospect right now but wanted to get the prospect in the system and probably a super easy return.  More of a "Foot in the door" situation to build our network with the UFC.

Ian is originally from CT but when to the University of Texas and then ended up in Las Vegas working for the UFC in Partnerships (think he's more on the marketing side).  He's Cary's point of contact at Resorts for the UFC and became friends with him because he's a Boston guy.  

I golfed with him last weekend and Tanner Thompson (also another lead) who are Indys but good be a good foot in the door for the UFC employees.  This could be advantageous for our bid for Sponsorships with the UFC and growing our network in that space in general.  

I briefly talked to him about taxes while we golfed (which means it was work technically) and think he'll move his taxes over to us eventually.  We're BOYZ and he's a decent plug from the UFC perspective so getting him in the system as a prospect.

David "D-Ro" Rokeach is a friend of mine in Vegas and possibly the most well connected man I know.  He's from the Bay Area and started his career helping with youth camps folding towels and worked his way up with the Warriors organization.  He then moved to Coca Cola then Body Armor where he's the Brand Director.   

He had asked me about taxes last year but it was late in the game.  Also feel like a lot of my friends out here didn't know me to well so skeptical of moving their finances over but think after Cary / Aly, it's helped build some credibility.  

He has a W2 job obviously but had mentioned he had some side hustles with a DJ'ing business and potentially Marketing / Event planning.  Guys got a very advantageous market so this will be a strategic client because I think if we can do a good job with him... we can get some leads into some very high net work and high visibility clients.  

Still waiting on discovery documents for quote purposes but this will be a strategic client for Motta.

Amira is a friend of mine and the fiance of David Rokeach (another client).  D-Ro had talked about moving his taxes to Motta last year but too late in the game and talked to them about it at Janet Jackson.  

Amira is a former dancer for the Golden State Warriors who has since started her own Marketing / Event Planning business (Melon Marketing) and The Cultivate Code which is a business to help aspiring Dancers build their portfolio to get into the dance business.  

Amira and D-Ro are getting married in 2025 but for their 2024 taxes they'll be separate clients & returns.  

She'll be a 1040 with a couple of Schedule C's from what I know right now but still awaiting discovery docs.  

Just wanted to get the prospects in the queue but we can get to the quotes and such when we get there but they are both extremely well connected people both in Las Vegas and in the Bay Area (which could be a good market for us to get into.. lots of Silicon Valley money).

Rosa is very nice and personable, she is a SEED client/referral. Andrew and Mark spoke with her for about 20mins.  She is a single Mom super busy, running a business and currently working towards marketing degree at Suffolk. She said she doesnt have any money right now, not sure what the financials of her business look like but we will dive into those.  She said her books are mess, she uses Quickbooks, Toast, and Square. She currently makes 90% of her profit from selling her products retail at farmer markets, will do 150 transactions once a week. She is planning to open brick and mortar in about 3 weeks in newburyport. She knows all the restaurant owners in newburyport, so good be a good center of influence for us there. Also, does cooking classes, foodtruck. She is working with legal at Suffolk but potentially dividing up the brick and mortar from her foodtruck/farmers market business and creating a new EIN/LLC. Next steps, getting access to her Quickbooks and organizing her to work with students.  Be a good candidate for students to work on together, as clean up chart of accounts, reclassification, sync everything.

Eric is my roommate's dad (Cary aka Dre) who is a retired attorney who used to work for Fox (the network not Fox news) and ABC.  He's retired at this point and also recovering from lung cancer which he had a couple of surgeries for during 2024.  

Eric's currently drawing from his retirement accounts as Wendi (Dre's mom) is a house wife thus it's their only source of income.  He had an accountant who retired and he was passed off to someone else at the firm who they've worked with for the past couple of years.  He says the old CPA basically does the bare minimum for them and thinks it's because they are too small for them now.  I hate hearing that stuff and feel like we hear it all the time. 

I don't think he's working with an Advisor so might be a Wealth Management (more Wealth preservation) type of client and the Jacobson's have had me over for a bunch of holidays and treat me like family so looking to make sure they are taken care of.  

He's also thinking of selling their home in LA (Brian O and I looked it up and the house is paid off and probably worth ~$5m).  He's thinking of relocating to Las Vegas as the cost of living in LA is not great for retired folks.  If he does sell, guessing that'll be part of the Financial Planning / AUM conversation as well.   

From a fees perspective, he insisted on paying as he said "This is business" but they are a pretty simple Indy client so I'll work with Brian O from a fees perspective on this one.

Had a phone call with Jared for about 30 minutes.  He's a referral from Stu Galvis (who I've never even spoken to but he's referred us multiple leads already). 

Jared said he's currently working with a bigger firm (not sure which one) but he's got a lot of spice to his return and seems like the people there are either not interested in his complex Indy return or they are not familiar with all the crazy shit he's doing.  He has 4 rental properties (5 doors so think one of them is a multi family) and also does a lot of trading with Crypto, securities, etc.  {Side note, he said 2 of the rental properties are in LLCs and the other 2 aren't "out of pure laziness" so might be advisory opportunities down the road although he seems like a bright dude so might do that himself.}

He also said he wanted to start an SDIRA to get a golden visa in Portugal.  I'm not exactly sure what that means but I'm sure ALFRED will be able to give us a good idea of it.  Long story short, he's a high net worth individual who has his hands in a lot of different things.  He asked about fees so I told him I'd send him our fee schedules for 2024 but he'd AT LEAST be a 1040c with 2 Schedule E's and at least 1 Schedule D.  I told him we'd send discovery docs before we can finalize pricing but told him it depends on the complexity of the client.  

He has a "wife" named Hilary who's studying for her CFP.  They aren't legally married as they've both had 2 divorces and don't see the value in getting married but said it was because he didn't see any tax benefits to it because they're both high net worth individuals and said he thinks there's more flexibility with contribution limits for retirement accounts and such.  I don't know if that's true or not so said if they both do their taxes with us (they don't co-mingle finances at all it seems like and she has a different CPA) than we could do the return as them being individuals and MFJ to do the math to see if it would be advantageous from a tax perspective.  

I said the tax prep fees would depend on what we see in discovery documents but said he'd get the standard 15% partnership discount through Three Point Mortgage.

Lauren Vargo is a friend of mine who is from Detroit but lives in Los Angeles as she is pursuing a career as an actress.  She currently works in Marketing for Universal Studios and she's a bartender for supplemental income while she is putting in the ground work for acting career.   

She's currently taking acting classes, workshops, etc. and also is writing a short film.  She has spent a bunch of time on her film career and not taking credit for it.  Her and a group of actors put together a Short Film ("Laughing to Death") which was a bigger project for her.  

All of this is because she's owed money every year because of her bartending gig (W2 job I think) but she's not taking credit for her 3rd job as an actress where she easily cracks the 500 active participation rules.  Thinking if she takes credit for all the money she's spent for her acting career, that should hopefully offset most of her W2 jobs.  

This is a favor of sorts so I'll handle the prep on this one and I'll also talk to Brian O about pricing.

column41: Tax - Ind. w/ Sch C (1040 + Sch C)
column44:
Matt Mahoney is a referral from Chris Martin who graduated in the same high school class as Dwyer and I.  We actually had to share a locker on the football team so we go WAY back, it was good to catch up. 

Matt is looking for an accountant and said he's seen Motta but thought that he was too small time for us and didn't want to waste our time.  Foolish.  

He's currently using Seamus O'Brien's (another WMHS 2008 graduate) recommended accountant who is a tax prepper who is Seamus' girlfriend's friend or something.  The guy is your typical Tax Prepper.  He's already all in on working with us. 

Matt has a W2 job as a Fire Fighter for Woburn but also started a "Natural Insect Spraying" business or whatever called Ticked Off LLC.  It's a SMLLC he started it 3 years ago and it's been growing every year.  He also purchased a house with his girlfriend in north Woburn in July of 2024.  

He uses Jobr for his Client Scheduling platform and QuickBooks Online but he said the systems aren't synced up properly so he literally keeps all his receipts and punches them into QBO.  He says even then he's not sure he's putting them in the right categories and it takes him a ton of time.  

He'll be a 1040c from a Tax Prep standpoint as Ticked Off is a SMLLC.  I'll send discovery requests out as well as QBO access to get initial docs.  He'll most likely need Bookkeeping Onboarding and Quarterly Bookkeeping services probably.  

See Ticked Off LLC Karbon contact below. 

https://app2.karbonhq.com/4mTyp9lLRWTC#/organizations/JZ8Z1mCGcFY/details
column94: Self-Employed Sole Proprietor or Single Member - $975
column109:
Friends & Family 20%.

He said he made $7k net profit last year so he's not a gigantic client but thinking Tax Prep (1040c) this year for 20% discount for the 2024 tax return.  $500 for BKPG Onboarding (but might be higher depending on how big of a mess it is.) and Quarterly Bookkeeping for 2025 at $250 per Quarter and basically tell him that his Tax Prep fees for 2025 will be lower if we're doing his bookkeeping.

column50:
Had a phone call with Tyler who is Raquel Pennington's Brazilian Jiu Jitsu coach who owns Kraken BJJ.  It was the easiest close ever, he basically said he was looking for a CPA and talked to Raquel as he was purchasing an investment property and she said he HAS to talk to us.  Endorsement was so good he basically said, "Yeah I'm in" after hello. 

Tyler is a super bright dude, he opened Kraken BJJ about 5 years ago as a Schedule C and will be going SCorp in 2024.  He actually was on his QBO while we were on the phone and got access to his QuickBooks during the intro call.  Super productive.  

He needs help with Taxes for this year.  He has taken quarterly draws but also has a W2 Salary / Bonus.  Think he said he's paid himself like $65k in W2 and the business is at like $70k profit.  Income will probably be around $150k for him all in.  

Kraken also is expanding (with a franchise model) and a friend of his just opened up a franchise in Kansas City.  He says he gets 5% top line which is about $500 right now but expects that to go up.  Also said he's looking to get to about 5 franchisees over the next few years but wants to do it right.  

Tyler is also in the process of purchasing an investment property in Michigan.  It was their family house that's on 4 acres of land that's been in their family for over a century.  He purchased it for $140k (appraised value) and looking to put that into an LLC.  

I think this could be a situation where we get our foot in the door with taxes and the relationship will enviably expand (bookkeeping, advisory, etc.).  He said his issue is that he couldn't get his accountant on the phone which was frustrating and as he expands, he seems like the guy who will be a good partner.  

Let's draw up a quote for just taxes.  It'll be an 1120s & 1040.  I'd say bring the individual taxes down to $99 dollars and a 20% partner discount off the business return (1120s).  Brian, use the SCorp template when sending the proposal.  He's a coach to UFC fighters so think the discount helps get our foot in the door that could turn into a business channel in this field.  He says he talks to fighters about their finances post UFC life all the time.  Include the MottaGuard and Comprehensive Tax Assessment complimentary.  As part of Raquel's Sponsorship deal, think the industry standard is 5% commission off tax prep fees so I can track for that and use this as an opportunity to plant the seed to have her post something on social media for leads.  

He texted me his email so I'll send a Thank you email with some resources and send out Document requests.

column105:
Corey Woods is a great friend of mine who is essentially an Indy with a bunch of Crypto.  I'm going to use this as an FGA to use Legible because this dude has A LOT of crypto.  I don't see this going away and if we can get really good at it, we can corner the market.  

I'll handle this one as this is a personal favor for him.

Jared has officially left NWM and has moved to Baystate.  He is having a really hard time from a client transition standpoint and it's been an absolute nightmare working with NWM on that front.  I hear this about them a lot. 

From a tax standpoint, he said he'll most likely be above water in February so let's send the Proposal with a Start Date in February and expiration in mid march or something.  

He received a $250k signing bonus from Baystate to come over and he was asking if he should take it over 3 years if that'll lesson the tax burden.  I said we'd need to know his income from everything else to answer that intelligently.  He agreed.  I'm going to send Discovery / Income docs to give him a flavor but I'm guessing the tax number would basically be the same and would just depend on if he wanted to pay the taxes now or later but I'll confirm that.

Caught up with Derrick for about an hour about updates on his end and the quote.  

I changed up the quote that B made to exclude Bookkeeping as I thought he'd want to get the LLC established first but he seems like he wants to do the Bookkeeping before he forms the real LLC.  Think his side hustle is under the company's umbrella right now so the LLC isn't critical and they have their own accounting system but he doesn't like it so he wants to have them set it up and open a QBO with us than just transfer the data instead of setting it up from scratch.  

He said he wanted to do taxes for sure and wanted to see what bookkeeping would cost.  He was looking for a package like the Entrepreneur Essentials (I'll tag the Client Resource (CR) to this debrief for Brian).  

Let's revise the proposal into 2 proposals.  

(1) Tax Preparation: Individual (1040c), Onboarding (Bookkeeping), and QUARTERLY bookkeeping review (think we have it at $150 a quarter).  

The strategy is to reduce Tax Prep fees if they sign on as Bookkeeping because it'll get us the onboarding fee and the recurring revenue.  We don't give a fuck about Tax Prep fees and if we can give up tax prep fees in Year 1 for recurring accounting fees than we still win.  So give a small discount (if you want, B) but if anything, give the discount on taxes and email the proposal to the client explaining that Tax Prep fees go down if you are an accounting client of ours because we already have all their information. 

(2) Proposal for Entity formation (SMLLC) but set it for January / February of 2025 and give it a longer expiration period.  We know he's going to do it eventually so just want to get it in the pipeline to track.  

I'd also put the same Entity formation (SMLLC) as an OPTIONAL service to the first proposal and make it cheaper if he does it all at once.  Meaning, if he bundles the Advisory services with the Taxes/Bookkeeping than the entity formation is cheaper than if he waits and does the LLC formation separately.  

See link to the proposal below.  Brian, feel free to make those changes and blast it out.  One thing to be mindful of is that there were a bunch of duplicate services (think some were the Ignition default ones) so make sure we're using the services that are linked to a QuickBooks Account (i.e. Tax Prep goes to Tax Prep) and that the service descriptions are robust.  You can tell the ones I tuned up because I also added specific service terms for each service while I'm cleaning them up.


https://ignt.io/5FPy1kcskh8

Mark Dwyer met with Keegan on 12/17/24. Dat was sick. 

Keegan is very nice, single guy just bought a house in October, was asking about energy credits, he has home improvements to do and wants to take advantage of credits where possible. first project will most likely be windows. No plans for this before year end, so planning for 2025 taxes. 

He asked about standard deduction vs itemized, said taxes are not bad where he is at, i mentioned Mortgage interest as a big one where client get bumped into itemized but with him only owning the house for a couple of months most likely be standard for 2024 and we can look at it for 2025. 

Is avid pokemon player and collecter and will sell cards throughout the year, he tries to stat below the 600 dollar sale threshold on the different website but he will be getting at least one 1099 from Whatsnot in 2024. Not at Schedule C level, it will be schedule D transactions. He will try to get us cost basis and holding period, went over long term vs short term capital gains. He admitted he has not done a good job tracking any of the info with the sales but will get it put together. 

He sent me a disclosure from our website that needs to be fixed, saying that all of our prices are to be paid with Euros unless otherwise stated, i assured him we are a big U S D firm. 

Follow up with document requests and standard tax prep proposal. He would be interested in a consulting hr after tax season but he doesnt have any money right now, get his bonus in april or may and is expecting a work promotion

Met with Isabelle to catch up on her Quarterly Tax Payments, talk through taxes, and talked through tax strategy.  

See meeting recording & summary but action items are as follows: 

(1) Mark to gather "advisory" hours to date and Brian O to bill for it at the end of the month when we know the total.  I said she had 4 free and she agreed to pay after and we've been super super helpful so she'd gladly pay it.  Mark, when thinking about your hours, she paid separately for Payroll Clean Up / Payroll but if there were any other issues or time that you feel like would be out of scope, I'd include those.  I think I've spent around 45 minutes (0.75 hours) so far in December.  

(2) Andrew to get caught up on this client and also take an FGA at creating a Bi-Weekly payroll processing work item.  I'm pretty sure it's on auto but think there should be a recurring work item to track it.  

(3) Dat to send YE tax documents.  I think Mark is on this one and it's mostly business so OCP on support.  I'll send the requests out coming from Mark and think we can input in PY as we wait for her YE docs.  Maybe Sophia can help with that one.

column50:
Shea is a referral from our friend Ray H from Denver.  Shea's the VP of Ray's company who also plays in a metal band on the side (which is in an LLC) and he also sells Magic The Gathering cards on the side.  

The band used to do really well but then COVID happened so there hasn't been any activity but he's kept the LLC open and they are dropping an album soon so he's hoping it'll pick up in 2025.  

He said he started selling cards for gun and it made a couple hundred dollars a week but lately it's been picking up so he also wants to eventually put that into an LLC.  

From a personal standpoint, he just got divorced and sold his house so wants to level set on life and also financially but this time with guidance.  

Great guy.  

Mark to take the lead on this one for the WM prospect.  I told him let's get the taxes done first then we'll do the financial planning once we've had a chance to level set and get all of his taxes and finance in order first.  I think that might be the higher percentage play to crush taxes first then work the planning in vs trying to get the HR ball (think Elder).  

I'll send a thank you with the Budget and some resources but think this will be a Tax Proposal with a 1040c with an additional schedule C.  Also double check the proposal that is attached in the current Ignition Template and think I found a typo which I fixed and saved in the client resources folder but not sure I updated the Ignition Proposal template.  

Also include the Tax Review & Assessment complimentary and MottaGuard Compliance as an optional service.  

15% off all services and 50% off the additional schedule C.  If we give him the homie hook up now and crush it, the financial planning fees will be acquired easier.
column94:
State Return - $50
Self-Employed Sole Proprietor or Single Member - $975
LLC (1040 with Sch C) - $450

column105:
Action Items

She is meeting with Dat on Monday 4pm Eastern.

Need to mail 941s after she signs them.  Payments have been made for CO FAMLI, CO UI, and Denver Local Tax. She will need to mail in vouchers for the 941s. 

Looking to take a bonus to get her as close to 70k W2 wages on the year, thats what she feels is reasonable salary for what she is doing.  She will be at 15k through regular payroll. Calculating a 40k bonus for her. 

Is planning on taking the Augusta rule for 12 days, told her she needs to write up an invoice for the business and document office expenses in the area. She might not do this because of cash flow with the 40k bonus, asked if she needed to pay the invoice in 2024. I checked her return, she is cash accounting, so invoice would need to be paid in 2024. 

Personal Tax Estimates- she has not paid any estimated taxes for distributions. Need to run the numbers for that, to give her a heads up what she is looking at.

Talked with Isabelle this morning.  Walked through getting access to UI Colorado acct. I have full access now for that and FAMLI. 

She wants to get estimated taxes for her ytd.

Mentioned she will need to do a 1099 for Amanda Hogan Contractor she is in Gusto. Need to confirm her info is up to date.

Went to networking group where they heard from a CPA presenting on idea... She is going to rent her house under the Augusta rule to her business when she works from home for year end around the holidays. 

Wants Estimated Taxes for Year End by end of next week. 12/13/24

Need to confirm her salary is in line with what she is doing.

Nick and Mark spoke with Patrick.  Patrick had questions about accounting for his sports cards business. 
Follow up questions/Action Items
1031 Exchanges for Sports Cards?
Wash Sale Rule for Cards?
W9 and 1099 for Matt Coleman 
Make First Quarter 2024 Tax Payment 
Accrual Accounting for the business

Nick and Mark met with Dale and Mike to discuss a couple of year end questions. Dale had reached out to see how much he could take from his IRA to fill up the 12% tax bucket, it was looking like he could take a pretty big chunk but he forgot to tell us he talked to social security this week and after a back and forth ended up taking a lump some of 28k for the last 6months and will getting around 3800 a month starting in January. So we told him we would get him final estimates but looking like he will have filled up the 12% tax bracket now. Asked about 10k he recieved back from having car issues, we went over this with him in email but that needs to be income back to the business.  He also is planning on taking 500 a month from the business starting in January to pay back a 34k loan he paid the business in 2024. Briefly went over BOI, emphasized the importance of getting it done, he said mike was checking to see how much their payroll company charges for it. They will be out of the country for the first 2 weeks of december.

Caught up with Nicole, she apologized for being out of touch they have been crazy with client seminars and than she went to Punta Cana for a family wedding for 10days. So she has been behind on everything. Discussed bookkeeping she didnt realize that we had never set up monthly billing, she will take care of invoice to get up to speed and I will set up recurring payments moving forward, they dont like to get big bills, understandably so i apologized for our tardiness there. We booked a meeting for December 17th to cover Balance Sheet and P&L. She doenst have a great understanding on what the numbers mean and what she should be paying attention to. So from a budget and business health standpoint she would appreciate a walk through. She is finalizing our access to their eastern bank accts and payroll acct and will provide info on outstanding requests. She will be more responsive moving forward but the goal is to get us access to everything so she does not need to be involved.

Mark Dwyer spoke with Isabelle on the phone. She paid the Denver OPT tax while we were on the phone, that should be settled moving forward. Went over the 1099 option to get her payroll squared, she wants to move forward with W2, so need to look into how to pay FICA and quarter federal and state payroll taxes for Q1 and Q2 of 2024

column50:
Talked to Vinod with Mark/Brian for about 30 minutes on everything they have going on.  Vinod has a W2 day job but him and his wife also have 4 LLCs.  

(1) SMLLC for Vinod's music business
(2) SMLLC for the wife's Yoda business. She had one awhile back but stopped and then they started another in 2024 but did nothing with it but looking to do more in 2025.
(3) MMLLC for a rental property that they are 50/50 owners on.
(4) MMLLC for their market research firm because a friend of theirs hired them for a project so they formed the LLC for that project and looking to do more in 2025.  

He has QBO for his music business but unsure if he has it for anything else.  I think they could benefit from even the QB ledger for his other businesses just from a tracking standpoint.  It'd be pretty light onboarding I'd imagine and think P24 could do it easily.  He'll need tax services for all of his businesses as well.

Action items are for Dat to send the thank you email and send out document requests ASAP because he's leaving for India next Saturday for a month and won't be back until a little before Christmas.

column105:
Talked to Frankie while I was re-filling my prescription and she asked for a meeting to see what their tax hit is going to be for 2024.  I don't think it'll be extensive.  I'm guessing they'll be at a Net Loss for 2024 so they'd probably get taxes back if anything but we'll see.  

I asked her to schedule an hour meeting with Sweeney, Me, Frankie, and Ryan to do somewhat of a tax pre game meeting.  I think we have their QBO so we can most likely just import into ProConnect and see what the return looks like.

Had a good conversation with Witt who has been a client of Hunter's for about a year.  Witt is a power line worker who has a remote job right now but used to have to be on the road which was tough from a family perspective.  He's from Montana but met his wife in Denver when he was in town for work and now they live in the Southwestern part of Colorado in the desert.  They've got two sons (7 & 2) and both the husband and wife are W2 workers.  Seems like a very blue collar family. 

His father in law is a contractor who built their home and they have also added a "Caretaker unit" which they rent out and a barn on their lake that their neighbors rent to store their boats.  He also has his house he bought a long time ago in Montana that started with an informal rental but he just kept renting.  

His frustration is that his current accountant sends him a binder of his tax return every year after he spends about 3 hours gathering all of his expenses into one of his CPAs templates and then he drops it off with her secretary for $1,600 per year.  Seems high for a 1040 Schedule E but not sure what that lady is doing.  I asked him how helpful that binder was and he said "not really" then said he can't even talk to her for more than 10 minutes and she invoices him for it.  He basically said he's paying her for data input and even the intro call has been more valuable than his 5 year relationship with his current CPA.  

He also said he eventually wants to put all of his investment properties (Barn, Caretaker Unit, Rental Property) in LLCs so talked that through with him and went way over his head.  

There's about a 100% chance he becomes a client so I'll send him the full tax intake.  He was very well organized and had all his numbers in a notebook.  He also said he wants to be proactive during the year so if it's easier for us for him to just send us documents when he gets them, he just wants things to be as proactive and efficient as possible.  

Action items are for me to send the thank you emails with some of our resources for background.  

15% Financial Advisor Discount.

Had a level set / onboarding meeting with Ariel and walked through what we've done before, her reports right now and some of the potential iterations of the reports, and some onboarding questions such as uncategorized transactions.  

She explained the process for how they earn money and some of their more complicated payments such as their lease, how they earn money and how that comes in, and expenses / headcount / growth plans to get an idea for what they have on the horizon. 

Couple thoughts for me: 

(1) I think this job can be P24'd as of now, books are in decent shape and I think we can start layering them in from a categorization standpoint.  

(2) We will start to buildout the monthly reports (i.e. reorganize the chart of accounts and add reports to the Management Reports to send on a monthly basis).  I think we add the Monthly Balance Sheet & P&L as a stock report for our clients and think we add it to this one.  We asked her to start to look at it to start to group / reorder accounts to really start to build it out.  

(3) Depending on the growth that Ariel noted, might make sense for her to go to ADP as she's currently on QB Payroll which isn't great.  

..sidenote from an FP&A standpoint, they get $180 private pay and around $130 from Health Insurance. She also is starting to go group sessions which will be $210 per session.)

(4) Make sure we get the lease docs and loan documents.  Might take an FGA as far as building out those reports for this client but TBD on that.  

(5) Do a quick review of her books and potential review their tax return to see if there are any areas of potential savings (LLC vs SCorp was what she asked about).

column41: Tax - Ind. w/ Sch C (1040 + Sch C)
column44:
Christina runs a side hustle creating logos, selling products wholesale and retail.  Pretty much everything is made to order, doesnt keep inventory.  Her biggest client is a general store in Warren NH Apple Knockers.  She will drive there and meet in person. She has an app to track her mileage. Her car is older so she is going to start to track actual expenses as well. She uses excel to track expenses, than has shopify for online stuff and then use app through Citizens bank called Autobooks. She said she can provide us a P&L and Balance sheet. She doesnt mine doing her own bookkeeping but wants to make sure she is categorizing things correctly. She had quickbooks but stopped using it, didnt think it was worth the $30 bucks a month. 

Her current CPA only charges her $250 for her tax return but she sees him for an hour and it is very rushed. So she is willing to pay more if it is worth. I highlighted how we like to work with clients and will offer more assistance throughout the year. 

She asked about going back to Sole Prop, her current CPA mentioned it, I told it didnt make sense if her plan is to grow this business. WEnt over S-Corp and how that works if she starts making more money. 

She was very nice and can tell shes done a lot of research on her own. She was just laid of by Reebok in June so she is very cost conscious currently. This will be a proposal for 1040 with Schedule C.  With 2-4 consulting hours.
column94:
Federal Individual Return (1040) - $450
State Return - $50
LLC (1040 with Sch C) - $450

column50:
Talked to Ron after a confusing back and forth and he also had reception issues so we changed the meeting to a phone call.  

Ron's a retired disabled military man who was a professor and also worked for the military (or military contracts) in "Cyber Penetration" from how he described it, his job was to train the military on how to hack into systems.  He could legitimately (and probably is watching) hack into our system right now.  

Ron left the corporate life and joined the entrepreneur life like ourselves.  He says he's emptied his savings and started 4 businesses (which I added via his LinkedIn and created contacts for in Karbon).  The businesses are US Computer Support (trains people how to hack into stuff I think?), SomeOfTheBestDeals (selling business where he has contracts with eBay, Alibaba, etc.), and Chit Chat (a social media website that has all the capabilities of Facebook, Twitter, and Tiktok.).  He also said he invents Ai apps and said he was thinking about inventing an Accounting Ai App but didn't have the expertise (I brought up a collab).  

He says Harrison is the advisor on all of his businesses and that he doesn't have any money right now but has contracts signed that start in January.  The problem is that he needs to get set up on a Salary this year.  I talked through pricing for Payroll and said it would be $500 for basic set up via Gusto and $99 per month for payroll & compliance.  He said he wanted to pay himself out of two of the businesses so I said the set up fees would be the same but the monthly would only be $150.  He said he didn't have any money and he has all of the employment ID items set up so he can do a lot of the the work on his side.  

He also says a lot of his large contracts are with Microsoft, US Military, etc. and they require his financials as part of the contract diligence.  He said his books and records are an absolute horror show right now.  He also asked about selling his businesses so I talked him through BizEquity and our capabilities there.  He says he knows Intuit as well (another point for asking him to help us with ALFRED).  

He's a very straight to the point man so would fall under the "Jordan Rules" category but he said he trusts Harrison and if Harrison is recommending us than he trusts us too.  At the end of the call he was thrilled and excited to get started. 

I'll take the Payroll Set Up but want to also start on the tax return piece of it.  This has extension written all over it but think if we can get him up on Payroll, it will be a good win to earn his trust.  He says he has all the information handy so think it'll be a good exercise for me to go through it with him and see what he knows.  He can also see that we are experts and we might be able to parlay that into assistance on ALFRED Ai.
column109:
15% Partnership Discount through Harrison.

I said we can get started on the work and we can bill him for everything in January / February when his contracts come in.  

I'm not sure what the accounting is going to look like and what the lift on that will be but he said he would send us an email within 24 hours to get started.  

He'll need tax returns too but that won't drop until after his contracts go live so we can assess pricing for all of that in early 2025.

column105:
Mark, Brian O, and I caught up with Jared who wanted to get a better idea of our ideal clients and how we work with advisors.  He also asked about our fees because Jared wants to move his taxes over to us and also has two siblings who are also high net worth individuals.   

I also brought up bookkeeping with him but Jared was planning a departure from NWM due to the high compliance and lack of flexibility to work with CPAs like us.  Seems like there's another RIA who is going to pay him some transition pay (which would be W2) and wanted to hire us to help him set all of that up.  

Seemed to me like an LLC set up but if he's looking to go full independent than the fees would be much higher.  He said he'd find some time to catch up with me on that front.  

On our side, I'll follow up with him and send him our fee schedules + some of our materials.  I'm also going to send him client requests to start gathering documents.

Hong texted me on Sunday (I'll add the text chain to the debrief) and she got a letter for a Worker's Comp Audit and asked if we do that.  She says she gets audited every year and has to pay $500 - $1,000 (also said "I can't afford that shit"?).. seems weird for a $1.5m company. 

She still hasn't filed 2023 taxes and said she's trying to get us over her info.  Let's hope she follows through this time.  She asked to amend after the audit is complete as well.  

I went and cleaned up all the Karbon contacts, Quickbooks, and Work items.  Also sent the instructions for her to sync her bank account with QuickBooks and also sent a request via ADP.   She said "they" set it up and she doesn't know the log in.  Not sure if "They" is ADP or someone at Giang Enterprises.  She said she had someone semi managing it but she's going to take over the reins.   

TBD on Taxes and Accounting Onboarding but on the Payroll Side.  We'll see what the lift is for the Payroll Clean Up but we'll have to get it cleaned up for the audit so they'll all be under the same project.  For the Worker's Comp audit, also researched pricing and said it's between $500 - $1,500 depending on industry.  I think our prices for Worker's Comp audits should be hourly or Fixed Fee for $1,500.  For this one, I think we list at $1,500 on the quote and discount down to $1,000 due to the bundling with the Payroll Onboarding and Payroll Services.  

Also going Vengage Proposal on this one!

column50:
Talked to Kayla who was a referral from Jared Tisher (NWM).  Kayla is a Recruiter who earns $192k salary, 20% bonus (she got a 120% multiplier in 2024) which was about $47k, and a bunch of RSUs from her company.  

Her husband is ex-arena football quarterback, Sean Brackett, who is a teacher at Waltham High School and also the head football coach.  He also is looking to start a virtual coaching class so she said it's a good time to find an accountant.  He makes about $85k in wages.  

They also have a rental property (condo) and they are looking to purchase another property soon.  She's also 9 months pregnant and due with their first kid (daughter) in 2 weeks.  Lots going on. 

She said she cashed in about ~$85k in RSUs in 2024 and she gets a new tranche of RSUs every year so she wants to make sure she's doing it intelligently because she did not do that in 2024.  She cashed out tranches that had some ST and LT cap gains considerations and based on their income, their might be some AMT in there.  

She cashed them out related to diversifying from her financial planning with Tish but there's a lot of tax implications here so think this will be a good opportunity for us.  Also another Pro Athlete in the portfolio technically.  

Next steps are for client requests but think this will be a tax planning client (similar to the Beneweiss project).  I think we get paid on this one for "Tax Planning" and combo that with their return which is technically just a 1040.  

I'm also going to loop in D-Block on this one and get his feet wet.

column105:
Sally called me and we fucked up her tax return and didn't provide enough income for her to get approved.  

I promised her a review and scrub by EOW.  We'll also do the amendment for free due to our failures.

column13:
Accounting - Client Onboarding - Bookkeeping
Taxes - Business
Taxes - Individual
column18:
Had a good conversation with Matt after some phone tag.  He's a referral from 3PM and says he's good friends with Mitch who got him the loan to his house. 

Matt is a lobbyist in the Government & Public Affairs space so Election Season is his busy season.  He and a partner (Ellie Reynolds per their website) started the business 1/1/2024 but said they really started planning in 2023 and did the smart thing by getting help in order to set it up.  They set up the Business (Purple Label Government Solutions as a Partnership) that is owned by two SCorps (each of the partners respectively).  He said he told his Financial Advisor that they'd hope to do $500k in the first year and they're at $700k right now so pretty pretty good start.  

Matt said his side will be around $250k and his partners is the rest of it.  He said he's taken about $80-$90k in distributions to pay bills and I talked him through the mechanics of SE tax.  After that rizz he was basically ready to throw over the keys.  Bright dude and trying to do the right things but think he's missing some of the finer mechanics of it all (similar to the salary situation).  This will be his first year doing everything so it's all new to him and I think he's a bit green on the business, accounting, and tax side of the house.  He said all the bookkeeping is done on a spreadsheet because it's so minimal.  I doubt the last part a lot and think it's going to be shit show. 

He didn't take the intake form but said he would, the contact information as far as email address was made up so I can start the debrief form while I was on the call.  Next steps are for him to schedule an hour call because he said he wanted to walk us through everything.  The reason he reached out was to find a CPA and get all the stuff over to them before year end so they can start the tax process early.  This is my kind of client but we've also heard this story before.  

Once we get the docs, we can build a Vengage Proposal for all of these services because I think it'll be: 

(1) Partnership Return
(2) Two SCorps / 1040s (Partners)
(3) Bookkeeping for 3 entities
(4) Payroll for SCorps
(5) I doubt they did their BOIs so 3 of those

Thanks MITCHYYYY
